translations.text: [اى فرشتگان،] كسانى را كه ستم كردند- مشركان- و همانندانشان- همراهانشان از ديوان- گرد آوريد، و آنچه را مى‌پرستيدند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «کسانی را که ستم کرده‌اند و همردیفانشان و آنچه را می‌پرستیده‌اند.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Gather all the wicked together and their comrades, and those they had worshipped

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Gather all the unjust persons and their spouses, and all that they used to worship!” –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Muster those who did evil, their wives, and that they were serving,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Gather together those who did wrong and their comrades and that which they were wont to worship

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (It will be said to the angels): "Assemble those who did wrong, together with their companions (from the devils) and what they used to worship.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Gather those who did wrong, and their mates, and what they used to worship.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (Then will the command be given): “Muster all the wrong-doers and their spouses and the deities whom they used to serve

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (It will be said to the angels:) Assemble those who did wrong, together with their companions and what they used to worship,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: (And it is said unto the angels): Assemble those who did wrong, together with their wives and what they used to worship

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘Muster the wrongdoers and their mates and what they used to worship

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Gather together the evildoers, their wives, and that they were worshipping,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [The angels will be ordered], "Gather those who committed wrong, their kinds, and what they used to worship

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (God will command the angels), "Gather together the unjust, their spouses, and what they had worshipped

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Gather together those who were unjust and their associates, and what they used to worship

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ohshuroo allatheena thalamoo waazwajahum wama kanoo yaAAbudoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But We shall say, "Assemble those who did wrong together with their associates and what they worshipped

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Bring ye up", it shall be said, "The wrong-doers and their wives, and the things they worshipped-

verses.text: مِنْ‌ دُونِ‌ اللَّهِ‌ فَاهْدُوهُمْ‌ إِلَى‌ صِرَاطِ الْجَحِيمِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس همه را به سوی راه دوزخ راهنمایی کنید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: همه را به راه جهنم راه بنماييد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [آرى آنچه را] جز خدا [مى‌پرستيدند گرد آوريد] و به راه جهنم هدايتشان كنيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گِرد آوريد و به سوى راه جهنم رهبرى‌شان كنيد!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که به جز خدا می‌پرستیدند، و همه را به راه دوزخ راه نمایید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: غیر از خدا (هر چه را پرستش می‌کرده‌اند، همه را یکجا گرد آورید و) آن گاه آنان را به راه دوزخ راهنمائی کنید (تا بدان در آیند). [[«مِن دُونِ اللهِ»: غیر از خدا.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه به سوی راه جهنم راهنمایشان کنید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (آری آنچه را) جز خدا می‌پرستیدند جمع کنید و بسوی راه دوزخ هدایتشان کنید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: جز خدا پس رهبریشان کنید بسوی راه دوزخ‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: به جاى خدا، و آنها را به راه دوزخ راه نماييد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «غیر از خدا، گرد آورید و سوی راه مستقیم جهنّم رهبریشان کنید!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Other than God," (the angels will be told), "then show them the way to Hell,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Instead of Allah – and herd them to the path leading to hell.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: apart from God, and guide them unto the path of Hell!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Beside Allah, and lead them on to the path of the Flaming Fire.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Instead of Allah, and lead them on to the way of flaming Fire (Hell);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Besides God, and lead them to the way to Hell.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: apart from Allah, and direct them to the path of Hell,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Instead of Allah, and lead them on to the way of flaming Fire (Hell);

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Instead of Allah, and lead them to the path to hell;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: besides Allah, and show them the way to hell!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: other than Allah, and guide them to the Path of Hell!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Other than Allah, and guide them to the path of Hellfire

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: besides God, and show them the way of hell.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Besides Allah, then lead them to the way to hell.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Min dooni Allahi faihdoohum ila sirati aljaheemi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: besides God, and lead them to the path of the Fire;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Besides Allah, and lead them to the Way to the (Fierce) Fire!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آنان را نگه دارید که حتماً مورد بازپرسی قرار می گیرند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و نگه داريدشان، بايد بازخواست شوند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آنها را نگه داريد كه بازخواست خواهند شد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و بازداشتشان نماييد كه آنها مسؤولند!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (در موقف حساب) نگاهشان دارید که در کارشان سخت مسئولند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان را نگاه دارید که باید بازپرسی شوند (و از عقائد و اعمالشان پرسیده شود). [[«قِفُوهُمْ»: نگاهشان دارید. «مَسْؤُولُونَ»: پرسیدگان. بازخواست شوندگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و آنان را بازدارید که ایشان بازخواست کردنی هستند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها را نگهدارید که باید بازپرسی شوند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بازداشتشان کنید که ایشانند پرسش‌شدگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و بازداريدشان كه آنان پرسش خواهند شد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «و بازداشتشان نمایید، (که) آنان همواره مورد بازخواستند!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And detain them, for they will be questioned."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And stop them – they are to be questioned.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And halt them, to be questioned:

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And stop them; verily they are to be questioned:

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "But stop them, verily they are to be questioned.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And stop them. They are to be questioned.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and detain them there; they will be called to account.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But stop them, verily, they are to be questioned.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And stop them, for they must be questioned.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: [But first] stop them! For they must be questioned.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And halt them so that they may be questioned.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And stop them; indeed, they are to be questioned."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Stop them. They must be questioned."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And stop them, for they shall be questioned:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waqifoohum innahum masooloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and stop them there for questioning:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "But stop them, for they must be asked:

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [به آنان گویند:] شما را چه شده که یکدیگر را [برای رهایی از عذاب] یاری نمی دهید؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چرا يكديگر را يارى نمى‌كنيد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: شما را چه شده است كه يكديگر را يارى نمى‌كنيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: شما را چه شده است كه همديگر را يارى نمى‌كنيد؟!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (به آنان خطاب شود که) چرا شما (در دفع عذاب) به یکدیگر نصرت نمی‌کنید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (ای مشرکان!) شما چرا همدیگر را یاری نمی‌دهید (و در نجات هم نمی‌کوشید؟). [[«لا تَنَاصَرُونَ»: همدیگر را یاری نمی‌دهید. اصل آن (لا تَتَنَاصَرُونَ) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: شما را چه می‌شود که همدیگر را یاری نمی‌کنید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: شما را چه شده که از هم یاری نمی‌طلبید؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: چه شود شما را که همدیگر را یاری نکنید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: شما را چيست كه يكديگر را يارى نمى‌كنيد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «برایتان چیست [:چه بیماری است] (که) همدیگر را یاری نمی‌کنید؟!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "What is the matter with you that you do not help each other?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “What is the matter with you, that you do not help one another?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: "Why help you not one another?"

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: What aileth you that ye succour not one another?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "What is the matter with you? Why do you not help one another (as you used to do in the world)?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: What is the matter with you? Why do you not help one another?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: How is it that you are not helping one another?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "What is the matter with you Why do you not help one another"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: What aileth you that ye help not one another?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘Why is it that you do not support one another [today]?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'Why do you not help one another?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [They will be asked], "What is [wrong] with you? Why do you not help each other?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They will be asked, "Why do you not help each other?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: What is the matter with you that you do not help each other?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ma lakum la tanasaroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: 'But what is the matter with you that you cannot help one another?,'"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "'What is the matter with you that ye help not each other?'"

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [نه اینکه نمی توانند یکدیگر را یاری دهند] بلکه آنان امروز فروتنانه تسلیم [قدرت حق] هستند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نه، امروز همه تسليم‌شوندگانند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بلكه امروز آنها تسليم شدگانند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [نه!] بلكه امروز آنان از در تسليم درآمدگانند!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بلکه در این روز آنها همه سخت تسلیم و ذلیلند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بلکه آنان امروز کاملاً مطیع و تسلیمند. [[«مُسْتَسْلِمُونَ»: افراد منقاد و مطیع.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آری ایشان امروز تسلیم‌پیشه‌اند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ولی آنان در آن روز تسلیم قدرت خداوندند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بلکه ایشانند در آن روز تسلیم‌شدگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [نه،] بلكه آنها امروز [به عذاب خداى‌] گردن‌نهادگانند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بلکه امروز آنان به ناچار از دَر تسلیم درآمدگانند!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They will submit to questioning then,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: In fact this day they have all surrendered.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: No indeed; but today they resign themselves in submission

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Nay! on that Day they will be entirely submissive.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Nay, but that Day they shall surrender,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: In fact, on that Day, they will be submissive.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Indeed, today they are surrendering themselves completely.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Nay, but that Day they shall surrender.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nay, but this day they make full submission.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘Indeed, they are [meek and] submissive today!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: No, today they will resign themselves in submission,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But they, that Day, are in surrender.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: In fact, on that day they will be submissive.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Nay! on that day they shall be submissive.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Bal humu alyawma mustaslimoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: indeed, on that Day they will surrender themselves.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Nay, but that day they shall submit (to Judgment);

verses.text: وَ أَقْبَلَ‌ بَعْضُهُمْ‌ عَلَى‌ بَعْضٍ‌ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به یکدیگر رو کرده از هم می پرسند: [این چه وضعی است؟]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آنگاه روى به يكديگر كنند و بپرسند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و روى به يكديگر كنند و از هم بپرسند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و بعضى روى به بعضى ديگر مى‌آورند [و] از يكديگر مى‌پرسند!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و در آن هنگامه برخی از آنان به بعضی دیگر رو نموده (یعنی مرئوسین با رؤسا) سؤال و جواب کنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (در این حال) بعضی رو به بعضی می‌نمایند و همدیگر را بازخواست می‌کنند. [[«یَتَسَآءَلُونَ»: از همدیگر بازخواست می‌کنند. به گونه کشمکش و سرزنش از یکدیگر سؤالاتی می‌کنند و همدیگر را مقصّر وضع موجود قلمداد می‌نمایند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بعضی از آنان به بعضی دیگر به همپرسی روی آورند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (و در این حال) رو به یکدیگر کرده و از هم می‌پرسند...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و روی آورد برخی از ایشان به برخی پرسش‌کنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و برخى از ايشان بر برخى ديگر- پيروان و پيشوايان- روى كرده يكديگر را مى‌پرسند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بعضی روی به بعضی دیگر آوردند حال آنکه از یکدیگر می‌پرسند!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And some of them will confront the others,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And some of them inclined towards others, mutually questioning.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and advance one upon another, asking each other questions.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they will advance toward each other mutually questioning.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And they will turn to one another and question one another.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They will come to one another, questioning one another.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They will then turn towards each other (and start wrangling).

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And they will turn to one another and question one another.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And some of them draw near unto others, mutually questioning.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Some of them will turn to others, questioning each other.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and approach each other with questions,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they will approach one another blaming each other.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They will turn to each other saying,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And some of them shall advance towards others, questioning each other.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waaqbala baAAduhum AAala baAAdin yatasaaloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They will turn upon one another, and question one another.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And they will turn to one another, and question one another.

verses.text: قَالُوا إِنَّکُمْ‌ کُنْتُمْ‌ تَأْتُونَنَا عَنِ‌ الْيَمِينِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [پس پیروان گمراه به پیشوایان گمراه کننده] می گویند: همانا شما از راه خیرخواهی به سوی ما می آمدید، [ولی کارتان جز فریب و نیرنگ نبود!]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گويند: شما بوديد كه از در نيكخواهى بر ما درمى‌آمديد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گويند: [پس چه شد؟] شما كه از در نيكخواهى سراغ ما مى‌آمديد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [و] مى‌گويند: «شما [ظاهراً] از درِ راستى با ما درمى‌آمديد [و خود را حق به جانب مى‌نموديد]!»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: گویند: شما بودید که از سمت راست (و چپ برای فریب) ما می‌آمدید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (مستضعفان به مستکبران) می‌گویند: شما از راه خیرخواهی به سوی ما می‌آمدید (تا به ما ضربه بزنید و گمراهمان سازید). [[«عَنِ الْیَمِینِ»: از طریق خیرخواهی و دلسوزی. از راه دین. از راه قدرت. مراد این است که شما گفتید: ما خیرخواه شما هستیم، و آئینی که دارید حق است، و با زور وادار به گمراهیمان کردید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گویند شما بودید که "حق به جانب" به سراغ ما می‌آمدید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گروهی (می‌گویند: «شما رهبران گمراهی بودید که به ظاهر) از طریق خیرخواهی و نیکی وارد شدید امّا جز فریب چیزی در کارتان نبود)!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفتند همانا شما بودید می‌آمدید ما را از راست‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [پيروان به پيشوايان‌] گويند: شما بوديد كه از جانب راست- كه نشانه خير و نيكبختى مى‌پنداشتيم- بر ما درمى‌آمديد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (و) گویند: «شما (با باطنی دروغین) از درِ راستی با ما در می‌آمده‌اید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Saying: "It were you who imposed yourselves upon us."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They said, “It is you who used to come to us from our right, in order to sway.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: These say, 'Why, you of old would come to us from the right hand.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They will say: verily ye! ye were wont to come Unto us Imposing.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They will say: "It was you who used to come to us from the right side [i.e. from the right side of one of us and beautify for us every evil, order us for polytheism, and stop us from the truth i.e. Islamic Monotheism and from every good deed]."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They will say, “You used to come at us from the right.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (The followers will say to their leaders): “You used to come to us from the right hand.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They will say: "It was you who used to come to us from the right side."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They say: Lo! ye used to come unto us, imposing, (swearing that ye spoke the truth).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They will say, ‘Indeed you used to accost us peremptorily.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: saying: 'You used to come to us from the right hand'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They will say, "Indeed, you used to come at us from the right."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: "It was you who tried to mislead us from righteousness".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They shall say: Surely you used to come to us from the right side.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qaloo innakum kuntum tatoonana AAani alyameeni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They will say, "You used to come at us from the right."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They will say: "It was ye who used to come to us from the right hand (of power and authority)!"

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: می گویند: [ما را تقصیری نیست] بلکه خود شما اهل ایمان نبودید،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گويند: نه، شما ايمان نياورده بوديد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [مستكبران‌] مى‌گويند: [نه،] بلكه شما [خودتان‌] مؤمن نبوديد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [متّهمان‌] مى‌گويند: «[نه!] بلكه با ايمان نبوديد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آنها جواب دهند (که به ما مربوط نیست) بلکه شما خود ایمان نیاوردید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (مستکبران به مستضعفان در پاسخ) می‌گویند: بلکه خودتان بی‌ایمان و بی‌باور بودید (گناه ما چیست. بروید و خویشتن را سرزنش و نفرین کنید).

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گویند بلکه خود شما مؤمن نبودید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (آنها در جواب) می‌گویند: «شما خودتان اهل ایمان نبودید (تقصیر ما چیست)؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفتند بلکه نبودید شما گروندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [پيشوايان‌] گويند: [نه،] بلكه شما خود مؤمن نبوديد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گویند: « (نه!) بلکه خودتان باایمان نبوده‌اید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They will say: "No, you were the ones who would not believe.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They will answer, “You yourselves did not have faith!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Those say, 'No; on the contrary, you were not believers;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They will say: nay! ye yourselves were not believers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They will reply: "Nay, you yourselves were not believers.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They will say, “You yourselves were not believers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They will say: “Nay, you yourselves were not the ones who would believe.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They will reply: "Nay, you yourselves were not believers."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They answer: Nay, but ye (yourselves) were not believers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They will answer, ‘No, you [yourselves] had no faith.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But they reply: 'Rather, you were not believers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: The oppressors will say, "Rather, you [yourselves] were not believers,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Others will respond, "It was you who did not want to have any faith.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They shall say: Nay, you (yourselves) were not believers;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qaloo bal lam takoonoo mumineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They will say, "No! It was you who would not believe --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They will reply: "Nay, ye yourselves had no Faith!

verses.text: وَ مَا کَانَ‌ لَنَا عَلَيْکُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ سُلْطَانٍ‌ بَلْ‌ کُنْتُمْ‌ قَوْماً طَاغِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و ما را بر شما هیچ تسلطی نبود، بلکه شما مردمی طغیان گر و سرکش بودید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما را بر شما هيچ تسلطى نبود. شما خود مردمانى نافرمان بوديد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و ما را بر شما هيچ تسلطى نبود، بلكه شما خود مردمى طغيانگر بوديد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و ما را بر شما هيچ تسلطى نبود، بلكه خودتان سركش بوديد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما بر شما تسلط و حجتی نداشتیم بلکه شما خودتان طاغی و سرکش مردمی بودید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما که هیچ گونه سلطه و قدرتی بر شما نداشتیم (تا از شما سلب اختیار کنیم) بلکه خودتان مردمان سرکش و نافرمانی بودید (و بر حق و حقیقت شوریدید و به چنین روزی افتادید). [[«سُلْطَانٍ»: سلطه و قدرت. مراد زور و اجبار است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و ما را بر شما سلطه‌ای نبود، بلکه شما قومی سرکش بودید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما هیچ گونه سلطه‌ای بر شما نداشتیم، بلکه شما خود قومی طغیانگر بودید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نبود ما را بر شما فرمانروائی بلکه بودید شما گروهی گردنکشان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و ما را بر شما هيچ دستى و تسلطى نبود، بلكه شما خود گروهى سركش بوديد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «و ما را بر شما هیچ سلطه‌ای نبود، بلکه خودتان سرکش بوده‌اید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We had no power over you. In fact, you were a people rebellious.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And we did not have any control over you; but in fact you yourselves were rebellious.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: we had no authority over you; no, you were an insolent people.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And we had over you no authority, but ye were a people exorbitant.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "And we had no authority over you. Nay! But you were transgressing people (disobedient, polytheists, and disbelievers).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We had no authority over you. You yourselves were rebellious people.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We had no power over you. You were a rebellious people,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "And we had no authority over you. Nay! But you were a transgressing people."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: We had no power over you, but ye were wayward folk.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We had no authority over you. No, you [yourselves] were a rebellious lot.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We had no authority over you, but you were an insolent nation.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And we had over you no authority, but you were a transgressing people.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We had no authority over you, in fact, you were a rebellious people.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And we had no authority over you, but you were an inordinate people;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama kana lana AAalaykum min sultanin bal kuntum qawman tagheena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: we had no power over you; but you yourselves were a rebellious people.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Nor had we any authority over you. Nay, it was ye who were a people in obstinate rebellion!

verses.text: فَحَقَ‌ عَلَيْنَا قَوْلُ‌ رَبِّنَا إِنَّا لَذَائِقُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: اکنون فرمان عذاب پروردگارمان بر ما محقق و ثابت شد که همه ما چشندگان عذاب خواهیم بود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفته پروردگارمان بر ما ثابت شد. اكنون بايد بچشيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس وعده‌ى پروردگارمان بر ما محقق شد و اكنون بايد [عذاب را] بچشيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس فرمان پروردگارمان بر ما سزاوار آمد؛ ما واقعاً بايد [عذاب را] بچشيم!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس امروز بر همه ما وعده (انتقام) خدایمان حتمی است، و البته عذاب را خواهیم چشید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس عذاب پروردگارمان گریبانگیرمان شد، و ما باید آن را بچشیم. [[«فَحَقَّ عَلَیْنَا ...»: فرمان خدا درباره ما محقّق گشت که ما گمراهان باید روز قیامت عذاب را بچشیم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و حکم پروردگارمان در حق ما تحقق یافت، ما چشندگان [عذاب‌]ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: اکنون فرمان پروردگارمان بر همه ما مسلّم شده، و همگی از عذاب او می‌چشیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و راست آمد بر ما سخن پروردگار ما که مائیم همانا چشندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس گفتار پروردگارمان- وعده عذاب- بر ما سزا شد كه ما چشندگان عذابيم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «پس گفته‌ی پروردگارمان بر ما پابرجا و درست آمد؛ ما همواره بی‌چون چشنده‌ی عذابیم!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The sentence of our Lord has come true for us. We have certainly to taste (the punishment),

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “So the Word of our Lord has proved true upon us; we will surely have to taste (the punishment).”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So our Lord's Word is realised against us; we are tasting it.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So on us hath been justified the sentence of our Lord: verily we are to taste.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "So now the Word of our Lord has been justified against us, that we shall certainly (have to) taste (the torment).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: The Word of our Lord has been realized against us. We are tasting it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and so we became deserving of the Word of our Lord that we shall be made to suffer chastisement.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "So now the Word of our Lord has been justified against us, that we shall certainly taste (the torment)."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Now the Word of our Lord hath been fulfilled concerning us. Lo! we are about to taste (the doom).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So our Lord’s word became due against us that we shall indeed taste [the punishment].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: The statement of Our Lord is realized against us, and we are tasting it,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So the word of our Lord has come into effect upon us; indeed, we will taste [punishment].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Thus, the words of Our Lord about us have come true and now we are suffering the torment.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So the sentence of our Lord has come to pass against us: (now) we shall surely taste;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fahaqqa AAalayna qawlu rabbina inna lathaiqoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But now our Lord's word has come true against us: truly, we are bound to taste [the punishment].

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "So now has been proved true, against us, the word of our Lord that we shall indeed (have to) taste (the punishment of our sins).

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [سبک مغزی و تعصّب شما زمینه گمراهی شما شد] پس ما شما را گمراه کردیم؛ زیرا خودمان گمراه بودیم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما شما را گمراه كرديم و خود نيز گمراه بوديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس شما را گمراه كرديم، زيرا خودمان نيز گمراه بوديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و شما را گمراه كرديم، زيرا خودمان گمراه بوديم!»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما شما را بدین سبب گمراه کردیم که خود گمراه بودیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما خودمان گمراه بودیم و شما را هم گمراه کردیم. [[«غَاوِینَ»: گمراهان (نگا: اعراف / 175، حجر / 42، شعراء / 91 و 94).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه شما را گمراه کردیم، ما خود هم گمراه بودیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما شما را گمراه کردیم، همان گونه که خود گمراه بودیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس گمراهتان کردیم که بودیم ما گمراهان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: شما را گمراه كرديم زيرا كه خود گمراه بوديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «پس شما را گمراه کردیم، (زیرا) بی‌گمان خودمان (هم) گمراه بوده‌ایم!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: For we had led you astray. In fact we ourselves were astray."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “We therefore led you astray, for we ourselves were astray!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Therefore we perverted you, and we ourselves were perverts.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: We seduced you astray; verily we were ourselves the seduced ones.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "So we led you astray because we were ourselves astray."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We seduced you. We were seducers.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So we led you astray; we ourselves were strayed.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "So we led you astray because we were ourselves astray."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thus we misled you. Lo! we were (ourselves) astray.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So we perverted you, for we were perverse [ourselves].’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: we perverted you, indeed, we were perverts'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And we led you to deviation; indeed, we were deviators."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We mislead you and we ourselves had also gone astray."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So we led you astray, for we ourselves were erring.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faaghwaynakum inna kunna ghaweena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We led you astray as we were ourselves astray."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "We led you astray: for truly we were ourselves astray."

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس بی تردید همه 2آنان در آن روز در عذاب شریک اند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در آن روز، همه در عذاب شريكند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس بى‌ترديد [همه‌] ايشان در آن روز در عذاب مشتركند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس، در حقيقت، آنان در آن روز در عذاب شريك يكديگرند!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و در آن روز آنها همه در عذاب مشترکند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در نتیجه آنان در آن زمان (همگی، اعم از راهبران و پیروان) در عذاب، با یکدیگر و مشترکند. [[«مُشْتَرِکُونَ»: با یکدیگر اشتراک دارند. با همدیگرند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه ایشان در چنین روزی در عذاب مشترکند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (آری) همه آنها [= پیشوایان و پیروان گمراه‌] در آن روز در عذاب الهی مشترکند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس آنانند در آن روز در عذاب شریک‌شدگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس بى‌گمان همه ايشان در آن روز در عذاب شريكند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: در نتیجه، آنان در آن روز بی‌چون در (ژرفای) عذاب شریک یکدیگرند!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So, they will become partners in punishment.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So this day they all are partners in the punishment.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So all of them on that day are sharers in the chastisement.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So verily on that Day they all in the torment will be sharers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then verily, that Day, they will (all) share in the torment.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: On that Day, they will share in the punishment.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: On that Day, they will all share the chastisement.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then verily, that Day, they will (all) share in the torment.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then lo! this day they (both) are sharers in the doom.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So, that day they will share the punishment.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Therefore, on that Day they will all share Our punishment.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So indeed they, that Day, will be sharing in the punishment.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: On that day they will all share the torment.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So they shall on that day be sharers in the chastisement one with another.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fainnahum yawmaithin fee alAAathabi mushtarikoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: On that Day they will all share the punishment:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Truly, that Day, they will (all) share in the Penalty.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: ما با مجرمان این گونه رفتار می کنیم؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما با مجرمان چنين مى‌كنيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [آرى‌] ما با مجرمان چنين مى‌كنيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [آرى،] ما با مجرمان چنين رفتار مى‌كنيم!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ما چنین از بد کاران انتقام می‌کشیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما این گونه با بزهکاران رفتار می‌کنیم. [[«کَذلِکَ نَفْعَلُ بِالْمُجْرِمِینَ»: با همه بزهکاران تاریخ چنین می‌کنیم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ما با گناهکاران چنین می‌کنیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما این گونه با مجرمان رفتار می‌کنیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا ما بدینسان کنیم با گنهکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا ما با بزهكاران- مشركان- چنين مى‌كنيم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (آری،) ما به‌راستی با مجرمان چنان می‌کنیم!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: That is how We deal with sinners.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: This is how We deal with the guilty.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Even so We do with the sinners;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily We! in this wise We deal with the culprits.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Certainly, that is how We deal with Al-Mujrimun (polytheists, sinners, criminals, the disobedient to Allah, etc.).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Thus We deal with the sinners.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Thus do We treat the culprits.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Certainly, that is how We deal with the criminals.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! thus deal We with the guilty.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed, that is how We deal with the guilty.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: As such We shall deal with the evildoers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, that is how We deal with the criminals.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: This is how We deal with the criminals.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely thus do We deal with the guilty.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna kathalika nafAAalu bialmujrimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: that is how We deal with evil-doers.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Verily that is how We shall deal with Sinners.

verses.text: إِنَّهُمْ‌ کَانُوا إِذَا قِيلَ‌ لَهُمْ‌ لاَ إِلٰهَ‌ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ‌ يَسْتَکْبِرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: زیرا آنان چنین بودند که هر زمان به آنان می گفتند: معبودی جز خدا نیست، تکبّر می کردند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون به آنان گفته مى‌شد كه جز خداى يكتا خدايى نيست تكبر مى‌كردند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: چرا كه آنان بودند كه وقتى به ايشان گفته مى‌شد: خدايى جز خداى يگانه نيست تكبر مى‌ورزيدند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: چرا كه آنان بودند كه وقتى به ايشان گفته مى‌شد: «خدايى جز خداى يگانه نيست»، تكبر مى‌ورزيدند!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آنها بودند که چون لا اله الاّ اللّه (کلمه توحید) به ایشان گفته می‌شد (از قبول آن) سرکشی می‌کردند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (چرا که) وقتی که بدانان گفته می‌شد: جز خدا معبودی نیست، بزرگی می‌نمودند (و خویشتن را بالاتر از آن می‌دیدند که یکتاپرستی را بپذیرند). [[«یَسْتَکْبِرُونَ»: (نگا: بقره / 34 و 87، نساء / 173).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: اینان چنان بودند که چون به آنان [کلمه‌] لا اله الا الله گفته می‌شد، استکبار می‌ورزیدند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: چرا که وقتی به آنها گفته می‌شد: «معبودی جز خدا وجود ندارد»، تکبّر و سرکشی می‌کردند...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که بودند گاهی که گفته می‌شد بدیشان نیست خدائی جز خدا کبر می‌ورزیدند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنان بودند كه چون به آنها گفته مى‌شد خدايى جز خداى يكتا نيست بزرگ‌منشى و گردنكشى مى‌كردند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بی‌گمان همانان بودند (که) وقتی به ایشان گفته می‌شد: «خدایی جز خدای یگانه نیست‌» بزرگ‌خواهی می‌کردند (و سر باز می‌زدند).

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They were those who, when it was said to them, "There is no god but God," behaved with insolence,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed, when it was said to them, “There is no God except Allah”, they were haughty.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: for when it was said to them, 'There is no god but God,' they were ever waxing proud,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily when it was said Unto them: there is no god but Allah, they ever grew stiff-necked.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Truly, when it was said to them: La ilaha ill-Allah "(none has the right to be worshipped but Allah)," they puffed themselves up with pride (i.e. denied it).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: When it was said to them, “There is no god except God,” they grew arrogant.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Whenever it was said to them: “There is no true deity apart from Allah,” they waxed proud

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Truly, when it was said to them: "La ilaha illallah," they puffed themselves up with pride.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: For when it was said unto them, There is no Allah save Allah, they were scornful

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed, it was they who, when they were told, ‘There is no god except Allah,’ used to be disdainful,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: For when it was said to them: 'There is no god except Allah' they were always proud

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed they, when it was said to them, "There is no deity but Allah," were arrogant

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They were the ones, who on being told, "God is only One," become puffed-up with pride

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely they used to behave proudly when it was said to them: There is no god but Allah;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Innahum kanoo itha qeela lahum la ilaha illa Allahu yastakbiroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: When they were told, "There is no deity but God," they turned away with disdain,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: For they, when they were told that there is no god except Allah, would puff themselves up with Pride,

verses.text: وَ يَقُولُونَ‌ أَ إِنَّا لَتَارِکُوا آلِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٍ مَجْنُونٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [همواره] می گفتند: آیا باید به خاطر شاعری دیوانه معبودان خود را رها کنیم؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و مى‌گفتند: آيا به خاطر شاعر ديوانه‌اى خدايانمان را ترك گوييم؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و مى‌گفتند: آيا ما خدايان خويش را براى گفته شاعرى مجنون رها كنيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و مى‌گفتند: «آيا ما براى شاعرى ديوانه دست از خدايانمان برداريم؟!»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و می‌گفتند: آیا ما به خاطر شاعر دیوانه‌ای دست از خدایان خود برداریم؟!

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و می‌گفتند: آیا ما برای (سخن) چکامه‌سرای دیوانه‌ای، معبودهای خویش را رها سازیم؟! [[«شَاعِرٍ»: مرادشان - زَادَهُمُ اللهُ عَذاباً - پیغمبر گرامی اسلام بود. «شَاعِرٍ مَّجْنُونٍ»: این سخن، ضدّ و نقیض است. چرا که شاعر برعکس دیوانه از روی اندیشه که زاده خرد است سخن می‌گوید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و می‌گفتند آیا ما رهاکننده خدایانمان به خاطر شاعری دیوانه باشیم؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و پیوسته می‌گفتند: «آیا ما معبودان خود را بخاطر شاعری دیوانه رها کنیم؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و می‌گفتند آیا ما رها کنیم خدایان خویش را برای شاعری دیوانه‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و مى‌گفتند: آيا ما از بهر شاعرى ديوانه دست از خدايان خويش بداريم!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و گویند: «آیا ما به‌راستی برای شاعری دیوانه دست از خدایانمان برداریم‌؟!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And said: "Should we abandon our gods for the sake of an insane poet?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And they used to say, “Shall we forsake our Gods upon the sayings of a mad poet?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: saying, 'What, shall we forsake our gods for a poet possessed?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they said: are we going to abandon our gods on account of a Poet distracted?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And (they) said: "Are we going to abandon our aliha (gods) for the sake of a mad poet?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And said, “Are we to abandon our gods for a mad poet?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and said: “Shall we forsake our deities for the sake of a distracted poet?”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And (they) said: "Are we going to abandon our gods for the sake of a mad poet"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And said: Shall we forsake our gods for a mad poet?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and [they would] say, ‘Shall we abandon our gods for a crazy poet?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and said: 'Are we to renounce our gods for the sake of a mad poet'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And were saying, "Are we to leave our gods for a mad poet?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and said, "Should we give up our idols for the sake of an insane poet".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And to say: What! shall we indeed give up our gods for the sake of a mad poet?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wayaqooloona ainna latarikoo alihatina lishaAAirin majnoonin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and replied, "Shall we then give up our deities at the bidding of a mad poet?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And say: "What! shall we give up our gods for the sake of a Poet possessed?"

verses.text: بَلْ‌ جَاءَ بِالْحَقِ‌ وَ صَدَّقَ‌ الْمُرْسَلِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [چنین نیست که می پندارید] بلکه او حق را آورده و پیامبران را تصدیق کرده است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نه، آن پيامبر حق را آورد و پيامبران پيشين را تصديق كرد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بلكه او حق را آورده و پيامبران را تصديق كرده است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: ولى نه! [او] حقيقت را آورده و فرستادگان را تصديق كرده است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (چنین نیست که آنها پنداشتند) بلکه (محمّد صلی الله علیه و آله پیغمبر بزرگی است که برای تعلیم و هدایت خلق عالم) با برهان روشن حق آمد و (حجت و معجزاتش) صدق پیغمبران پیشین را نیز اثبات کرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (امّا او شاعر و مجنون نیست و) بلکه حق را آورده و پیغمبران را تصدیق کرده است. (محتوای دعوت محمّد و هماهنگی آن با دعوت انبیاء، دلیل صدق گفتار او است). [[«الْحَقِّ»: مراد آئین اسلام است که عین حقیقت است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: حق این است که او [پیامبر] حق را به میان آورد و پیامبران [پیشین‌] را تصدیق کرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: چنین نیست، او حقّ را آورده و پیامبران پیشین را تصدیق کرده است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بلکه آمد به راستی و تصدیق کرد به فرستادگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بلكه [آن پيامبر] به حق آمد- يا حق را آورد- و [ديگر] پيامبران را باور داشت.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بلکه تمامی حق (حقیقت) را آورده و فرستادگان (خدا) را تصدیق نموده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Not in the least. He has brought the truth and confirmed the other messengers.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: In fact he has brought the Truth, and testified for the Noble Messengers!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: 'No indeed; but he brought the truth, and confirmed the Envoys.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Aye! he hath come with the truth, and he confesseth to the sent ones.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Nay! he (Muhammad SAW) has come with the truth (i.e. Allah's Religion - Islamic Monotheism and this Quran) and he confirms the Messengers (before him who brought Allah's religion - Islamic Monotheism).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: In fact, he came with the truth, and he confirmed the messengers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (They say so although) he brought the Truth and confirmed the veracity of the Messengers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Nay! he has come with the truth and he confirms the Messengers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nay, but he brought the Truth, and he confirmed those sent (before him).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed, he has brought [them] the truth, and confirmed the [earlier] apostles.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: No, indeed, he has brought the truth, and confirmed the Messengers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Rather, the Prophet has come with the truth and confirmed the [previous] messengers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: In fact, he had brought them the truth and had acknowledged the Messengers (who were sent before him).

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Nay: he has come with the truth and verified the apostles.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Bal jaa bialhaqqi wasaddaqa almursaleena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: "Surely, he has brought the truth, confirming those who were sent before;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Nay! he has come with the (very) Truth, and he confirms (the Message of) the messengers (before him).

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید شما [کوردلان] عذاب دردناک را خواهید چشید،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: شما عذاب دردآور را خواهيد چشيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بى‌ترديد، شما چشنده‌ى عذاب دردناك خواهيد بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در واقع، شما عذاب پر درد را خواهيد چشيد!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: شما (که او را تکذیب کردید امروز) عذاب سخت و دردناک خواهید چشید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: شما (ای مشرکان کوردل!) قطعاً عذاب دردناک (الهی) را خواهید چشید.

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: شما چشندگان عذاب دردناکید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: اما شما (مستکبران کوردل) بطور مسلّم عذاب دردناک (الهی) را خواهید چشید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که شمائید همانا چشندگان عذاب دردناک‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هر آينه شما چشنده عذاب دردناك خواهيد بود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بی‌چون، شما همی چشنده‌ی عذابی پر درد هستید!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: You will indeed taste a painful punishment,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “You surely have to taste the painful punishment.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Now certainly you shall be tasting the painful chastisement,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily ye are going to taste a torment afflictive.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, you (pagans of Makkah) are going to taste the painful torment;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Most assuredly, you will taste the painful punishment.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (They will be told): “You shall taste the grievous chastisement.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, you are going to taste the painful torment;

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! (now) verily ye taste the painful doom -

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed you will taste the painful punishment,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: You shall certainly taste the painful punishment:

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, you [disbelievers] will be tasters of the painful punishment,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (They will be told), "You will certainly suffer the painful torment

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Most surely you will taste the painful punishment.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Innakum lathaiqoo alAAathabi alaleemi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: you shall surely taste the painful punishment,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Ye shall indeed taste of the Grievous Penalty;-

verses.text: وَ مَا تُجْزَوْنَ‌ إِلاَّ مَا کُنْتُمْ‌ تَعْمَلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و جز آنچه که همواره انجام می دادید، پاداش داده نمی شوید،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: جز در برابر اعمالتان كيفر نخواهيد ديد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و جز در برابر آنچه مى‌كرديد جزا نمى‌يابيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و جز آنچه مى‌كرديد جزا نمى‌يابيد!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و جز به کردارتان مجازات نمی‌شوید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و جز در برابر کارهائی که می‌کرده‌اید کیفر داده نمی‌شوید. [[«مَا تُجْزَوْنَ ...»: (نگا: یس / 54).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و جز بر حسب آنچه کرده‌اید، جزا نمی‌یابید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و جز به آنچه انجام می‌دادید کیفر داده نمی‌شوید،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و کیفر نشوید جز آنچه بودید می‌کردید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و جز آنچه مى‌كرديد پاداش داده نشويد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و جز آنچه می‌کرده‌اید جزا نمی‌یابید!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And be rewarded but only for what you had done,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And you will not be compensated except for your deeds.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and not be recompensed, except according to what you were doing.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And ye shall be required not except for that which ye have been doing;

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And you will be requited nothing except for what you used to do (evil deeds, sins, and Allah's disobedience which you used to do in this world);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And you will be repaid only for what you used to do.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: You will only be recompensed according to your deeds.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And you will be requited nothing except for what you used to do.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Ye are requited naught save what ye did -

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and you will be requited only for what you used to do

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: but you shall not be recompensed except for what you were doing.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and will be recompensed only for what you deserve.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And you shall not be rewarded except (for) what you did.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama tujzawna illa ma kuntum taAAmaloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and be rewarded only according to your deeds."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But it will be no more than the retribution of (the Evil) that ye have wrought;-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: جز بندگان خالص شده خدا [که از هر کیفری در امانند،]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مگر بندگان مخلص خدا،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مگر بندگان خالص شده‌ى خدا

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مگر بندگان پاكدل خدا!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (امروز همه مسئولند) جز بندگان پاک برگزیده خدا.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مگر بندگان مخلص خدا (که پروردگارشان از کیفر لغزشهایشان می‌گذرد، و پاداش مضاعف ده تا هفت صد برابر کردار نیکشان و گاهی افزون بر آن، بدیشان عطاء می‌فرماید). [[«مُخْلَصِینَ»: افراد پاک و بی‌آلایش. کسانی که خداوند ایشان را از نقائص پاکیزه و پالوده کرده است و تمام همّ و غمّ خود را صرف طاعت خدا نموده‌اند (نگا: یوسف / 24، ص / 46).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: مگر بندگان اخلاص یافته خداوند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: جز بندگان مخلص خدا (که از این کیفرها برکنارند)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: مگر بندگان خدا را ناآلودگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مگر بندگان ويژه و برگزيده خداى،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: مگر بندگان پاک شده‌ی (از طرف) خدا!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Except the chosen creatures of God,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Except the chosen bondmen of Allah.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Except for God's sincere servants;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: But the bondmen of Allah, the sincere ones -

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Save the chosen slaves of Allah (faithful, obedient, true believers of Islamic Monotheism).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Except for God’s sincere servants.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But Allah's chosen servants (shall be spared this woeful end).

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Save the chosen servants of Allah.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Save single-minded slaves of Allah;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: —[all] except Allah’s exclusive servants.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But for the sincere worshipers of Allah,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But not the chosen servants of Allah.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: But the sincere servants of God

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Save the servants of Allah, the purified ones.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Illa AAibada Allahi almukhlaseena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But the chosen servants of God;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But the sincere (and devoted) Servants of Allah,-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: برای آنان رزق و روزی معین و ویژه ای است،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كه آنها راست رزقى معين،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه آنها رزقى معين دارند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنان روزىِ معيّن خواهند داشت.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آنان را (در بهشت ابد) روزی جسمانی و روحانی (بی حساب) معیّن است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ایشان را روزیِ ویژه و معیّنی است. [[«مَعْلُومٌ»: مشخّص. ویژه. یعنی دارای صفات مخصوص به خود. مراد مواهب توصیف ناشدنی و غیرقابل درک بهشت است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: اینان روزی معین دارند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: برای آنان [= بندگان مخلص‌] روزی معیّن و ویژه‌ای است،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که آنان را است روزیی دانسته‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه ايشان راست روزى معلوم،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: ایشان برایشان روزی‌ای معلوم است؛

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Whose provision is predetermined --

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: For them is the sustenance known to Us.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: for them awaits a known provision,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Those! theirs shall be a provision known:

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: For them there will be a known provision (in Paradise).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: For them is a known provision.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: For them awaits a known provision,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: For them there will be a known provision,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: For them there is a known provision,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: For such there is a known provision

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: there is waiting for them a known provision;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Those will have a provision determined -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: will have their determined sustenance

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: For them is a known sustenance,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Olaika lahum rizqun maAAloomun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: shall have a known provision --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: For them is a Sustenance determined,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: میوه هایی [گوناگون] در حالی که مورد اکرام خواهند بود،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: از ميوه‌ها، و گرامى داشتگانند؛

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [انواع‌] ميوه‌ها و آنها گرامى داشتگانند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [انواع‌] ميوه‌ها! و آنان مورد احترام خواهند بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: میوه‌های گوناگون بهشتی، و هم آنها (در آن عالم جاودانی) بزرگوار و محترمند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یعنی میوه‌های رنگارنگ. و آنان مکرّم و معزّزند (و با نهایت احترام از ایشان پذیرائی می‌گردد). [[«فَوَاکِهُ»: بدل از (رزق) است. تنکیر آن دالّ بر وفور و مرغوبیّت است. «مُکْرَمُونَ»: اشاره به این است که همچون حیوانات، آذوقه در مقابل آنان ریخته نمی‌شود، بلکه همچون مهمانان عزیزی، از ایشان پذیرائی می‌گردد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: انواع میوه‌ها، و خود گرامیانند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: میوه‌ها (ی گوناگون پر ارزش)، و آنها گرامی داشته می‌شوند...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: میوه‌هائی و آنانند گرامی‌داشتگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: ميوه‌ها [از هر گونه‌]، و ايشان گرامى‌داشتگان و نواختگانند،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (از انواع) میوه‌ها! حال آنکه آنان گرامی‌شدگانند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Fruits of every kind, and they will be honoured

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Fruits; and they will be honoured.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: fruits -- and they high-honoured

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Fruits! And they shall be honoured.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Fruits; and they shall be honoured,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Fruits; and they will be honored.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: a variety of delicious fruits; and they shall be honoured

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Fruits; and they shall be honored,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Fruits. And they will be honoured

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: —fruits—and they will be held in honour,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: fruits. And they are receivers of generosity

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Fruits; and they will be honored

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and fruits while they are honored.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Fruits, and they shall be highly honored,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fawakihu wahum mukramoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: fruits of various kinds; and they shall be honoured,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Fruits (Delights); and they (shall enjoy) honour and dignity,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در بهشت های پر نعمت،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در بهشتهاى پرنعمت،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: در باغ‌هاى پرنعمت

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در باغهاى پر نعمت!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در آن بهشت پر نعمت متنعّمند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در میان باغها و بوستانهای پر نعمت بهشت بسر می‌برند. [[«جَنَّاتِ النَّعِیمِ»: (نگا: مائده / 65، یونس / 9، حجّ / 56، لقمان / 8).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: در بهشتهای پرناز و نعمت‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: در باغهای پر نعمت بهشت؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: در باغستان نعمتها

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: در بهشتهاى پر نعمت

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: در باغ‌های (پر) نعمت!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: In gardens of delight,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: In Gardens of peace.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: in the Gardens of Bliss

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: In Gardens of Delight.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: In the Gardens of delight (Paradise),

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: In the Gardens of Bliss.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: in the Gardens of Bliss.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: In the Gardens of Delight,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: In the Gardens of delight,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: in the gardens of bliss,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: in the Gardens of Delight,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: In gardens of pleasure

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (They will live) in the bountiful gardens,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: In gardens of pleasure,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fee jannati alnnaAAeemi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: in the Gardens of Bliss,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: In Gardens of Felicity,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در حالی که بر تخت هایی روبه روی یکدیگر [تکیه زده اند،]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بر تختهايى كه رو به روى هم‌اند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بر تخت‌هايى رو به روى هم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بر سريرها در برابر همديگر [مى‌نشينند].

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بر تختهای عالی رو به روی یکدیگر نشسته‌اند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بالای تختهای آراسته و مزیّن، روبه‌روی یکدیگر می‌نشینند. [[«سُرُرٍ»: جمع سَریر، تختها. «مُتَقَابِلِینَ»: روبه‌روی همدیگر. حال (هُمْ) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بر روی تختها، رو به روی همدیگر

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: در حالی که بر تختها رو به روی یکدیگر تکیه زده‌اند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بر تختهائی روی به روی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بر تختهايى روياروى هم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (تکیه‌زنان) بر تخت‌هایی در حالی‌که برابر یکدیگرند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: (Sitting) on couches, face to face,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Facing one another on thrones.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: upon couches, set face to face,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: On couches, facing one another.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Facing one another on thrones,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: On furnishings, facing one another.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They will be seated upon couches set face to face;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Facing one another on thrones.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: On couches facing one another;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: [reclining] on couches, facing one another,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: sitting face to face upon couches,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: On thrones facing one another.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: on couches facing each other.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: On thrones, facing each other.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: AAala sururin mutaqabileena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: seated on couches, facing one another.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Facing each other on Thrones (of Dignity):

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: جامی از نوشیدنی زلال و پاک گرداگردشان می گردانند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و جامى از چشمه خوشگوار ميانشان به گردش درآيد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: جامى از شراب طهور بر آنان مى‌گردانند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: با جامى از باده ناب پيرامونشان به گردش درمى‌آيند؛

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (حور و غلمان) با جام شراب طهور بر آنان دور می‌زنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: قدحهای می برگرفته از رودبار جاری شراب، گرداگرد آنان در گردش است. [[«کَأْسٍ»: قدح شراب. مراد از واژه کأس در قرآن، خود شراب است. «مَعِین»: جاری. رودبار روان. مراد چشمه‌سار جاری شراب است که بیانگر فراوانی و بی‌دردسری نگاهداری در خُمره‌ها و بی‌زحمتِ تهیّه و خرید و فروش، و مصون از کهنگی و تباهی است (نگا: واقعه / 18).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: برای آنان جامی از شرابی جاری بگردانند [و پیش آرند]

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و گرداگردشان قدحهای لبریز از شراب طهور را می‌گردانند؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گردانیده شود بر ایشان جامی از باده پدیدار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: جامى از نوشيدنى پاكيزه بر آنان مى‌گردانند،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: با جامی از نوشابه‌ای روان (که) پیرامونشان به گردش می‌آید؛

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: With cups from a flowing stream being passed around,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Cups of wine will be presented to them in rounds, from a spring flowing in front of them.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: a cup from a spring being passed round to them,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
