translations.text: Round shall be passed a cup Unto them filled with limpid drink:

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Round them will be passed a cup of pure wine;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They will be offered a cup of pure drink.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: a cup filled with wine from its springs, will be passed around to them;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Round them will be passed a cup of pure wine

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: A cup from a gushing spring is brought round for them,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: served around with a cup, from a clear fountain,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: a goblet from a spring shall be passed round to them

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: There will be circulated among them a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They will be served with a cup full of crystal clear wine,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: A bowl shall be made to go round them from water running out of springs,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Yutafu AAalayhim bikasin min maAAeenin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: A drink will be passed round among them from a flowing spring:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Round will be passed to them a Cup from a clear-flowing fountain,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [نوشیدنی] سپید [و درخشنده] و لذت بخش برای نوشندگان،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: سفيد است و نوشندگانش را لذت‌بخش،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: شرابى سپيد و روشن كه براى نوشندگان لذّت بخش است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [باده‌اى‌] سخت سپيد كه نوشندگان را لذتى [خاص‌] مى‌دهد؛

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: شرابی سپید و روشن که آشامندگان لذت کامل برند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: می سفیدرنگ و خوشگواری برای نوشندگان. [[«بَیْضَآءُ»: سفید رنگ. صفت (کَأْسٍ) است. «لَذَّةٍ»: لذیذ. خوشگوار. این واژه مؤنّث (لَذّ) به معنی (لذیذ) و یا این که مصدر است و برای مبالغه به عنوان وصف به کار رفته است. صفتِ دوم (کَأْسٍ) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپید درخشان و لذت‌بخش آشامندگان‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: شرابی سفید و درخشنده، و لذّتبخش برای نوشندگان؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تابناکی خوشکامی برای نوشندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سپيد و روشن، خوشگوار براى آشامندگان

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (که) سپید است و نوشندگان را لذّتی (خاص) می‌دهد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Clear, delicious to drink,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: White, delicious for the drinkers.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: white, a delight to the drinkers,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: White, a pleasure Unto the drinkers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: White, delicious to the drinkers,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: White; a delight to those who drink.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: white, sparkling (wine), a delight to the drinkers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: White, delicious to the drinkers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: White, delicious to the drinkers,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: snow-white, delicious to the drinkers,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: white, a delight to the drinkers,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: White and delicious to the drinkers;

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: delicious to those who drink it

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: White, delicious to those who drink.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Baydaa laththatin lilshsharibeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: white and delicious to those who drink it,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Crystal-white, of a taste delicious to those who drink (thereof),

verses.text: لاَ فِيهَا غَوْلٌ‌ وَ لاَ هُمْ‌ عَنْهَا يُنْزَفُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: نه در آن مایه فساد [جسم و عقل] است، و نه از آن مست و بیهوش می شوند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نه عقل از آن تباهى گيرد و نه نوشنده مست شود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: نه در آن تباهى عقل است و نه از آن مست مى‌شوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: نه در آن فساد عقل است و نه ايشان از آن به بدمستى [و فرسودگى‌] مى‌افتند!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: نه در آن می‌خمار و دردسری و نه مستی و مدهوشی است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: نه در آن تباهیها و گرفتاریهائی (همچون بیهوشی و سردرد و سایر مضرّات و مفاسد) است، و نه میخواران از آن به حالت تهوّع (و استفراغ و عرق و کثرت ادرار) در می‌آیند. [[«غَوْلٌ»: گرفتاریها و تباهیهائی همچون بیهوشی و خمار و زوال عقل. «عَنْهَا»: به سبب آن. واژه (عَنْ) مفید سببیّت است (نگا: توبه / 114، هود / 53). «یُنزَفُونَ»: نَزْف، به معنی بیرون کشیدن آب از چاه و مانند این است. در اینجا مراد تخلیه بدن از راه استفراغ و عرق کردن و بول زیاد است که میخواره دچار آن می‌شود (نگا: واقعه / 19).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: هیچ دردسری در آن نیست، و از آن مست نشوند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: شرابی که نه در آن مایه تباهی عقل است و نه از آن مست می‌شوند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نه در آن است مستی (بیهشی و یا رنجی) و نه آنانند از آن بازگرفتگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: نه در آن تباهى و بى‌خردى است و نه از آن مست شوند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: نه در آن هلاکتی ناخودآگاه است و نه ایشان از آن (از عقل) تهی می‌گردند!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Neither dulling the senses nor intoxicating,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Neither does it intoxicate, nor give a headache.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: wherein no sickness is, neither intoxication;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: No headiness there shall be therein, nor shall they be therewith Inebriated.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Neither they will have Ghoul (any kind of hurt, abdominal pain, headache, a sin, etc.) from that, nor will they suffer intoxication therefrom.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Never polluted, and never intoxicating.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: There will neither be any harm in it for their body nor will it intoxicate their mind.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Neither will they have Ghawl from that nor will they suffer intoxication therefrom.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Wherein there is no headache nor are they made mad thereby.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: wherein there will be neither headache nor will it cause them stupefaction,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: there is neither sickness in it, nor intoxication.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: No bad effect is there in it, nor from it will they be intoxicated.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: but not harmful or intoxicating.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: There shall be no trouble in it, nor shall they be exhausted therewith.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: La feeha ghawlun wala hum AAanha yunzafoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: causing no headiness or intoxication.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Free from headiness; nor will they suffer intoxication therefrom.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و در کنارشان زنانی هستند که فقط به شوهرانشان عشق می ورزند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: زنانى درشت چشم كه تنها به شوهران خود نظر دارند، همدم آنهايند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و در كنارشان دلبرانى درشت چشم است كه [به همسران خود] چشم دوزند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و نزدشان [دلبرانى‌] فروهشته‌نگاه و فراخ‌ديده باشند!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و در بزم حضورشان حوران زیبا چشمی است که (جز به شوهر خود) به هیچ کس ننگرند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: همسرانی دارند با چشمانی درشت و خمارآلود. [[«قَاصِرَاتُ الطَّرْفِ»: دارای چشمانی نیم نگاه. دارای چشمانی که تنها با آنها به شوهران زیبای خود نگاه می‌کنند و نه به دیگران، که کنایه از این است که آنان تنها به شوهران صاحب جمال خود عشق می‌ورزند و جز مهر ایشان را در دل ندارند. دارای چشمانی خمارآلود. «عِینٌ»: جمع عَیْناء، زنان درشت چشم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و نزد ایشان دوشیزگان چشم فروهشته [/قانع به همسر] درشت چشم هستند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و نزد آنها همسرانی زیبا چشم است که جز به شوهران خود عشق نمی‌ورزند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نزد ایشان است کوته‌مژگانی درشت‌چشمان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و نزد ايشان زنان ديده فروهشته درشت‌چشم باشند،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و در نزدشان (زنانی) با چشمان فروهشته‌ی درشتند!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And with them maidens of modest look and large lustrous eyes,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And with them are those who do not set gaze upon men except their husbands, the maidens with gorgeous eyes.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and with them wide-eyed maidens restraining their glances

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And with them shall be damsels of refraining looks, large- eyed

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And with them will be chaste females, restraining their glances (desiring none except their husbands), with wide and beautiful eyes.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: With them will be bashful women with lovely eyes.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Theirs shall be wide-eyed maidens with bashful, restrained glances,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And beside them will be Qasirat-At-Tarf with (wide and beautiful) eyes.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And with them are those of modest gaze, with lovely eyes,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and with them will be maidens, of restrained glances with big [beautiful] eyes,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And with them will be maidens (houris) who restrain their wide glances

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And with them will be women limiting [their] glances, with large, [beautiful] eyes,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They will have with them loving wives with big black and white eyes

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And with them shall be those who restrain the eyes, having beautiful eyes;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WaAAindahum qasiratu alttarfi AAeenun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: With them will be spouses, modest of gaze and beautiful of eye,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And besides them will be chaste women, restraining their glances, with big eyes (of wonder and beauty).

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گویا آنان [از سپیدی] تخم شترمرغی هستند که [زیر پر و بال] پوشیده شده اند [و هرگز دست کسی به آنان نرسیده است.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: همانند تخم مرغهايى دور از دسترس.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [سيمين تن‌] گويى تخم ماكيانند كه در پوشش نهاده‌اند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [از شدّت سپيدى‌] گويى تخم شتر مرغ [زير پَرَ]ند!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: گویی آن حوران (در سفیدی و لطافت) بیضه مکنونند [یعنی تخم شتر مرغ که بسیار خوشرنگ است و شتر مرغ آن را با پر خویش می‌پوشاند تا غبار بر آن ننشیند. (م)].

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: انگار آنان تخمهای (شترمرغ) هستند که (در زیر بال و پر شترمرغ) پنهان (از دید مردمان و گرد و غبار) باشند. [[«بَیْضٌ»: جمع بَیْضَة، تخم‌مرغ (البتّه هر گونه تخم‌مرغی). ولی در اینجا شاید مراد تخم شترمرغ است که عربها زنان زیبای سفیدپوست را از لحاظ صفا و شفّافیّت بدان تشبیه می‌کنند. «مَکْنُونٌ»: مستور و پنهان. مراد دور از دسترس بیگانگان و پوشیده در زیر بال و پر و زدوده از گرد و غبار. که اشاره به سفیدی و درخشندگی است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گویی ایشان بیضه‌های شتر مرغ نهفته‌اند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گویی از (لطافت و سفیدی) همچون تخم‌مرغهایی هستند که (در زیر بال و پر مرغ) پنهان مانده (و دست انسانی هرگز آن را لمس نکرده است)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گوئیا تُخمهای ماکیانند به پرده پوشیدگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه گويى تخمهاى شترمرغ‌اند پوشيده.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گویی ایشان به‌راستی تخمی پنهانند،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Like sheltered eggs in a nest.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: As if they were eggs, safely hidden.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: as if they were hidden pearls.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: As though they were eggs hidden.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (Delicate and pure) as if they were (hidden) eggs (well) preserved.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: As if they were closely guarded pearls.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: so delicate as the hidden peel under an egg's shell.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: as if they were Bayd Maknun.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: (Pure) as they were hidden eggs (of the ostrich).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: as if they were hidden ostrich eggs.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: as if they were hidden pearls.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: As if they were [delicate] eggs, well-protected.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: who are as chaste as sheltered eggs.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: As if they were eggs carefully protected.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Kaannahunna baydun maknoonun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: like closely guarded pearls.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: As if they were (delicate) eggs closely guarded.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس برخی از آنان به برخی دیگر رو کرده از [حال] یکدیگر می پرسند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: رو به يكديگر كنند و به گفت و گو پردازند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: رو به يكديگر كنند و از همديگر پرس و جو كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس برخى‌شان به برخى روى نموده و از همديگر پرس‌وجو مى‌كنند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در آنجا مؤمنان بعضی با بعضی به صحبت روی کنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بعضی (از این افراد مخلص) رو به بعضی دیگرمی‌کنند و از یگدیگر می‌پرسند (که حال چه احوالی دارند، و در دنیا چه می‌کردند و چه می‌دیدند؟!). [[«أَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ ...»: بعضی از بهشتیان رو به بعضی دیگر کنند و ...]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بعضی از آنان به بعضی دیگر به همپرسی روی آورند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (در حالی که آنها غرق گفتگو هستند) بعضی رو به بعضی دیگر کرده می‌پرسند...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و روی آورد برخی از ایشان به برخی پرسش‌کنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس برخى از ايشان- بهشتيان- پرسش‌كنان روى به برخى ديگر كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس برخیشان به برخی روی نموده، در حالی‌که از همدیگر پرس‌وجو می‌کنند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then one turned to the other in an enquiry.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So one among them turns to the other, questioning. –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They advance one upon another, asking each other questions.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then they will advance Unto each other, mutually questioning.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then they will turn to one another, mutually questioning.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then they will approach one another, questioning.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then some of them will turn to others, and will ask each other.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then they will turn to one another, mutually questioning.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And some of them draw near unto others, mutually questioning.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Some of them will turn to others, questioning each other.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They will go to one another asking each other questions.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They will turn to each other and ask questions.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then shall some of them advance to others, questioning each other.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faaqbala baAAduhum AAala baAAdin yatasaaloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They will turn to one another with questions:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then they will turn to one another and question one another.

verses.text: قَالَ‌ قَائِلٌ‌ مِنْهُمْ‌ إِنِّي‌ کَانَ‌ لِي‌ قَرِينٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گوینده ای از آنان می گوید: همانا من [در دنیا] هم نشینی داشتم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يكى از آنها گويد: مرا همنشينى بود،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گوينده‌اى از آنها مى‌گويد: راستى من [در دنيا] همنشينى داشتم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گوينده‌اى از آنان مى‌گويد: «راستى من [در دنيا] همنشينى داشتم،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: یکی از آنها گوید: (ای رفیقان بهشتی) مرا (در دنیا) همنشینی (کافر) بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یکی از آنان می‌گوید: من همنشینی (در دنیا) داشتم (که با من درباره‌ی دین و قوانین آسمانی مجادله می‌کرد). [[«قَرِینٌ»: همنشین. دوست.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گوینده‌ای از میان آنان گوید مرا [در دنیا] همنشینی بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: کسی از آنها می‌گوید: «من همنشینی داشتم...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت گوینده‌ای از ایشان که همانا بود مرا همنشینی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گوينده‌اى از ايشان گويد: همانا مرا [در دنيا] همنشينى بود،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گوینده‌ای از آنان گفت: «به‌راستی من (در دنیا) همنشینی داشتم،»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Said one of the speakers: "I had a friend

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The speaker among them said, “I had a companion.” –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: One of them says, 'I had a comrade

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And a speaker from among them will say: verily there was Unto me a mate.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: A speaker of them will say: "Verily, I had a companion (in the world),

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: One of them will say, “I used to have a friend.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: One of them will say: “I had a companion in the world

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: A speaker of them will say: "Verily, I had a companion (in the world),"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: A speaker of them saith: Lo! I had a comrade

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: One of them will say, ‘Indeed I had a companion

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: One of them will say: 'I had a companion

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: A speaker among them will say, "Indeed, I had a companion [on earth]

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: One of them will say, "I had a companion who asked me,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: A speaker from among them shall say: Surely I had a comrade of mine,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala qailun minhum innee kana lee qareenun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: one of them will say, "I had a friend,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: One of them will start the talk and say: "I had an intimate companion (on the earth),

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [که همواره از روی تعجب به من] می گفت: آیا تو از باور دارندگان [رستاخیز و زنده شدن مردگان] هستی؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كه مى‌گفت: آيا تو از آنها هستى كه تصديق مى‌كنند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [كه به من‌] مى‌گفت: آيا واقعا تو [هم‌] از باور دارندگانى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [كه به من‌] مى‌گفت: «آيا واقعاً تو از باوردارندگانى؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که با من می‌گفت: آیا تو (وعده‌های بهشت و قیامت را) باور می‌کنی؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: می‌گفت: آیا تو از زمره‌ی کسانی هستی که باور می‌کنند (به این که بعد از مرگ، زندگی و رستاخیزی، و حساب و کتابی، و سزا و جزائی در میان است؟). [[«الْمُصَدِّقِینَ»: تصدیق کنندگان. مؤمنان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که می‌گفت آیا تو [هم‌] از باور دارندگانی؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: که پیوسته می‌گفت: آیا (به راستی) تو این سخن را باور کرده‌ای...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: می گفت آیا توئی از راست پنداران (تصدیق‌کنندگان)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه مى‌گفت: آيا تو از باوردارندگانى- به رستاخيز-؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «(که به من) می‌گوید: آیا واقعاً تو بی‌گمان از تصدیق‌کنندگانی‌؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Who used to say: 'Are you one of those who can testify to the truth?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Who used to tell me, ‘Do you believe it is true?’ –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: who would say, "Are you a confirmer?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Who said: art thou of those who confess to the doctrine of Resurrection:

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Who used to say: "Are you among those who believe (in resurrection after death).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Who used to say, “Are you of those who believe?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: who used to say: -- Are you also one of those who confirm the Truth (of life after death)?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Who used to say: `Are you among those who believe.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Who used to say: Art thou in truth of those who put faith (in his words)?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: who used to say, ‘‘Are you really among those who affirm

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: who would say: "Are you among the believers (of the resurrection)?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Who would say, 'Are you indeed of those who believe

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: 'Do you believe in the Day of Judgment?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Who said: What! are you indeed of those who accept (the truth)?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Yaqoolu ainnaka lamina almusaddiqeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: who used to ask, 'Do you really believe that

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Who used to say, 'what! art thou amongst those who bear witness to the Truth (of the Message)?

verses.text: أَ إِذَا مِتْنَا وَ کُنَّا تُرَاباً وَ عِظَاماً أَ إِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا زمانی که ما مردیم و خاک استخوان شدیم، حتماً [زنده می شویم و] پاداشمان می دهند؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا آنگاه كه مُرديم و خاك و استخوان شديم، كيفرمان مى‌دهند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا وقتى مرديم و خاك و استخوان شديم آيا واقعا [زنده شده‌] مجازات مى‌شويم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا وقتى مُرديم و خاك و [مشتى‌] استخوان شديم، آيا واقعاً جزا مى‌يابيم؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا چون مردیم و استخوان ما خاک راه شد باز (زنده شویم و) پاداش و کیفری یابیم؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا زمانی که مُردیم و خاک و استخوان شدیم، آیا ما مورد بازخواست (از اعمال و اقوال خود) قرار می‌گیریم و سزا و جزا می‌بینیم؟!. [[«لَمَدِینُونَ»: جمع مَدِین، بازخواست و بازجوئی شدگان. پاداش و پادافره داده شدگان (نگا: واقعه / 86).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [به اینکه‌] آیا چون مردیم و خاک و استخوانها[ی پوسیده‌] شدیم، آیا ما جزا خواهیم یافت؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: که وقتی ما مُردیم و به خاک و استخوان مبدّل شدیم، (بار دیگر) زنده می‌شویم و جزا داده خواهیم شد؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا گاهی که مُردیم و شدیم خاکی و استخوانهائی آیا مائیم هر آینه کیفردادگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا چون بمرديم و خاك و استخوانى چند شديم، آيا ما را پاداش و كيفر مى‌دهند؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «آیا هنگامی (که) ما مردیم و خاک و استخوان‌هایی بودیم آیا بی‌چون ما به‌درستی جزا یافتگانیم‌؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: (Do you think) we would be paid back our due when we are dead and reduced to dust and bones?'

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: ‘That when we are dead and have turned into dust and bones, that we will either be rewarded or punished?’”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What, when we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we indeed be requited?"

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: When we are dead and have become dust and bones, are we indeed going to be requited?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "(That) when we die and become dust and bones, shall we indeed (be raised up) to receive reward or punishment (according to our deeds)?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: That after we die and become dust and bones, we will be called to account?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: After we are dead and have become all dust and bones shall we still be requited?'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (That) when we die and become dust and bones, shall we indeed be indebted (Madinun)"'

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Can we, when we are dead and have become mere dust and bones - can we (then) verily be brought to book?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: that when we have died and become dust and bones, we shall be brought to retribution?’’ ’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: When we are dead and turned to dust and bones, shall we be recompensed?"

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: That when we have died and become dust and bones, we will indeed be recompensed?'"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Shall we be recompensed for our deeds after we die and become bones and dust?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: What! when we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then be certainly brought to judgment?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Aitha mitna wakunna turaban waAAithaman ainna lamadeenoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: after we die and become dust and bones, we shall be brought to judgement?'"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "'When we die and become dust and bones, shall we indeed receive rewards and punishments?'"

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [سپس به دوستان بهشتی خود] می گوید: آیا شما با من به دوزخ سر می کشید [تا از هم نشینم خبری بگیرید که در کجا و در چه حالی است؟]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گويد: مى‌توانيد از بالا بنگريد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گويد: آيا شما سر بلند مى‌كنيد ببينيد [او كجاست‌]

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [مؤمن‌] مى‌پرسد: «آيا شما اطلاع داريد [كجاست‌]؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: باز (این گوینده بهشتی به رفیقان) گوید: آیا می‌خواهید نظر کنید (و آن رفیق کافر را اینک در دوزخ بنگرید).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (سپس آن بهشتی، رو به دوستان بهشتی خود کرده) می‌گوید: آیا شما می‌توانید نگاهی (به دوزخ) بیندازید و او را بنگرید؟ [[«مُطَّلِعُونَ»: کسانی که از بالا به پائین بنگرند و دیده‌ور شوند. افراد مشرِف بر چیزی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [سپس‌] گوید آیا شما نگرندگانید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (سپس) می‌گوید: «آیا شما می‌توانید از او خبری بگیرید؟»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت آیا شمائید سربرآرندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [سپس‌] گويد: آيا شما فرو مى‌نگريد- تا آن همنشين را ببينيد-؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «آیا شما سر بر (جهنم) آورندگانید؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He said: 'Will you look down?'

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said (to others on the thrones), “Will you take a glimpse (into hell) below?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He says, 'Are you looking down?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Allah will say: will ye look down?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (The man) said: "Will you look down?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He will say, “Will you have a look?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He will say: -- Do you wish to know where he is now?'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (The speaker) said: "Will you look down"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He saith: Will ye look?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He will say, ‘Will you have a look?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And he will reply: 'Are you looking down (into Hell)'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He will say, "Would you [care to] look?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do you want to see him?' "

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He shall say: Will you look on?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala hal antum muttaliAAoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then he will say, "Shall we look for him?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (A voice) said: "Would ye like to look down?"

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس خود او به دوزخ سر می کشد و هم نشینش را وسط دوزخ می بیند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: از بالا بنگرد و او را در ميان آتش دوزخ بيند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس سر بلند مى‌كند و او را در وسط آتش مى‌بيند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس اطلاع حاصل مى‌كند، و او را در ميان آتش مى‌بيند!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن گاه خود بنگرد و او را در میان دوزخ (معذّب) بیند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس آن گاه خودش دیده‌ور می‌شود (و به دوزخ می‌نگرد) و او را در وسط دوزخ می‌بیند. [[«سَوَآءِ»: وسط. (نگا: دخان / 47). این آیه و آیات دیگری در قرآن بیانگر این واقعیّت است که در قیامت قدرت دید فوق‌العاده‌ای به بهشتیان عطاء می‌شود که فاصله مکانی برای ایشان چندان مطرح نیست (نگا: اعراف / 44) و مطالب و مقاصد هم بدون ثغور و حدود است (نگا: انبیاء / 102، فصّلت / 31، زخرف / 71، واقعه / 21، مرسلات / 42).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس فرانگرد و او را در میانه دوزخ ببیند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: اینجاست که نگاهی می‌کند، ناگهان او را در میان دوزخ می‌بیند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس سربرآورد پس نگریستش در میان دوزخ‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس بنگرد و او را در ميان دوزخ ببيند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس سر بر آورد تا او را در وسط آتش فروزان دید!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He looked down and saw (his friend) in the midst of Hell.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He therefore looked down and saw him amidst the blazing fire.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then he looks, and sees him in the midst of Hell.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then he will look down and see him in the midst of the Flaming Fire.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So he looked down and saw him in the midst of the Fire.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He will look, and will see him in the pit of Hell.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then he will look downwards, and will see him in the depths of Hell.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So he looked down and saw him in the midst of the Fire.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then looketh he and seeth him in the depth of hell.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then he will take a look and sight him in the middle of hell.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then, he will look and see him in the midst of Hell.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And he will look and see him in the midst of the Hellfire.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He will look down and see him in hell.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then he looked down and saw him in the midst of hell.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: FaittalaAAa faraahu fee sawai aljaheemi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then he will look and see him in the midst of the Fire.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He looked down and saw him in the midst of the Fire.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [به او] می گوید: به خدا سوگند نزدیک بود، مرا به هلاکت بیندازی.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گويدش: به خدا سوگند، نزديك بود كه مرا به هلاكت افكنى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مى‌گويد: به خدا سوگند چيزى نمانده بود كه مرا به هلاكت اندازى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [و] مى‌گويد: «به خدا سوگند، چيزى نمانده بود كه تو مرا به هلاكت اندازى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: به او گوید: قسم به خدا که نزدیک بود مرا (همچون خود) هلاک گردانی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: می‌گوید: به خدا سوگند! نزدیک بود (با نیرنگ خود) مرا پرت کنی و هلاکم سازی. [[«إِن کِدْتَ»: نزدیک بود که تو. «لَتُرْدینِ»: اصل آن لَتُرْدینی، از مصدر إرْداء و ماده (ردی) (نگا: طه / 16، فصّلت / 23)، مرا پرت کنی. مرا هلاک سازی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [و از دور به او] گوید به خدا نزدیک بود که تو مرا به نابودی بکشانی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: می‌گوید: «به خدا سوگند نزدیک بود مرا (نیز) به هلاکت بکشانی!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت به خدا سوگند همانا نزدیک بود مرا سرنگون کنی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گويد: به خدا سوگند هر آينه نزديك بود كه مرا به هلاكت افكنى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «به خدا سوگند، چیزی نمانده بود که تو مرا بی‌چون به سقوط کشانی.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: 'By God', he said, 'you had almost ruined me.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “By Allah, you had nearly ruined me!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He says, 'By God, wellnigh thou didst destroy me;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And he will say: by Allah, thou hadst wellnigh causedest me to perish.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He said: "By Allah! You have nearly ruined me.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He will say, “By God, you almost ruined me.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He will say to him: -- By Allah, you almost ruined me.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He said: "By Allah! You have nearly ruined me."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He saith: By Allah, thou verily didst all but cause my ruin,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He will say, ‘By Allah, you had almost ruined me!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'By Allah' he will say, 'you almost destroyed me!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He will say, "By Allah, you almost ruined me.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He will say to his friend in hell, "By God, you almost destroyed me.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He shall say: By Allah! you had almost caused me to perish;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala taAllahi in kidta laturdeeni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He will say, "By God! You almost brought me to ruin!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He said: "By Allah! thou wast little short of bringing me to perdition!

verses.text: وَ لَوْ لاَ نِعْمَةُ رَبِّي‌ لَکُنْتُ‌ مِنَ‌ الْمُحْضَرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اگر توفیق و رحمت پروردگارم نبود، حتماً از احضارشدگان [در دوزخ] بودم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و اگر موهبت پروردگارم نبود، من نيز از احضارشدگان مى‌بودم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اگر رحمت پروردگارم نبود، بى‌ترديد من نيز از احضار شدگان [در آتش‌] بودم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اگر رحمت پروردگارم نبود، هرآينه من [نيز] از احضارشدگان بودم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اگر نعمت و لطف خدای من (نگهدار) نبود من هم به دوزخ (نزد تو) از حاضر شدگان بودم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر نعمت (هدایت و توفیق) پروردگارم (دستگیرم) نبود، من هم (هم اینک) از احضار شدگان (در دوزخ) بودم. [[«الْمُحْضَرِینَ»: کسانی که فرشتگان ایشان را در میان دوزخ گرد آورده‌اند (نگا: روم / 16، سبأ / 38، یس / 32 و 53 و 75، قصص / 61).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اگر نعمت پروردگارم نبود من نیز از حاضر شدگان [در عذاب‌] بودم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و اگر نعمت پروردگارم نبود، من نیز از احضارشدگان (در دوزخ) بودم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اگر نبود نعمت پروردگار من هر آینه می‌بودم از احضارشدگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اگر نيكويى و بخشايش پروردگارم نبود هر آينه من هم از حاضرشدگان [در دوزخ‌] بودم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «و اگر نعمت پروردگارم نبود، بی‌گمان من (نیز) از احضارشدگان (برای پرسش و در آن آتش) بودم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Had it not been for the grace of my Lord I too would have been there (in Hell).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And were it not for the munificence of my Lord, I too would have been seized and brought forth (captive)!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But for my Lord's blessing, I were one of the arraigned.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And but for the favourcf my lord, I should have been of those brought forward.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Had it not been for the Grace of my Lord, I would certainly have been among those brought forth (to Hell)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Were it not for the grace of my Lord, I would have been among the arraigned.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But for Allah's favour, I should be one of those who have been mustered here.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Had it not been for the grace of my Lord, I would certainly have been among those brought forth (to Hell)."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And had it not been for the favour of my Lord, I too had been of those haled forth (to doom).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Had it not been for my Lord’s blessing, I too would have been among those mustered [in hell]!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But for the Favor of Allah I should have surely been among those who were arraigned (with you in Hell).

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: If not for the favor of my Lord, I would have been of those brought in [to Hell].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Had I not the guidance of my Lord, I would certainly have been brought into torment".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And had it not been for the favor of my Lord, I would certainly have been among those brought up.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walawla niAAmatu rabbee lakuntu mina almuhdareena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: If it had not been for the blessing of my Lord, I would also have been taken to Hell."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Had it not been for the Grace of my Lord, I should certainly have been among those brought (there)!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [آن گاه به دوستان بهشتی خود می گوید:] آیا ما [برای همیشه در بهشتیم و] هرگز نمی میریم؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا ما را مرگى نيست،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [و از روى شوق مى‌گويد:] آيا ما را ديگر مرگى نيست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [و از روى شوق مى‌گويد:] «آيا ديگر روى مرگ نمى‌بينيم،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (و از خوشحالی گوید) آیا دیگر ما را مرگی نخواهد بود؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا ما دیگر نمی‌میریم؟! [[«أَفَمَا نَحْنُ ...»: وقتی که آن بهشتی، عذاب دوزخ را می‌بیند، و این همه نعمت و خوشی وصف‌ناشدنی بهشت را هم می‌نگرد، به گونه تجاهل العارف و انگار که خواب می‌بیند، سؤال می‌کند: آیا واقعاً ما دیگر نمی‌میریم و جاودانه هستیم؟ یا این که تحدّث به نعمت می‌کند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس آیا ما دیگر نمی‌میریم؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (سپس به یاران خود می‌گوید: ای دوستان!) آیا ما هرگز نمی‌میریم (و در بهشت جاودانه خواهیم بود)،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا پس نیستیم ما مُردگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [آنگاه از فرط خوشحالى گويد:] پس آيا ما ديگر نخواهيم مرد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (و از رویِ شوق می‌گوید:) «آیا پس ما دیگر (از) میرندگان نیستیم؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: (Another will say:)"Is it true, we are not going to die

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “So are we never to die?” (The people of Paradise will ask the angels, with delight, after the announcement of everlasting life.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What, do we then not die

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Are we not then to die

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (Allah informs about that true believer that he said): "Are we then not to die (any more)?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “We will not die.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So, are we not going to die,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Are we then not to die (any more)"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Are we then not to die

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘Is it [true] that we shall not die [anymore],

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: What then, shall we not die

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then, are we not to die

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He will ask his companion, "Did you not say that there would only be one death

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Is it then that we are not going to die,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Afama nahnu bimayyiteena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then he will say [to his blessed companions], "Are we not going to die,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Is it (the case) that we shall not die,

verses.text: إِلاَّ مَوْتَتَنَا الْأُولَى‌ وَ مَا نَحْنُ‌ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [و] جز همان مرگ نخستین [که در دنیا سراغمان آمد مرگی دیگر به سراغمان نخواهد آمد] و ما هرگز عذاب نخواهیم شد؟ [شگفتا! چه لطف خاصی از سوی خدا به ما شده است!]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: جز آن مرگ نخستين؟ و ديگر عذابمان نمى‌كنند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: جز همان مرگ نخستين ما؟ و ما عذاب نخواهيم شد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: جز همان مرگ نخستين خود؟ و ما هرگز عذاب نخواهيم شد؟!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: جز همان مرگ اول (که در دنیا مردیم) و دیگر هیچ رنج و عذابی بر ما نخواهد بود؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مگر مرگ نخستینی که داشتیم (و بعد از آن برانگیخته شدیم) و ما هرگز عذاب داده نمی‌شویم. [[«مَوْتَتَنَا الأُولی»: مرگ پیشین ما. گاهی عربها - مثل اینجا - واژه اوّل را به کار می‌برند و دومی به دنبال ندارد. لذا مراد همان مرگ بعد از پایان عمر و فرا رسیدن اجل است (نگا: دخان / 35 و 56).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: مگر به مردن نخستینمان، و ما عذاب شونده نیستیم؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و جز همان مرگ اول، مرگی به سراغ ما نخواهد آمد، و ما هرگز عذاب نخواهیم شد.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: جز مرگ نخستین را و نیستیم ما عذاب‌شدگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مگر همان مرگ نخستين خود [كه گذشت‌] و ما از عذاب‌شدگان نيستيم؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «جز همان مرگ نخستینمان؟ و ما هرگز از معذبان نیستیم‌؟!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Other than our first death, and we shall not be punished?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Except our earlier death, and nor will we be punished?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: except for our first death, and are we not chastised?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Save our first death, and are we not to be tormented?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Except our first death, and we shall not be punished? (after we have entered Paradise)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Except for our first death, and we will not be punished.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: except for our first death? And shall we suffer no chastisement?'”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Except our first death, and we shall not be punished"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Saving our former death, and are we not to be punished?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: aside from our earlier death, and that we shall not be punished?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: except our first death, and shall we not be punished'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Except for our first death, and we will not be punished?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and that we would not be punished?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Except our previous death? And we shall not be chastised?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Illa mawtatana aloola wama nahnu bimuAAaththabeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: except for our first death? Are we not going to be punished?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Except our first death, and that we shall not be punished?"

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید این همان کامیابی بزرگ است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هر آينه اين است كاميابى بزرگ.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: به راستى اين همان كاميابى بزرگ است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: راستى كه اين همان كاميابى بزرگ است!»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: این است همان سعادت و رستگاری بزرگ.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: این (نعمت و کرامتی که خدا به ما روا دیده است) واقعاً پیروزی بزرگی است (که به دست آورده‌ایم، و رستگاری سترگی است از عقاب و عذاب اخرویی که در دنیا از آن می‌ترسیدیم). [[«الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِیمُ»: پیروزی بزرگ. رستگاری سترگ.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌گمان این [که من در بهشت هستم‌] همان رستگاری بزرگ است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: راستی این همان پیروزی بزرگ است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا این است آن رستگاری بزرگ‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هر آينه اين است پيروزى و كاميابى بزرگ.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «به‌راستی همواره این همان کامیابی سالم بزرگ است!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: This will indeed be great happiness.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “This is, most certainly, the supreme success.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: This is indeed the mighty triumph,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily this! that is the supreme achievement.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Truly, this is the supreme success!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: This is the supreme triumph.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Surely this is the supreme triumph.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Truly, this is the supreme success!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! this is the supreme triumph.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: This is indeed the supreme triumph!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Indeed, this is the mighty victory,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, this is the great attainment.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: This is certainly the greatest triumph

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Most surely this is the mighty achievement.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna hatha lahuwa alfawzu alAAatheemu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Truly, this is a great victory!"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Verily this is the supreme achievement!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس باید برای چنین پاداشی عمل کنندگان عمل کنند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: عمل‌كنندگان بايد براى چنين پاداشى عمل كنند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: براى اين (رقم نعمت‌ها) بايد اهل عمل بكوشند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: براى چنين [پاداشى‌] بايد كوشندگان بكوشند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آنان که سعی و عملی می‌کنند باید بر مثل این (بهشت جاودانی) کنند (نه بر دنیای دو روزه فانی).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: برای رسیدن به چنین چیزی، کارکنان باید کار کنند. [[«هذا»: این سعادت عُظمی و نعمت کُبری.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: باید که اهل عمل برای چنین هدفی بکوشند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آری، برای مثل این، باید عمل‌کنندگان عمل کنند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: به مانند این پس باید کنند کنندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: براى چنين [پاداشى‌] بايد كوشندگان بكوشند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس برای همانند این (پاداش) باید عمل‌کنندگان عمل کنند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: For this the toilers should strive."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: For such a reward should the workers perform.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: for the like of this let the workers work.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: For the like of this, then, let the workers work.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: For the like of this let the workers work.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: For the like of this let the workers work.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: For the like of it should the workers work.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: For the like of this let the workers work.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: For the like of this, then, let the workers work.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Let all workers work for the like of this!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and for the like of this let the workers work.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: For the like of this let the workers [on earth] work.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: for which one must strive hard.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: For the like of this then let the workers work.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Limithli hatha falyaAAmali alAAamiloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: It is for the like of this that all should strive.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: For the like of this let all strive, who wish to strive.

verses.text: أَ ذٰلِکَ‌ خَيْرٌ نُزُلاً أَمْ‌ شَجَرَةُ الزَّقُّومِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا این [بهشت جاودان پر نعمت] برای پذیرایی بهتر است یا درخت زقّوم؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا خورش را اين بهتر يا درخت زقوم؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا اين براى پذيرايى بهتر است يا درخت زقوم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا از نظر پذيرايى اين بهتر است يا درخت زقوم؟!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا این پذیرایی (و مقام عالی) بهتر است یا درخت زقّوم جهنم؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا آن (همه نعمتهای بیکران و جاویدانی) که بهشتیان را با آن پذیرائی می‌کنند بهتر است، یا درخت زقّوم (نفرت‌انگیز که از آن به دوزخیان می‌دهند؟). [[«نُزُلاً»: (نگا: آل‌عمران / 198، کهف / 102 و 107، سجده / 19). «الزَّقُّومِ»: نام درختچه بدبو و تلخ مزه‌ای است که در سرزمین تهامه می‌روید و شیره‌ای دارد که اگر به بدن انسان بخورد، ورم می‌کند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا این پیشکش بهتر است یا درخت زقوم؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا این (نعمتهای جاویدان بهشتی) بهتر است یا درخت (نفرت‌انگیز) زقّوم؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا این بهتر است پیشکشی یا درخت تلخکام زقّوم‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا اين براى پذيرايى و مهمانى بهتر است يا درخت زقوم [كه در ميان دوزخ رسته است‌]؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا این (منزلگاه والا) برای پذیرایی واردان بهتر است، یا درخت زقّوم‌؟!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Is this better or the tree of Zaqqum

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So is this welcome better, or the tree of Zaqqum?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Is that better as a hospitality, or the Tree of Ez-Zakkoum?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Is this better as an entertainment or the tree of Zaqqum?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Is that (Paradise) better entertainment or the tree of Zaqqum (a horrible tree in Hell)?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Is this a better hospitality, or the Tree of Bitterness?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Is this a better hospitality or the tree of al-Zaqqum?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Is that (Paradise) better entertainment or the tree of Zaqqum

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Is this better as a welcome, or the tree of Zaqqum?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Is this a better reception, or the Zaqqum tree?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Is this a better hospitality or the tree of AzZakkum!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Is Paradise a better accommodation or the tree of zaqqum?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Is this not a better reward than the tree of Zaqqum

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Is this better as an entertainment or the tree of Zaqqum?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Athalika khayrun nuzulan am shajaratu alzzaqqoomi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Is that better by way of hospitality or the Zaqqum tree,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Is that the better entertainment or the Tree of Zaqqum?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: ما آن را برای ستمکاران مایه شکنجه و عذاب قرار داده ایم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما آن درخت را براى ابتلاى ستمكاران پديد آورده‌ايم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همانا ما آن [درخت‌] را براى ستمگران، عذاب قرار داده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در حقيقت، ما آن را براى ستمگران [مايه آزمايش و] عذابى گردانيديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که آن درخت را ما بلای جان ستمکاران عالم گردانیدیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما آن را مایه‌ی رنج و محنت ستمگران کرده‌ایم. [[«فِتْنَةً»: زحمت و محنت. رنج و عذاب. مراد این است که دوزخیان وادار به خوردن چنین درخت بدبو و تلخی می‌شوند که به جای این که وسیله راحت باشد، باعث عذاب و رنج بیشتر می‌گردد. ممکن است (فِتْنَةً) را به معنی آزمایش دانست. در این صورت اشاره به این است که زقّوم در دنیا وسیله آزمایش ستمگران کفرپیشه است. چرا که کافران گفته و می‌گویند: مگر درخت در آتش می‌روید؟!]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ما آن را مایه آزمون ستمکاران [مشرک‌] قرار داده‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما آن را مایه درد و رنج ظالمان قرار دادیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا ما گردانیدیمش گرفتاریی برای ستمگران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا آن

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: همواره، ما آن را برای ستمگران مایه‌ی آزمایشی آتشین گردانیدیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Which We have reserved as punishment for evil-doers?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: We have indeed made that a punishment for the unjust.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We have appointed it as a trial for the evildoers.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily We! We have made it a temptation for the wrong- doers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Truly We have made it (as) a trail for the Zalimun (polytheists, disbelievers, wrong-doers, etc.).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We made it an ordeal for the unjust.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We have made this tree a trial for the wrong-doers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Truly, We have made it (as) a trial for the wrongdoers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! We have appointed it a torment for wrong-doers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed We have made it a punishment for the wrongdoers.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We have made this (tree) a trial for the evildoers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, We have made it a torment for the wrongdoers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: which We have made as a torment for the unjust?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely We have made it to be a trial to the unjust.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna jaAAalnaha fitnatan lilththalimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: which We have made as a test for the wrongdoers.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: For We have truly made it (as) a trial for the wrong-doers.

verses.text: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٌ تَخْرُجُ‌ فِي‌ أَصْلِ‌ الْجَحِيمِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آن درختی است که در قعر دوزخ می روید،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: درختى است كه از اعماق جهنم مى‌رويد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [و] آن درختى است كه در اعماق جهنم مى‌رويد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آن، درختى است كه از قعر آتش سوزان مى‌رويد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن زقوم به حقیقت درختی است که از بن دوزخ برآید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: زقّوم درختی است که در ته دوزخ می‌روید. [[«تَخْرُجُ»: بیرون می‌دمد. می‌روید. «أَصْل»: قعر. ته.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آن درختی است که از بن جهنم می‌روید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آن درختی است که از قعر جهنّم می‌روید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: هر آینه آن درختی است که برون آید در تهِ دوزخ‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آن درختى است كه در بن دوزخ مى‌رويد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آن بی‌گمان (همان) درختی است که در (ژرفای) آتش سوزان برون می‌تند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: It is a tree that grows at the bottom of Hell.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed it is a tree that sprouts from the base of hell.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: It is a tree that comes forth in the root of Hell;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily it is a tree that springeth forth in the bottom of Flaming Fire.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, it is a tree that springs out of the bottom of Hell-fire,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It is a tree that grows from the bottom of Hell.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: It is a tree that grows in the nethermost part of Hell.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, it is a tree that springs out of the bottom of Hell-fire,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! it is a tree that springeth in the heart of hell.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It is a tree that rises from the depths of hell.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It is a tree that grows from the bottom of Hell;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, it is a tree issuing from the bottom of the Hellfire,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Zaqqum) is a tree which grows from the deepest part of hell,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely it is a tree that-grows in the bottom of the hell;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Innaha shajaratun takhruju fee asli aljaheemi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: For it is a tree that springs out of the bottom of Hellfire:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: For it is a tree that springs out of the bottom of Hell-Fire:

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: شکوفه هایش مانند سرهای شیاطین [بسیار بدنما و زشت] است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ميوه‌اش همانند سر شياطين است،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: ميوه‌اش گويى سرهاى ديوان است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: ميوه‌اش گويى چون كله‌هاى شياطين است،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: میوه‌اش (در خباثت) گویی سرهای شیاطین است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: شکوفه و میوه‌ی آن انگار کلّه‌های شیاطین است. [[«طَلْعُهَا»: طلع، شکوفه. نخستین میوه‌ای که بر درخت ظاهر می‌شود (نگا: انعام / 99، شعراء / 148). «رُؤُوسُ الشَّیَاطِینِ»: نماد نهایت زشتی قیافه است که بر اساس انعکاسات ذهنی انسانها ترسیم می‌گردد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: میوه‌اش گویی کله‌های شیاطین است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: شکوفه آن مانند سرهای شیاطین است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: شکوفه (یا میوه) آن همچون سرهای دیوان (شیاطین)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: خوشه و بار آن [از زشتى‌] گويى سرهاى ديوان است

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: ثمره‌ی آغازینش گویی - آن- همانا سرهای شیاطین است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Its spathes are like the prickly pear.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Its fruit like the heads of demons.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: its spathes are as the heads of Satans,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: The fruit thereof is as though the hoods of the serpents.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: The shoots of its fruit-stalks are like the heads of Shayatin (devils);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Its fruits are like the devils’ heads.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Its spathes are like the heads of satans.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: The shoots of its fruit stalks are like the heads of Shayatin.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Its crop is as it were the heads of devils

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Its spathes are as if they were devils’ heads.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: its spathes are like the heads of satans

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Its emerging fruit as if it was heads of the devils.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and its fruits are like the heads of devils.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Its produce is as it were the heads of the serpents.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: TalAAuha kaannahu ruoosu alshshayateeni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and its fruits are like devils' heads.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The shoots of its fruit-stalks are like the heads of devils:

verses.text: فَإِنَّهُمْ‌ لَآکِلُونَ‌ مِنْهَا فَمَالِئُونَ‌ مِنْهَا الْبُطُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس این منکران لجوج حتماً از آن می خورند و شکم ها را از آن پر می کنند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: دوزخيان از آن مى‌خورند و شكم انباشته مى‌سازند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس [دوزخيان‌] حتما از آن مى‌خورند و شكم‌ها را از آن پر مى‌كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس [دوزخيان‌] حتماً از آن مى‌خورند و شكمها را از آن پر مى‌كنند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: اهل دوزخ از آن درخت (خباثت) آن طور می‌خورند که شکمها پر می‌سازند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: دوزخیان از آن می‌خورند و شکمها را از آن پر و آکنده می‌سازند. [[«مَالِئُونَ»: پُر کُنندگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه ایشان خورنده از آنند، و پرکننده شکمهای خویش از آن‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها [= مجرمان‌] از آن می‌خورند و شکمها را از آن پر می‌کنند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: هر آینه ایشانند از آن خورندگان پس شکمها را از آنند آکندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس همانان- دوزخيان- از آن بخورند و شكمها را از آن پر كنند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس بی‌گمان آنان [:دوزخیان] بی‌‌چون خورندگان از آن و پُرکنندگان شکم‌هاشان از آنند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They will eat and fill their bellies with it,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So indeed they will eat from it, and fill their bellies with it.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and they eat of it, and of it fill their bellies,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily they must eat thereof and fill their bellies therewith.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Truly, they will eat thereof and fill their bellies therewith.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They will eat from it, and fill their bellies with it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (The people of Hell) will surely eat of it, filling their bellies with it.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Truly, they will eat thereof and fill their bellies therewith.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! they verily must eat thereof, and fill (their) bellies therewith.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They will eat from it and gorge with it their bellies.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: on it they shall feed, and with it they shall fill their bellies.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, they will eat from it and fill with it their bellies.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The dwellers of hell will eat that fruit and fill-up their bellies.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then most surely they shall eat of it and fill (their) bellies with it.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fainnahum laakiloona minha famalioona minha albutoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They will eat from it and fill their bellies with it;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Truly they will eat thereof and fill their bellies therewith.

verses.text: ثُمَ‌ إِنَ‌ لَهُمْ‌ عَلَيْهَا لَشَوْباً مِنْ‌ حَمِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آن گاه به ناچار روی آن [به عنوان نوشیدنی] مخلوطی از آب بسیار داغ و متعفّن برای آنان خواهد بود!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و بر سر آن آميزه‌اى از آب سوزان مى‌نوشند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سپس براى ايشان بر روى آن [زقوم‌] مخلوطى از آب جوشان است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: سپس ايشان را بر سر آن، آميغى از آب جوشان است؛

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس از خوردن زقّوم دوزخ بر آنها آمیزه‌ای از شراب سوزان خواهد بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سپس آب داغ کثیف و آلوده‌ای را بر آن می‌نوشند. [[«لَشَوباً»: شَوب، آلوده. آمیخته. مراد آلوده به زردابه و خونابه است (نگا: ص / 57، نبأ / 25، حاقّه / 36). «حَمِیمٍ»: آب داغ و جوشان. (نگا: انعام / 70، یونس / 4، حجّ / 19).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس برای آنان آمیزه‌ای از آب جوش هست که به دنبال آن نوشند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس روی آن آب داغ متعفّنی می‌نوشند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سپس ایشان را است بر آن آمیخته از آبی جوشان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنگاه براى آنان بر بالاى آن [طعام‌] آميزه‌اى است از آب جوشان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس ایشان را (افزون) بر آن، بی‌چون آمیخته‌ای به‌راستی از مایعی بس جوشان است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Washing it down with boiling water.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Then after it, indeed for them is the drink of boiling hot water.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: then on top of it they have a brew of boiling water,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And thereafter verily they shall have thereon a draught of balling water.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then on the top of that they will be given boiling water to drink so that it becomes a mixture (of boiling water and Zaqqum in their bellies).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then, on top of it, they will have a brew of boiling liquid.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then on top of it they will have a brew of boiling water.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then on the top of that they will be given boiling Hamim.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And afterward, lo! thereupon they have a drink of boiling water

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: On top of that they will take a solution of scalding water.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: On top of it they shall have a brew of boiling water,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then indeed, they will have after it a mixture of scalding water.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Then they will have on top of it a mixture of boiling water.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then most surely they shall have after it to drink of a mixture prepared in boiling water.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma inna lahum AAalayha lashawban min hameemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: then in addition to it they shall have a draught of boiling water to drink;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then on top of that they will be given a mixture made of boiling water.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سپس بازگشتشان حتماً به سوی دوزخ است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: سپس بازگشتشان به همان جهنم است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سپس بازگشتشان بى‌گمان به جانب آتش دوزخ است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنگاه بازگشتشان بى‌گمان به سوى دوزخ است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و باز هم رجوعشان به سوی (عذاب دایم) جهنّم است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آن گاه (که از زقّوم خوردند و از آب داغِ آلوده نوشیدند) به دوزخ برمی‌گردند.
