[[«مَرْجِعُهُمْ»: رجوع و برگشت ایشان. مراد این است که دوزخیان برای خوردن زقّوم به قعر دوزخ برده می‌شوند (نگا: صافّات / 64) و برای نوشاندن آب داغ و سوزان به مکان دیگری که قرآن روشن نفرموده است (نگا: رحمن / 44)، سپس هر کسی را به جایگاه عذابش برمی‌گردانند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس بازگشتگاهشان به سوی دوزخ است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس بازگشت آنها به سوی جهنّم است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس بازگشت ایشان است همانا بسوی دوزخ‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سپس هر آينه بازگشتشان به دوزخ است

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس همواره بازگشتشان بی‌امان سوی آتش بس زبانه‌دارِ سوزان است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then to Hell they will surely be returned.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Then surely their return is towards hell.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: then their return is unto Hell.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And thereafter verily their return is Unto the Flaming Fire.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then thereafter, verily, their return is to the flaming fire of Hell.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then their return will be to the Blaze.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then their return will be to the same blazing Hell.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then thereafter, verily, their return is to the flaming fire of Hell.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And afterward, lo! their return is surely unto hell.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then their retreat will be toward hell.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: then their return is to Hell.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then indeed, their return will be to the Hellfire.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They can only return to hell.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then most surely their return shall be to hell.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma inna marjiAAahum laila aljaheemi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: then surely they shall return to Hell.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then shall their return be to the (Blazing) Fire.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [سزاوار بودنشان در قیامت به این همه عذاب به سبب این است که] آنان پدرانشان را گمراه یافتند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنها پدران خود را پيش از خود گمراه يافتند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همانا آنها پدران خود را گمراه يافتند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنها پدران خود را گمراه يافتند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: چرا که آنها پدرانشان را در ضلالت و گمراهی یافتند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (آنان شایسته‌ی چنین عذابی هستند. چرا که) پدران خود را در گمراهی یافته‌اند (و به دنبال ایشان کورکورانه روان گشته‌اند). [[«أَلْفَوْا»: (نگا: بقره / 170، یوسف / 25).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: چرا که ایشان پدرانشان را گمراه یافتند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: چرا که آنها پدران خود را گمراه یافتند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که ایشان یافتند پدران خویش را گمراهان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه آنان پدران خود را گمراه يافتند،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آنان همانا پدران خود را گمراهان یافتند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They had found their fathers astray,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They had indeed found their forefathers astray.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They found their fathers erring,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily they found their fathers gone astray.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, they found their fathers on the wrong path;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They had found their parents astray.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: These are the ones who found their fathers steeped in error,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, they found their fathers on the wrong path;

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They indeed found their fathers astray,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They had found their fathers astray,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They found their fathers in error,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed they found their fathers astray.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They found their father going astray

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely they found their fathers going astray,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Innahum alfaw abaahum dalleena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They found their fathers had gone astray;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Truly they found their fathers on the wrong Path;

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [با اینکه می دانستند گمراهند بدون اندیشه و تأمل] عجولانه از پی آنان می رفتند!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و بر پى ايشان شتابان مى‌روند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و [با اين حال‌] با سرعت در پى آنها كشانده مى‌شوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس ايشان به دنبال آنها مى‌شتابند!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و باز از پی آنها شتابان می‌رفتند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (چنان دل و دین به تقلید نیاکان داده‌اند که انگار) آنان را به دنبال نیاکانشان به شتاب می‌رانند. [[«عَلی آثَارِهِمْ»: در راه ایشان. به دنبال آنان (نگا: مائده / 46، کهف / 6). «یُهْرَعُونَ»: به شتاب رانده می‌شوند. به سرعت روانه می‌گردند. (نگا: هود / 78).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و آنان به دنبال ایشان شتافتند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: با این حال به سرعت بدنبال آنان کشانده می‌شوند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس ایشانند در پی آنان (پا بر نشان پایهای آنان) شتابندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس بر پى آنان مى‌شتافتند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس (هم) ایشان بر پیِ‌شان با سرعتی برق‌آسا ترسان و شتاب‌زدگانند!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Yet they hasten to follow in their footsteps.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So they hastily follow their footsteps!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and they run in their footsteps.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So they in their footsteps are rushing.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So they (too) made haste to follow in their footsteps!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And rushed along in their footsteps.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and they are running in their footsteps.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So they (too) hastened in their footsteps!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But they make haste (to follow) in their footsteps.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: yet they press onwards in their footsteps.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: yet they run in their footsteps,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So they hastened [to follow] in their footsteps.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and rushed to follow them.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So in their footsteps they are being hastened on.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fahum AAala atharihim yuhraAAoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: so they are rushing to follow in their footsteps.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So they (too) were rushed down on their footsteps!

verses.text: وَ لَقَدْ ضَلَ‌ قَبْلَهُمْ‌ أَکْثَرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و به راستی پیش از اینان بیشتر پیشینیان گمراه شدند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و پيش از آنها بيشتر پيشينيان گمراه شدند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و البته پيش از آنها بيشتر پيشينيان گمراه شدند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و قطعاً پيش از آنها بيشتر پيشينيان به گمراهى افتادند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و قبل از اینان بیشتر پیشینیان هم سخت گمراه بودند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: قبل از اینان هم، اکثر پیشینیان گمراه بوده‌اند (چون مثل همین مشرکان از نیاکانشان تقلید کرده‌اند و کورکورانه مسیر ایشان را پیموده‌اند). [[«الأوَّلِینَ»: پیشینیان. گذشتگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به راستی پیش از آنان، بیشترینه پیشینیان گمراه شدند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و قبل از آنها بیشتر پیشینیان (نیز) گمراه شدند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا گمراه شدند پیش از ایشان بیشتر پیشینیان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه پيش از آنها بيشتر پيشينيان گمراه شدند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بی‌گمان پیش از آنان بیشتر پیشینیان همی به گمراهی افتادند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So had many an earlier people gone astray,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed before them, most of the former people went astray.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Before them erred most of the ancients,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And assuredly there went stray before them many of the ancients.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And indeed most of the men of old went astray before them;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And most of the ancients before them went astray.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Before them a multitude of people of olden times had erred,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And indeed most of the earlier ones went astray before them;

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And verily most of the men of old went astray before them,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Most of the former peoples went astray before them,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: yet before them most of the ancients went astray,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And there had already strayed before them most of the former peoples,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Most of the ancient people had also gone astray.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And certainly most of the ancients went astray before them,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walaqad dalla qablahum aktharu alawwaleena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: And assuredly many of the ancients went astray before them,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And truly before them, many of the ancients went astray;-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و بی تردید ما در میان آنان بیم دهندگانی فرستادیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و ما بيم‌دهندگانى به ميانشان فرستاديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و حال آن كه ما هشدار دهندگانى در ميانشان فرستاديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و حال آنكه مسلماً در ميانشان هشداردهندگانى فرستاديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما رسولانی برای بیم و پند بر آنها فرستادیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و ما در میانشان بیم‌دهندگانی (برانگیختیم و به سویشان) روانه کردیم. [[«مُنذِرِینَ»: بیم دهندگان. مراد پیغمبرانی است که آنان را به مسؤولیّتهایشان آشنا می‌کردند و ایشان را از فرجام شرک و کفر و بدکرداری و بیدادگری و تقلید کورکورانه از دیگران بیم می‌دادند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به راستی به میان آنان هشداردهندگانی فرستادیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما در میان آنها انذارکنندگانی فرستادیم،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا فرستادیم در ایشان ترسانندگانی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه در ميان ايشان بيم‌كنندگان فرستاديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و همواره در میانشان بس هشداردهندگانی فرستادیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And We had sent admonishers to them.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed We had sent Heralds of warnings among them.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and We sent among them warners;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And assuredly We sent among them warners.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And indeed We sent among them warners (Messengers);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Even though We sent messengers to warn them.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and We had sent among them Messengers to warn them.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And indeed We sent among them warners;

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And verily We sent among them warners.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and We had certainly sent warners among them.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: though We had sent among them warners.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We had already sent among them warners.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We had certainly sent warners to them.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And certainly We sent among them warners.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walaqad arsalna feehim munthireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: though We had sent warners among them.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But We sent aforetime, among them, (messengers) to admonish them;-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس با تأمل بنگر سرانجام بیم داده شدگان چگونه بود؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس بنگر كه سرانجام آن بيم‌يافتگان چگونه بود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس ببين فرجام هشدار داده شدگان چگونه شد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس ببين فرجام هشدارداده‌شدگان چگونه بود!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (همه را تکذیب کردند) پس بنگر تا عاقبت کار آن امتهای بیم داده شده (گمراه) به چه (سختی و هلاکت) انجامید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بنگر که فرجام کار بیم داده شدگان چه شده است؟! (همه نابود شده‌اند و عبرت تاریخ گشته‌اند). [[«الْمُنذَرِینَ»: بیم داده شدگان. یعنی آن کسانی که پیغمبران الهی، ایشان را از تباهی و گمراهی می‌ترساندند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس بنگر سرانجام هشدار یافتگان چگونه بوده است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ولی بنگر عاقبت انذارشوندگان چگونه بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس بنگر چگونه بود فرجام بیم‌دادگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس بنگر كه سرانجام آن بيم‌شدگان چگونه بود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس بنگر (که) فرجام هشدار‌شدگان چگونه بوده است؛

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Look, then how was the end of those who had been warned,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore see what sort of fate befell those who were warned!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and behold, how was the end of them that were warned,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So behold what wise hath been the end of those who were warned.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then see what was the end of those who were warned (but heeded not).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So observe the end of those who were warned.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Observe, then, what was the end of those that had been warned,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then see what was the end of those who were warned.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then see the nature of the consequence for those warned,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So observe how was the fate of those who were warned

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: See then the end of those who were warned,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then look how was the end of those who were warned -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: See how terrible was the end of those who were warned.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then see how was the end of those warned,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faonthur kayfa kana AAaqibatu almunthareena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: See how those who were warned met their end!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then see what was the end of those who were admonished (but heeded not),-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [همه هلاک شدند] جز بندگان خالص شده خدا،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: جز بندگان مخلص خدا.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: به استثناى بندگان خالص شده‌ى خدا

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: به استثناى بندگان پاكدل خدا!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: جز بندگان پاک برگزیده خدا (همه هلاک شدند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مگر بندگان پاکیزه و برگزیده‌ی خدا، (که از این مهلکه جان به در برده‌اند و به بهشت نعیم و فوز عظیم رسیده‌اند). [[«إِلاّ عِبَادَ اللهِ الْمُخْلَصِینَ»: (نگا: صافّات / 40).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: مگر بندگان اخلاص یافته خداوند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مگر بندگان مخلص خدا!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: جز بندگان خدا آن پاکشدگان (ناآلودگان)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مگر بندگان ويژه و برگزيده خداى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بجز بندگان ‎پاک شده (ی از طرف) خدا.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Other than the chosen creatures of God.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Except the chosen bondmen of Allah.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: except for God's sincere servants.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Save the bondmen of Allah sincere.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Except the chosen slaves of Allah (faithful, obedient, and true believers of Islamic Monotheism).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Except for the sincere servants of God.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: except for the chosen servants of Allah?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Except the chosen servants of Allah.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Save single-minded slaves of Allah.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: —[all] except Allah’s exclusive servants!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: except the sincere worshipers of Allah.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But not the chosen servants of Allah.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Only Our sincere servants were saved.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Except the servants of Allah, the purified ones.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Illa AAibada Allahi almukhlaseena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Not so the chosen servants of God.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Except the sincere (and devoted) Servants of Allah.

verses.text: وَ لَقَدْ نَادَانَا نُوحٌ‌ فَلَنِعْمَ‌ الْمُجِيبُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و نوح ما را ندا کرد [و ما ندایش را اجابت کردیم] پس ما به راستی نیکو اجابت کننده ای هستیم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نوح ما را ندا داد و ما چه نيك پاسخ‌دهنده‌اى بوديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و همانا نوح ما را ندا داد و چه نيكو اجابت كننده بوديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و نوح، ما را ندا داد، و چه نيك اجابت‌كننده بوديم!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و همانا نوح ما را (بر یاری خود) ندا کرد و ما او را چه نیکو اجابت کردیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: نوح ما را به فریاد خواند و ما بهترین پاسخ دهندگان (برای او) بودیم. [[«لَقَدْ نَادَانَا ...»: (نگا: قمر / 10، مؤمنون / 29، نوح / 26 و 27).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به راستی نوح ما را ندا داد، و چه نیکو پاسخ‌دهندگانیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و نوح، ما را خواند (و ما دعای او را اجابت کردیم)؛ و چه خوب اجابت کننده‌ای هستیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا خواند ما را نوح پس چه خوبند پاسخ‌دهندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه نوح ما را بخواند، پس چه نيك پاسخ‌دهنده بوديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و همانا نوح، ما را به‌درستی ندا در داد. پس به‌راستی چه نیک اجابت‌کنندگان بوده‌ایم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Noah had verily called to Us. And how gracious was He who answered (him).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed Nooh prayed to Us – so what an excellent Acceptor of Prayer We are!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Noah called to Us; and how excellent were the Answerers!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And assuredly Nuh cried Unto us; and We are the Best of answerers!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And indeed Nuh (Noah) invoked Us, and We are the Best of those who answer (the request).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And Noah called out to Us, and We are the Best of responders.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Noah had called upon Us (earlier). See, how excellent We were in answering him!

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And indeed Nuh invoked Us, and We are the best of those who answer.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And Noah verily prayed unto Us, and gracious was the Hearer of his prayer

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Certainly Noah called out to Us, and how well did We respond!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Noah called to Us, and We are the Best to answer.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And Noah had certainly called Us, and [We are] the best of responders.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Noah called for help. How blessed was the answer which he received.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And Nuh did certainly call upon Us, and most excellent answerer of prayer are We.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walaqad nadana noohun falaniAAma almujeeboona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Noah cried to Us, and how excellent was Our response!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (In the days of old), Noah cried to Us, and We are the best to hear prayer.

verses.text: وَ نَجَّيْنَاهُ‌ وَ أَهْلَهُ‌ مِنَ‌ الْکَرْبِ‌ الْعَظِيمِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و او و خاندانش را از آن اندوه بزرگ نجادت دادیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: او و كسانش را از اندوه بزرگ رهانيديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و او و كسانش را از آن محنت بزرگ رهانيديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و او و كسانش را از اندوه بزرگ رهانيديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و او را با اهل بیتش (و پیروانش) همه را از اندوه و بلای بزرگ (هلاکت غرق) نجات دادیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما او را و خانواده و پیروان او را از اندوه بزرگ (تمسخر و آزار قومش، و طوفان و غرق شدن در امواج کوه پیکر آب) نجات دادیم. [[«نَجَّیْنَاهُ ...»: (نگا: یونس / 73، اعراف / 64، شعراء / 119، انبیاء / 76 و 77). «الْکَرْبِ»: غم و اندوه (نگا: انعام / 64، انبیاء / 76).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و او و خانواده‌اش را از گرفتاری بزرگ رهانیدیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و او و خاندانش را از اندوه بزرگ رهایی بخشیدیم،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و رها ساختیمش با خاندانش از اندوه بزرگ‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و او و كسانش- خاندان و پيروانش- را از اندوه بزرگ- عذاب طوفان- رهانيديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و او و کسانش را از اندوه بس بزرگ رهانیدیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We saved him and his family from the great affliction,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We rescued him and his household from the great calamity.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And We delivered him and his people from the great distress,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We delivered him and his people from the great affliction.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We rescued him and his family from the great distress (i.e. drowning),

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We saved him and his family from the great calamity.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We delivered him and his household from the great calamity;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We rescued him and his family from the great distress,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We saved him and his household from the great distress,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We delivered him and his family from their great distress,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We saved him and his people from the great distress,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We saved him and his family from the great affliction.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We rescued him and his people from the greatest affliction

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We delivered him and his followers from the mighty distress.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wanajjaynahu waahlahu mina alkarbi alAAatheemi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We saved him and his people from great distress,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We delivered him and his people from the Great Calamity,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و تنها ذریه او را [در زمین] باقی گذاشتیم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و فرزندانش را باقى گذاشتيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و [تنها] نسل او را باقى گذاشتيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و [تنها] نسل او را باقى گذاشتيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و نژاد و اولاد او را روی زمین باقی داشتیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و نژاد او را بازماندگان (روی زمین) کردیم. [[«ذُرِّیَّتَهُ ...»: برخی، از این آیه چنین برداشت کرده‌اند که تمام نسل بشر بعد از نوح، از دودمان او به وجود آمده و تمام نژادهای روی زمین به فرزندان وی منتهی می‌شوند. امّا مؤمنان دیگری در خدمت نوح بودند، و قاعدةً از ایشان هم فرزندانی باقی مانده است (نگا: هود / 40). همچنین چه بسا طوفان نوح بخش بزرگی از معموره زمین را فرا گرفته باشد (نگا: التفسیر القرآنی للقرآن) مگر در بخشهای دیگر مردمانی نبوده‌اند و زاد و ولد نداشته‌اند؟ به هر حال، چه این باشد و چه آن، مسأله مهمّی نیست.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و زاد و رود او را ماندگار گرداندیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و فرزندانش را همان بازماندگان (روی زمین) قرار دادیم،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گردانیدیم نژادش را بازماندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و فرزندان او را بازماندگان گردانيديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و تنها فرزندان (صالح) و پیروانش را باقی گذاشتیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And made his progeny survive,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We preserved his descendants.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and We made his seed the survivors,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And his offspring! them We made the survivors.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And, his progeny, them We made the survivors (i.e. Shem, Ham and Japheth).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We made his descendants the survivors.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and made his offspring the only ones to survive,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And, his progeny, them We made the survivors.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And made his seed the survivors,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and made his descendants the survivors,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and We made his offspring the survivors.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We made his descendants those remaining [on the earth]

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and We made his offspring the only survivors.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We made his offspring the survivors.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WajaAAalna thurriyyatahu humu albaqeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and We made his offspring the only survivors.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And made his progeny to endure (on this earth);

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و در میان آیندگان برای او نام نیک به جا گذاشتیم؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و نام نيك او را در نسلهاى بعد باقى نهاديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و در ميان آيندگان [آوازه‌ى نيك‌] او را بر جاى نهاديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و در ميان آيندگان [آوازه نيك‌] او را بر جاى گذاشتيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و در میان آیندگان نام نیکویش بگذاشتیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و نام نیک او را در میان ملّتهای بعدی باقی گذاردیم. [[«تَرَکْنَا عَلَیْهِ ...»: مفعول (تَرَکْنا) ثَناءً محذوف است. یا این که سَلامٌ عَلی نُوحٍ فِی الْعَالَمِینَ است. (نگا: صافّات / 108 و 119 و 129). «الآخِرِینَ»: آیندگان. مراد ذکر جمیل و نام نیک و دعای خیر برای او است که بر زبان همه پیروان ادیان آسمانی جاری می‌گردد (نگا: مریم / 50، شعراء / 84).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و برای او در میان واپسینیان، نام نیک نهادیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و نام نیک او را در میان امّتهای بعد باقی نهادیم.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گذاردیم بر او در پس آیندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و از او نام و ثناى نيك- يا نام و دعوت او را- در ميان پسينيان باقى گذاشتيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و در میان آیندگان بر او (آوازه‌ی نیک) بر جای نهادیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And left (his name) for posterity.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We kept his praise among the latter generations.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and left for him among the later folk

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We left for him among the posterity.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And left for him (a goodly remembrance) among generations to come in later times:

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We left mention of him among those who succeeded.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and We established for him a good name among posterity.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And left for him (a goodly remembrance) among the later generations

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And left for him among the later folk (the salutation):

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and left for him a good name among posterity:

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And We let it remain upon him in the latter:

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We perpetuated his praise in later generations.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We perpetuated to him (praise) among the later generations.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Watarakna AAalayhi fee alakhireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We left mention of him among later generations.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We left (this blessing) for him among generations to come in later times:

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سلام بر نوح در میان جهانیان.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: سلام بر نوح باد، در سراسر جهان.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: درود بر نوح در ميان جهانيان

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: درود بر نوح در ميان جهانيان!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: سلام و تحیّت بر نوح (خدا پرست) در میان عالمیان باد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و آن درود بر نوح، در میان جهانیان است. [[«سَلامٌ عَلی نُوحٍ ...»: اگر واژه (سَلامٌ) خبر مبتدای محذوف (هُوَ) باشد، جمله اخباری است و معنی آن در بالا گذشت. و اگر (سَلامٌ) مبتدا بشمار آید، جمله انشائی و برای دعا است و معنی چنین است: درود خدا تا قیامت بر نوح باد. «فِی الْعَالَمِینَ»: در میان همه جهانیان. مراد تا پایان عمر انسانها و نهایت دنیا است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: در میان جهانیان، سلام بر نوح‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سلام بر نوح در میان جهانیان باد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سلامی بر نوح در جهانیان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سلام بر نوح در ميان جهانيان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سلامی (ربانی) بر نوح در (میان) جهانیان!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Peace on Noah among all men.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Peace be upon Nooh, among the entire people.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: 'Peace be upon Noah among all beings!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Peace be on Nuh among the worlds.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Salamun (peace) be upon Nuh (Noah) (from Us) among the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists)!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Peace be upon Noah among all people.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Peace be upon Noah among all the nations.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Salam (peace!) be upon Nuh among the all creatures!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Peace be unto Noah among the peoples!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘Peace to Noah, throughout the nations!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'Peace be upon Noah among all the worlds'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: "Peace upon Noah among the worlds."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Peace be with Noah among all men in the worlds.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Peace and salutation to Nuh among the nations.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Salamun AAala noohin fee alAAalameena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Peace be upon Noah among all the peoples!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Peace and salutation to Noah among the nations!"

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به راستی ما نیکوکاران را این گونه پاداش می دهیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما نيكوكاران را چنين پاداش مى‌دهيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: ما اين گونه نيكوكاران را پاداش مى‌دهيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: ما اين گونه نيكوكاران را پاداش مى‌دهيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ما نیکوکاران را چنین پاداش می‌دهیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما این گونه نیکوکاران را پاداش خواهیم داد.

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ما بدین‌سان نیکوکاران را جزا می‌دهیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما این گونه نیکوکاران را پاداش می‌دهیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا بدینسان پاداش دهیم به نکوکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: ما نيكوكاران را اينچنين پاداش مى‌دهيم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: ما همانا این گونه نیکوکاران را پاداش (شایسته) می‌دهیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: That is how We reward those who do good.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: This is how We reward the virtuous.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Even so We recompense the good-doers;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily We! thus We recompense the well-doers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, thus We reward the Muhsinun (good-doers - see V. 2:112).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We thus reward the righteous.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Thus do We reward all those who do good.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, thus We reward the gooddoers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! thus do We reward the good.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Thus do We reward the virtuous.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: As such We recompense the gooddoers,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Thus do We reward the righteous ones.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Thus do We surely reward the doers of good.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna kathalika najzee almuhsineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: That is how We recompense the righteous:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Thus indeed do we reward those who do right.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید او از بندگان مؤمن ما بود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: او از بندگان مؤمن ما بود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: به راستى او از بندگان مؤمن ما بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: به راستى او از بندگان مؤمن ما بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که او به حقیقت از بندگان با ایمان ما بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: چرا که او از بندگان با ایمان ما بود.

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که او از بندگان مؤمن ما بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: چرا که او از بندگان باایمان ما بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که او است همانا از بندگان ما مؤمنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا او از بندگان مؤمن ما بود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: به‌راستی او از بندگان باایمان ماست.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Surely he was among Our faithful creatures.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He is indeed one of Our high ranking, firmly believing bondmen.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: he was among Our believing servants.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily he was of Our bondmen believing.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, he [Nuh (Noah)] was one of Our believing slaves.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He was one of Our believing servants.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Surely he was one of Our truly believing servants.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, he [Nuh] was one of Our believing servants.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! he is one of Our believing slaves.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He is indeed one of Our faithful servants.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: he was one of Our believing worshipers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He was one of Our believing servants.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely he was of Our believing servants.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Innahu min AAibadina almumineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: he was truly one of Our faithful servants.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: For he was one of our believing Servants.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سپس دیگران را غرق کردیم؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: سپس ديگران را غرقه ساختيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سپس ديگران را غرق كرديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: سپس ديگران را غرق كرديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن گاه دیگران را همه غرق دریای هلاک گردانیدیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سپس دیگران را غرق کردیم. [[«ثُمَّ»: بعد از نجات نوح و همراهان. «الآخَرِینَ»: دیگران. مراد قوم کافر نوح است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس دیگران را غرقه ساختیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس دیگران [= دشمنان او] را غرق کردیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سپس غرق ساختیم دگران را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سپس ديگران را غرق كرديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس دیگران را غرق کردیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Afterwards We drowned the others.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: We then drowned the others.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then afterwards We drowned the rest.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then We drowned the others.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then We drowned the other (disbelievers and polytheists, etc.).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then We drowned the others.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Thereafter We caused the others to be drowned.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then We drowned the others.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then We did drown the others.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then We drowned the rest.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Afterwards We drowned the others.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then We drowned the disbelievers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We drowned all the others (besides Noah and his people).

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then We drowned the others

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma aghraqna alakhareena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We drowned the rest.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then the rest we overwhelmed in the Flood.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و به راستی ابراهیم از پیروان نوح بود،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ابراهيم از پيروان او بود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و بى‌گمان، ابراهيم از پيروان او بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و بى‌گمان، ابراهيم از پيروان اوست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و از پیروان نوح (در دعوت به توحید و خدا پرستی) به حقیقت ابراهیم (خلیل) بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: از زمره‌ی دنباله‌روان نوح (در اصول دین، و پیمودن راه او در دعوت به توحید و خداشناسی) ابراهیم بود. [[«شِیعَةِ»: پیرو. دنباله‌رو. مراد از پیروی و دنباله‌روی، تداوم خطّ فکری و مکتبی است. به عبارت دیگر: انبیاء، همه مبلّغان یک مکتب و استادان یک دانشگاه هستند، و توحید و عدل و تقوا و اخلاص و بسیاری دیگر از کردارهای پسندیده و خصال حمیده، تغییرناپذیر و شیوه متّبع همه فرستادگان خدا بوده است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و ابراهیم جزو پیروان او بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و از پیروان او ابراهیم بود؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و هر آینه از پیروان وی است ابراهیم‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه از پيروان او ابراهيم بود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بی‌گمان، ابراهیم به‌راستی از پیروان او بود.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And Abraham indeed was of his inducement,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed Ibrahim is from his (Nooh’s) group.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Of his party was also Abraham;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily of his sect was Ibrahim.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And, verily, among those who followed his [Nuh's (Noah)] way (Islamic Monotheism) was Ibrahim (Abraham).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Of his kind was Abraham.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Abraham was on the self-same way (as Noah).

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily, among those who followed his way was Ibrahim.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! of his persuasion verily was Abraham

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed Abraham was among his followers,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Of his party was Abraham.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, among his kind was Abraham,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Abraham was one of his followers.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely Ibrahim followed his way.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainna min sheeAAatihi laibraheema

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Abraham was of the same faith:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Verily among those who followed his Way was Abraham.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: هنگامی که با دلی پاک به سوی پروردگارش آمد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنگاه كه با دلى رسته از ترديد روى به پروردگارش آورد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آن‌گاه كه با دلى پاك به [پيشگاه‌] پروردگارش روى آورد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنگاه كه با دلى پاك به [پيشگاه‌] پروردگارش آمد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که با قلبی پاک و سالم (از شرک) به سوی پروردگار خویش آمد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: وقتی که با قلب سالم (زدوده از شرک) رو به پروردگارش آورد. [[«سَلِیمٍ»: سالم. پاک از شرک. «قَلْبٍ سَلِیمٍ»: (نگا: شعراء / 89).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: چنین بود که دل پاک و پیراسته [از شک و شرک‌] به درگاه پروردگارش آورد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (به خاطر بیاور) هنگامی را که با قلب سلیم به پیشگاه پروردگارش آمد؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گاهی که آمد پروردگار خویش را با دلی سالم‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنگاه كه با دلى پاك و رسته به سوى پروردگار خويش آمد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: چون با دلی بس سالم به (پیشگاهِ) پروردگارش آمد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When he came to his Lord with a heart compliant,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: When he came to his Lord, with a sound heart. (Free from falsehood).

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: when he came unto his Lord with a pure heart,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Recall what time he came Unto his lord with a heart whole.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: When he came to his Lord with a pure heart [attached to Allah Alone and none else, worshipping none but Allah Alone true Islamic Monotheism, pure from the filth of polytheism].

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: When he came to his Lord with a sound heart.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: When he came to his Lord with a pure heart,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: When he came to his Lord with a Salim heart.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: When he came unto his Lord with a whole heart;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: when he came to his Lord with a sound heart [untainted by sin].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (Remember when) he came to his Lord with a pure heart;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: When he came to his Lord with a sound heart

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He turned to his Lord with a sound heart

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: When he came to his Lord with a free heart,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ith jaa rabbahu biqalbin saleemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: he came to his Lord with a sound heart.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Behold! he approached his Lord with a sound heart.

verses.text: إِذْ قَالَ‌ لِأَبِيهِ‌ وَ قَوْمِهِ‌ مَا ذَا تَعْبُدُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [یاد کن] هنگامی را که به پدر و قومش گفت: چیست آنچه می پرستید؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به پدرش و قومش گفت: چه مى‌پرستيد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: چون به پدر و قوم خود گفت: [اينها] چيست كه مى‌پرستيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: چون به پدر[خوانده‌] و قوم خود گفت: «چه مى‌پرستيد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: هنگامی که با پدر (یعنی عموی) خود و قومش گفت: شما به پرستش چه مشغولید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: زمانی به پدر و قوم خود گفت: اینها چه چیزند که می‌پرستید؟! [[«مَاذَا»: اینها چه چیزند؟ سؤال، جنبه تحقیر بتها و ناپسند شمردن کار پدر را دارد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه که به پدرش و قومش گفت چه چیزی را می‌پرستید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هنگامی که به پدر و قومش گفت: «اینها چیست که می‌پرستید؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: هنگامی که گفت به پدر خویش و قومش چه را می‌پرستید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هنگامى كه به پدر- سرپرست- و قوم خود گفت: اين چيست كه مى‌پرستيد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: چون به پدر (تربیتی) خود و قوم خود گفت: «چه چیزی را می‌پرستید؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When he said to his father and his people: "What is this you worship?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: When he said to his father (paternal uncle) and his people, “What do you worship?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: when he said to his father and his folk, 'What do you serve?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Recall what time he said Unto his father and his people: What is it that ye worship?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: When he said to his father and to his people: "What is it that which you worship?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said to his father and his people, “What are you worshiping?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and said to his father and his people: “Whom do you worship?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: When he said to his father and to his people: "What is it that which you worship"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: When he said unto his father and his folk: What is it that ye worship?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: When he said to his father and his people, ‘What is it that you are worshiping?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and when he said to his father and to his nation: 'What do you worship?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [And] when he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and asked his father and his people, "What is that you worship?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: When he said to his father and his people: What is it that you worship?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ith qala liabeehi waqawmihi matha taAAbudoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: "Behold!" he said to his father and to his people, "What are these that you worship?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Behold! he said to his father and to his people, "What is that which ye worship?

verses.text: أَ إِفْکاً آلِهَةً دُونَ‌ اللَّهِ‌ تُرِيدُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا به جای خدا معبودان دروغین را می خواهید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا به جاى خداى يكتا، خدايان دروغين را مى‌خواهيد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا غير از خداوند خدايان دروغين را مى‌خواهيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا غير از آنها، به دروغ، خدايانى [ديگر] مى‌خواهيد؟!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا رواست که به دروغ خدایانی به جای خدای یکتا بر می‌گزینید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا غیر از خدا، خواستار معبودهای سراپا دروغ هستید؟! [[«إِفْکاً»: دروغ محض. کثیف‌ترین دروغ (نگا: نور / 11 و 12، فرقان / 4، سبأ / 43، احقاف / 11، عنکبوت / 17). «أَإِفْکاً آلِهَةً»: همزه برای استفهام توبیخی است. واژه (إِفْکاً) می‌تواند مفعول به و واژه (آلِهَةً) بدل، و یا این که (إِفْکاً) مفعول له و (آلِهَةً) مفعول به باشد. در صورت اخیر، معنی آیه چنین می‌شود: آیا محض دروغ، معبودهائی جز خدا را خواستارید؟]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا به دروغ و دغل در هوای خدایانی به جای خداوند هستید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا غیر از خدا به سراغ این معبودان دروغین می‌روید؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا به دروغ خدایانی را جز خدا خواهید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا به جاى خداى يكتا خدايانى دروغين- بتان- را مى‌خواهيد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «آیا به گزاف و انحراف خدایانی (دروغین) را جز خدا(ی راستین) می‌خواهید؟!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Why do you solicit false gods instead of God?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “What! You desire, through fabrication, Gods other than Allah?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Is it a calumny, gods apart from God, that you desire?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Is it a falsehood-god beside Allah - that ye desire?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Is it a falsehood aliha (gods) other than Allah that you seek?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Is it falsified gods, instead of God, that you want?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Is it false deities that you want to serve rather than Allah?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Is it a falsehood -- gods other than Allah -- that you desire"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Is it a falsehood - gods beside Allah - that ye desire?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Is it a lie, gods other than Allah, that you desire?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It is falsehood that you desire gods other than Allah!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Is it falsehood [as] gods other than Allah you desire?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do you want to worship false idols as your lords besides God?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: A lie-- gods besides Allah-- do you desire?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Aifkan alihatan doona Allahi tureedoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Would you serve false deities instead of God?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Is it a falsehood- gods other than Allah- that ye desire?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس گمانتان به پروردگار جهانیان چیست؟ [که غیر او را می پرستید،]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به پروردگار جهانيان چه گمان داريد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس به پروردگار جهانيان چه گمان داريد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس گمانتان به پروردگار جهانها چيست؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس در این صورت به خدای جهانیان چه گمان می‌برید (و از قهر و انتقام خدا چگونه نمی‌ترسید).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آخر، شما درباره‌ی پروردگار جهانیان چگونه می‌اندیشید؟! [[«فَمَا ظَنُّکُمْ ...»: آیا گمان می‌برید خدای جهانیان نیاز به انبازهائی برای اداره جهان هستی دارد؟ آیا اگر افرادی یا بتهائی را همچون خدا منشأ اثر بدانید، فردای قیامت، خدا به شما چه خواهد گفت و چه خواهد کرد و شما چه پاسخی دارید که بدو بدهید؟]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس گمانتان درباره پروردگار جهانیان چیست؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: شما درباره پروردگار عالمیان چه گمان می‌برید؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا چیست گمان شما به پروردگار جهانیان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس گمان شما به پروردگار جهانيان چيست؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «پس گمانتان به پروردگار جهانیان چیست‌؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: What do you imagine the Lord of the worlds to be?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “So what do you assume regarding the Lord Of The Creation?” (That He will not punish you?)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What think you then of the Lord of all Being?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: what, then, is your opinion of the Lord of the worlds?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Then what do you think about the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns, and all that exists)?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So what is your opinion about the Lord of the Worlds?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: What do you think of the Lord of the whole Universe?”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Then what think you about the Lord of the all that exists"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: What then is your opinion of the Lord of the Worlds?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then what is your idea about the Lord of all the worlds?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: What do you think of the Lord of the Worlds'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then what is your thought about the Lord of the worlds?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: What do you think about the Lord of the Universe?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: What is then your idea about the Lord of the worlds?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fama thannukum birabbi alAAalameena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: What do you think of the Lord of the Worlds?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Then what is your idea about the Lord of the worlds?"

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [چون از او دعوت کردند که شبانه به مراسم عیدشان برود] نگاهی به ستارگان انداخت،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نگاهى به ستارگان كرد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس نظرى به ستارگان افكند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس نظرى به ستارگان افكند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن گاه (ابراهیم تدبیری اندیشید و) به ستارگان آسمان نگاهی کرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سپس نگاهی به ستارگان انداخت. (انگار می‌خواهد از اوضاع کواکب، حوادث آینده را پیش‌بینی کند). [[«نَظَرَ نَظْرَةً ...»: نگاه ابراهیم به ستارگان آسمانی، جنبه مطالعه در اسرار آفرینش بود، هر چند ایشان آن را نگاه منجّمانه می‌پنداشتند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس نگاهی به ستارگان انداخت‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (سپس) نگاهی به ستارگان افکند...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس نگریست نگریستنی در ستارگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس با نگاهى به ستارگان درنگريست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس (آن‌گاه) نظری (ظاهری) در ستارگان افکند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then he looked up at the stars (they worshipped),

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He then shot a glance at the stars.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And he cast a glance at the stars,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then he glanced a glance on the stars.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then he cast a glance at the stars (to deceive them),

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then he took a glance at the stars.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then he looked carefully at the stars

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then he cast a glance at the stars,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And he glanced a glance at the stars

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then he made an observation of the stars

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He cast a glance at the stars

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And he cast a look at the stars

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The people invited him to attend their feast). Then he looked at the stars

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then he looked at the stars, looking up once,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fanathara nathratan fee alnnujoomi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He looked up at the stars.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then did he cast a glance at the Stars.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و گفت: به راستی من بیمارم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و گفت: من بيمارم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و گفت: من بيمارم [و با شما به مراسم عيد نمى‌آيم‌]

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و گفت: «من كسالت دارم!»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و با قومش گفت که من بیمارم (و نتوانم به جشن عید بتان آیم).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گفت: من ناخوش هستم. (روحم از این کفر و شرک و ظلم بیمار است). [[«سَقِیمٌ»: بیمار. «إِنِّی سَقِیمٌ»: مرادِ ابراهیم، بیماری روح و آزار دل از پندارگرائی و اوهام‌پرستی مردم، و برداشت ایشان از سخن او بیماری ظاهری بود. به این ترتیب عذر خود را از عدم شرکت در جشن سالیانه ایشان خواست. گویا سحرگاهان غذاهائی در کنار بتها می‌نهادند تا متبرّک شود، و خودشان از شهر بیرون می‌رفتند. شامگاهان از مراسم صحرا برمی‌گشتند و از آن خوراکیها می‌خوردند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و گفت من بیمارم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و گفت: «من بیمارم (و با شما به مراسم جشن نمی‌آیم)!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس گفت همانا منم بیمار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آنگاه گفت: همانا من بيمارم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس گفت: «من به‌راستی بیمارم!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And said: "I am sick (of what you worship)!"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He then said, “I feel sick (of you)!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and he said, 'Surely I am sick.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And he said: verily I am about to be sick.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And he said: "Verily, I am sick (with plague. He did this trick to remain in their temple of idols to destroy them and not to accompany them to the pagan's feast)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And said, “I am sick.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and said: “I am sick.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And he said: "Verily, I am sick."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then said: Lo! I feel sick!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and said, ‘Indeed I am sick!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and said: 'Surely, I am sick (of what you worship)'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And said, "Indeed, I am [about to be] ill."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and said, "I am sick!"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then he said: Surely I am sick (of your worshipping these).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faqala innee saqeemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: And said, "I am sick,"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And he said, "I am indeed sick (at heart)!"

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس پشت کنان از او روی گرداندند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: از او رويگردان شدند و بازگشتند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس از او روى گرداندند و برگشتند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس پشت‌كنان از او روى برتافتند!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: قوم از او دست کشیده برگشتند (و از بتخانه در پی نشاط عید به باغ و صحرا شتافتند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان بدو پشت کردند و (به دنبال مراسم خود) رفتند. [[«فَتَوَلَّوْا عَنْهُ مُدْبِرِینَ»: (نگا: توبه / 25، انبیاء / 57، نمل / 80، روم / 52).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه به او پشت کردند [و تنهایش گذاشتند]

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها از او روی برتافته و به او پشت کردند (و بسرعت دور شدند.)

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس روی برتافتد از او پشت‌کنندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس، از او روى گردانده برگشتند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس پشت‌کنان از او روی برتافتند!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But they turned their backs on him and went away.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And they turned their backs on him and went away. (The pagans thought he would transmit the disease).

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But they went away from him, turning their backs.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So they departed from him turning their backs.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So they turned away from him, and departed (for fear of the disease).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But they turned their backs on him, and went away.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So turning their backs, they went away from him.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So they turned away from him and departed.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they turned their backs and went away from him.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So they went away leaving him behind.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But they turned their backs and went away from him.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So they turned away from him, departing.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: All the people turned away from him

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So they went away from him, turning back.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fatawallaw AAanhu mudbireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: so they turned their backs on him and went off.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So they turned away from him, and departed.

verses.text: فَرَاغَ‌ إِلَى‌ آلِهَتِهِمْ‌ فَقَالَ‌ أَ لاَ تَأْکُلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: او هم مخفیانه به سوی بت هایشان رفت و [از روی ریشخند] گفت: آیا غذا نمی خورید؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پنهانى نزد خدايانشان آمد و گفت: چيزى نمى‌خوريد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس مخفيانه به سوى خدايانشان رفت و [به ريشخند] گفت: چرا چيزى نمى‌خوريد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: تا نهانى به سوى خدايانشان رفت و [به ريشخند] گفت: «آيا غذا نمى‌خوريد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ابراهیم (که بتخانه را خلوت یافت) قصد بتهای آنان کرد و گفت: آیا شما غذا نمی‌خورید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: شتابان و نهان، به سراغ معبودهای ایشان رفت (و تمسخرکنان فریاد زد) و گفت: آیا (از غذاهای رنگارنگ) نمی‌خورید؟ [[«رَاغَ»: مخفیانه و شتابان رفت. به نهانی رو کرد به.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: رو به خدایانشان آورد و گفت چرا [چیزی‌] نمی‌خورید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (او وارد بتخانه شد) مخفیانه نگاهی به معبودانشان کرد و از روی تمسخر گفت: «چرا (از این غذاها) نمی‌خورید؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس خرامید (خزید) بسوی خدایان ایشان پس گفت چرا نمی‌خورید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس پنهانى به سوى خدايانشان رفت و گفت: آيا چيزى نمى‌خوريد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس نهانی با حیله‌ای (ایمانی) به سوی خدایانشان تمایل کرد. پس گفت: «آیا (غذا) نمی‌خورید؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then he turned towards their gods and said: "Why do you not eat (of these offerings)?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He then sneaked upon their deities and said, “Do you not eat?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then he turned to their gods, and said, 'What do you eat?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then he slipped Unto their gods and said: eat ye not

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then he turned to their aliha (gods) and said: "Will you not eat (of the offering before you)?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then he turned to their gods, and said, “will you not eat?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then he went quietly to the (temple of the deities) and said: “What is the matter with you, why do you not eat?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then he turned to their gods and said: "Will you not eat"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then turned he to their gods and said: Will ye not eat?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then he stole away to their gods and said, ‘Will you not eat?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then he turned to their gods, and said: 'What do you eat?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then he turned to their gods and said, "Do you not eat?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and he turned to their idols and asked them, "Do you eat?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then he turned aside to their gods secretly and said: What! do you not eat?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faragha ila alihatihim faqala ala takuloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He turned to their gods and said, "Do you not eat?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then did he turn to their gods and said, "will ye not eat (of the offerings before you)?...

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: شما را چه شده که سخن نمی گویید؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چرا سخن نمى‌گوييد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: شما را چه شده كه سخن نمى‌گوييد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: شما را چه شده كه سخن نمى‌گوييد؟!»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: چرا سخن نمی‌گویید؟ (شما چه خدایان بی‌اثر باطلی هستید!)

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: شما را چه شده است که حرف نمی‌زنید؟ [[«مَا لَکُمْ»: شما را چه شده است؟]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: شما را چه می‌شود چرا سخن نمی‌گویید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (اصلاً) چرا سخن نمی‌گویید؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: چه شود شما را که سخن نگوئید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: شما را چيست كه سخن نمى‌گوييد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «شما را چه شده که سخن نمی‌گویید؟!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: What is wrong with you that you do not speak?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “What is the matter with you, that you do not say anything?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What ails you, that you speak not?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: What aileth ye that ye speak not?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "What is the matter with you that you speak not?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: What is it with you, that you do not speak?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: What is the matter with you, why do you not speak?”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "What is the matter with you that you speak not"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
