translations.text: What aileth you that ye speak not?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Why do you not speak?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: What is the matter with you, that you do not speak'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: What is [wrong] with you that you do not speak?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Why do you not speak?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: What is the matter with you that you do not speak?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ma lakum la tantiqoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: What is the matter with you that you do not speak?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "What is the matter with you that ye speak not (intelligently)?"

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس [به آنها روی آورد و] با دست راست ضربه ای کاری بر آنها کوبید [و خردشان کرد.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و در نهان، دستى به قوت بر آنها زد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس مخفيانه با دست راست ضربتى بر سر آنها كوفت [و آنها را در هم شكست‌]

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس با دست راست، بر سر آنها زدن گرفت!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و محکم (با تبر) بر بتان زد (و جز بت بزرگ همه را درهم شکست).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: با قدرت هر چه بیشتر ضربه‌های سخت و پیاپی بر آنها فرو کوفت. [[«رَاغَ عَلَیْهِمْ»: از بالا بر آنها فرو کوفت. «بِالْیَمِینِ»: با دست راست. با قدرت و قوّت (نگا: زمر / 67). «رَاغَ عَلَیْهِمْ ضَرْباً»: واژه (ضَرْباً) می‌تواند مفعول مطلق (رَاغَ) به اعتبار معنی باشد. چرا که معنی چنین است: ضَرَبَهُمْ ضَرْباً. یا این که مصدر است و در معنی اسم فاعل است: رَاغَ عَلَیْهِمْ ضَارِباً. و یا این که مفعول له و معنی آن چنین است: برای زدن به سراغشان رفت.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس [نهانی‌] بر آنان ضربه‌ای به شدت فرود آورد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس بسوی آنها رفت و ضربه‌ای محکم با دست راست بر پیکر آنها فرود آورد (و جز بت بزرگ، همه را درهم شکست).

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس روی آورد بر ایشان می‌نواخت با دست راست‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس نهانى بر آنها با دست راست- به قوت- ضربتى زد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس با دست راست، به گونه‌ای پنهان و حیله‌گرانه بر (سرها)شان کوبید!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then he started striking them down with his right hand.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He then began striking them with his right hand, unseen by the people.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And he turned upon them smiting them with his right hand.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then he slipped Unto them striking them with the right hand.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then he turned upon them, striking (them) with (his) right hand.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then he turned on them, striking with his right hand.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then he turned upon them, striking them with his right hand,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then he turned upon them, striking (them) with (his) right hand.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then he attacked them, striking with his right hand.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then he attacked them, striking forcefully.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And he turned upon them striking them with the right hand.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And he turned upon them a blow with [his] right hand.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He struck them with his right hand.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then he turned against them secretly, smiting them with the right hand.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faragha AAalayhim darban bialyameeni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: then he turned on them, striking them down with his right hand.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then did he turn upon them, striking (them) with the right hand.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: مردم با شتاب به سوی او آمدند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: قومش شتابان نزدش آمدند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس [قومش‌] شتابان به سوى او روى آوردند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: تا دوان دوان سوى او روى‌آور شدند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: قوم (آگه شدند و) با شتاب (از پی انتقام) به سوی او آمدند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: به طرف ابراهیم دوان دوان آمدند (و همچون شترمرغ بال گرفتند، و او را فرو کوفتند). [[«یَزِفُّونَ»: می‌شتافتند. به تک ایستادند. حال ضمیر (و) در فعل (أَقْبَلُوا) است. زَفّ و زَفیف، دویدن شترمرغ را می‌گویند، بدان گاه که رفتن و پرواز را آمیزه یکدیگر می‌سازد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه شتابان رو به سوی او آوردند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها با سرعت به او روی آوردند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس روی آوردند بسویش به انبوه دوندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آنان شتابان به نزد او آمدند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس شتابان سویش روان شدند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So the people descended upon him.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So the disbelievers came running towards him.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then came the others to him hastening.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then they advanced toward him, hastening.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then they (the worshippers of idols) came, towards him, hastening.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And they came running towards him.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: whereupon people came to him running.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then they came hastily towards him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And (his people) came toward him, hastening.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They came running towards him.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Thereafter they (the people) came to him in haste.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then the people came toward him, hastening.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Thereupon the people came running to him.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So they (people) advanced towards him, hastening.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faaqbaloo ilayhi yaziffoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: His people came rushing towards him,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then came (the worshippers) with hurried steps, and faced (him).

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [به آنان] گفت: آیا آنچه را [با دست خود] می تراشید، می پرستید؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: آيا چيزهايى را كه خود مى‌تراشيد مى‌پرستيد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [ابراهيم‌] گفت: آيا آنچه را كه [با دست خود] مى‌تراشيد، مى‌پرستيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [ابراهيم‌] گفت: «آيا آنچه را مى‌تراشيد، مى‌پرستيد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ابراهیم گفت: آیا رواست که شما چیزی به دست خود بتراشید و آن را پرستش کنید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (ابراهیم بدیشان) گفت: آیا چیزهائی را می‌پرستید که خودتان می‌تراشید؟ [[«تَنْحِتُونَ»: می‌تراشید (نگا: اعراف / 74، شعراء / 149).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [ابراهیم‌] گفت آیا چیزی را که [با دست خود] تراشیده‌اید می‌پرستید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفت: «آیا چیزی را می‌پرستید که با دست خود می‌تراشید؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت آیا می‌پرستید آنچه را می‌تراشید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: آيا آنچه را خود مى تراشيد مى‌پرستيد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (ابراهیم) گفت: «آیا آنچه را (خود) می‌تراشید، می‌پرستید؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "Why do you worship these you carve yourselves," he asked,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “What! You worship what you yourselves have sculpted?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He said, 'Do you serve what you hew,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: worship ye that which carve.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He said: "Worship you that which you (yourselves) carve?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “Do you worship what you carve?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Abraham said to them: “Do you worship what you yourselves have carved with your own hands

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He said: "Worship you that which you (yourselves) carve"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: Worship ye that which ye yourselves do carve

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘Do you worship what you have yourselves carved,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He said: 'Do you worship what you, yourselves have carved

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He said, "Do you worship that which you [yourselves] carve,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He said, "How can you worship what you yourselves have carved

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Said he: What! do you worship what you hew out?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala ataAAbudoona ma tanhitoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: but he said, "How can you worship things you carve with your own hands,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He said: "Worship ye that which ye have (yourselves) carved?

verses.text: وَ اللَّهُ‌ خَلَقَکُمْ‌ وَ مَا تَعْمَلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در حالی که خدا شما را و آنچه را می سازید، آفریده است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خداى يكتاست كه شما و هر چه مى‌سازيد، آفريده است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: حال آن كه خداوند هم شما را آفريده و هم آنچه را كه مى‌سازيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: با اينكه خدا شما و آنچه را كه برمى‌سازيد آفريده است!»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در صورتی که شما و آنچه (از بتان) می‌سازید همه را خدا آفریده.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: خداوند هم شما را آفریده است، و هم بتهائی را که می‌سازید. [[«مََا تَعْمَلُونَ»: اگر واژه (ما) موصوله به شمار آید، معنی چنین است: خدا هم شما را آفریده است، و هم ساخته‌هایتان را که بتها است. و اگر (مَا) مصدریّه به حساب آید، مفهوم این می‌شود که خداوند هم شما را آفریده است و هم اعمال شما را. از آنجا که بحث از بتها است؛ نه از اعمال آدمی، آیه مورد نظر، ناظر به این معنی نیست. تازه اگر چنین هم باشد، بیانگر این واقعیّت است که اعمال انسانها هر چند به اراده آنان انجام می‌گیرد، امّا اراده و قدرت بر تصمیم‌گیری و نیروهای دیگری که افعال خود را با آن انجام می‌دهند، همه از ناحیه خدا است. اگر هم بر بتها «ساخته‌های انسان» اطلاق می‌شود، به خاطر شکلی است که انسان بدانها می‌دهد، وگرنه ماده آنها را خدا آفریده است. این سخن درست به آن می‌ماند که می‌گویند: این فرش، آن خانه، و آن اتومبیل، ساخته انسان است. مسلّماً منظور این نیست که انسان موادّ آنها را ساخته است. بلکه مراد این است که صورت آنها با دست انسان شکل می‌پذیرد و تغییر ظاهر می‌دهد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و حال آنکه خداوند شما را و چیزهایی را که بر سر آنها کار می‌کنید، آفریده است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: با اینکه خداوند هم شما را آفریده و هم بتهایی که می‌سازید!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و خدا آفریدتان با آنچه می‌سازید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و حال آنكه خداوند شما را و آنچه مى‌كنيد بيافريد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «حال آنکه خدا شما و آنچه را که می‌‌سازید آفریده است!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "When God has created you and what you make?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Whereas Allah has created you and your actions?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and God created you and what you make?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Whereas Allah hath created you and that which ye make?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "While Allah has created you and what you make!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: When God created you, and what you manufacture?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: while it is Allah Who has created you and all that you make?”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "While Allah has created you and what you make!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: When Allah hath created you and what ye make?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: when Allah has created you and whatever you make?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: when it is Allah who created you and all that you do'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: While Allah created you and that which you do?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: even though God created both you and that which you have made?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And Allah has created you and what you make.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WaAllahu khalaqakum wama taAAmaloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: when it is God who has created you and all your handiwork?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "But Allah has created you and your handwork!"

verses.text: قَالُوا ابْنُوا لَهُ‌ بُنْيَاناً فَأَلْقُوهُ‌ فِي‌ الْجَحِيمِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفتند: برای او بنایی بسازید [که گنجایش آتش فراوانی داشته باشد] پس او را در آتش شعلهور بیندازید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفتند: برايش بنايى برآوريد و در آتشش اندازيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفتند: برايش بنايى بسازيد و او را در جهنمى [از آتش‌] افكنيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفتند: «برايش [كوره‌]خانه‌اى بسازيد و در آتشش بيندازيد»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (قوم حجت و برهانش نشنیدند و) گفتند: باید بر او آتشخانه‌ای بسازید و او را در آتش افکنید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (مشرکان فریاد زدند و به یکدیگر) گفتند: برای او چهاردیواری بزرگی بسازید (و در میان آن آتش بیفروزید) و او را به میان آتش سوزان و پر اخگر بیفکنید. [[«بُنْیَاناً»: ساختمان (نگا: توبه / 109 و 110، نحل / 26، کهف / 21). در اینجا مراد چهار دیواری است. «الْجَحِیمِ»: آتش عظیم و سوزان و پر اخگر. نامی از نامهای دوزخ.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفتند برای او بنایی بر آورید، و او را در آتش بیندازید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (بت‌پرستان) گفتند: «بنای مرتفعی برای او بسازید و او را در جهنّمی از آتش بیفکنید!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفتند بنیاد نهید برایش بنیانی پس بیفکنیدش در دوزخ‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [نمرود و قومش‌] گفتند: برايش بنائى سازيد و او را در آتش اندازيد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفتند: «برایش سازمانی (جهنمی) بسازید، پس او را در (آن) جهنم بیفکنید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "Build a pyre for him and throw him into the raging fire."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They said, “Construct a building (furnace) for him, and then cast him in the blazing fire!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They said, 'Build him a building, and cast him into the furnace!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They said. build for him a building and cast him into the flaming fire.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They said: "Build for him a building (it is said that the building was like a furnace) and throw him into the blazing fire!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They said, “Build a pyre for him, and throw him into the furnace.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They spoke among themselves: “Build him a pyre and then throw him into the furnace.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They said: "Build for him a building and throw him into the blazing fire!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They said: Build for him a building and fling him in the red-hotfire.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They said, ‘Build a structure for him and cast him into a huge fire.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They replied: 'Build for him a building and cast him into the fire'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They said, "Construct for him a furnace and throw him into the burning fire."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They said, "Let us build a fire and throw him into the flames".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They said: Build for him a furnace, then cast him into the burning fire.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qaloo ibnoo lahu bunyanan faalqoohu fee aljaheemi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They said, "Build a pyre for him and throw him into the blaze!"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They said, "Build him a furnace, and throw him into the blazing fire!"

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس خواستند به او نیرنگی زنند، ولی ما آنان را پست و شکست خورده کردیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خواستند تا بدانديشى كنند، ما نيز آنها را زيردست گردانيديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس طرحى براى [نابودى‌] او ريختند ولى ما آنها را پست و [مغلوب‌] ساختيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس خواستند به از نيرنگى زنند؛ و[لى‌] ما آنان را پست گردانيديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: نمرودیان قصد مکر و ستمش کردند ما هم آنان را خوار و نابود ساختیم (و آتش را بر او گلستان کردیم).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (خلاصه، آنان) برای نابودی ابراهیم نقشه‌ای پی افکندند و نیرنگی اندیشیدند، ولی ما (او را نجات دادیم و والایش کردیم، و) آنان را پست و حقیر و مغلوب و ذلیل نمودیم. [[«کَیْداً»: نیرنگ. چاره‌اندیشی. در اینجا طرح نابودی ابراهیم و نقشه برچیدن اثرات تبلیغ قولی و عملی او مراد است. «الأسْفَلِینَ»: پستان و خواران. به زیر افتادگان و شکست خوردگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه در حق او بد سگالیدند، ولی آنان را فرودست گرداندیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها طرحی برای نابودی ابراهیم ریخته بودند، ولی ما آنان را پست و مغلوب ساختیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و خواستند بدو نیرنگی را پس گردانیدیمشان پست‌شدگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و براى او نيرنگ و ترفندى خواستند، پس آنان را فروتر ساختيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس خواستند به او نیرنگی زنند. پس ما آنان را پست‌ترین (آفریدگان) گردانیدیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So they contrived a plot against him, but We made them abject.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So they tried to execute their evil scheme upon him – We therefore degraded them. (Allah saved him, by commanding the fire to turn cool).

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They desired to outwit him; so We made them the lower ones.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they devised a plot for him, but We made them the humble.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So they plotted a plot against him, but We made them the lowest.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They wished him ill, but We made them the losers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They had contrived an evil plan against him, but We abased them all.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, they plotted a plot against him, but We made them the lowest.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they designed a snare for him, but We made them the undermost.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So they sought to outwit him, but We made them the lowermost.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Their desire was to outwit him, but We made them to be the humiliated.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they intended for him a plan, but We made them the most debased.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They plotted against him, but We brought humiliation upon them.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they desired a war against him, but We brought them low.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faaradoo bihi kaydan fajaAAalnahumu alasfaleena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They wanted to harm him, but We humiliated them all.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (This failing), they then sought a stratagem against him, but We made them the ones most humiliated!

verses.text: وَ قَالَ‌ إِنِّي‌ ذَاهِبٌ‌ إِلَى‌ رَبِّي‌ سَيَهْدِينِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [وقتی از این مهلکه جان سالم به در برد] گفت: به راستی من به سوی پروردگارم می روم، و [او] به زودی مرا راهنمایی خواهد کرد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: من به سوى پروردگارم مى‌روم، او مرا راهنمايى خواهد كرد؛

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و [ابراهيم‌] گفت: من به سوى پروردگارم روانم، زودا كه هدايتم كند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و [ابراهيم‌] گفت: «من به سوى پروردگارم رهسپارم، زودا كه مرا راه نمايد!»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ابراهیم (پس از نجات از بیداد نمرودیان به قومش) گفت: من (با کمال اخلاص) به سوی خدای خود می‌روم که البته هدایتم خواهد فرمود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ابراهیم گفت: من به سوی پروردگارم می‌روم، او مرا رهنمود می‌کند. [[«إِنِّی ذَاهِبٌ إِلی رَبِّی»: بدیهی است خداوند مکانی ندارد. پس مراد مهاجرت از محیط آلوده به محیط پاک است. ابراهیم به دستور خدا به سرزمین انبیاء و کانون وحی الهی، یعنی شام مهاجرت فرمود، و راهنمایش در همه جا خدا بود. لذا سفر إِلیَ الله داشت.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و [ابراهیم‌] گفت من رونده به سوی پروردگارم هستم، که به زودی مرا رهنمایی خواهد کرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (او از این مهلکه بسلامت بیرون آمد) و گفت: «من به سوی پروردگارم می‌روم، او مرا هدایت خواهد کرد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت همانا می‌روم بسوی پروردگار خویش زود است رهبریم کند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و [ابراهيم‌] گفت: همانا من به سوى پروردگار خويش رونده‌ام- از ميان شما هجرت مى كنم-، كه او مرا راه خواهد نمود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و (ابراهیم) گفت: «من همواره سوی پروردگارم رهسپارم. زودا (که) مرا راه نماید!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And he said: "I am going away to my Lord who will show me the way.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And he said, “Indeed I shall go to my Lord Who will guide me.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He said, 'I am going to my Lord; He will guide me.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And he said: verily I am going to my Lord who will guide me.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And he said (after his rescue from the fire): "Verily, I am going to my Lord. He will guide me!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “I am going towards my Lord, and He will guide me.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Abraham said: “I am going to my Lord; He will guide me.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And he said: "Verily, I am going to my Lord. He will guide me!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And he said: Lo! I am going unto my Lord Who will guide me.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘Indeed I am going toward my Lord, who will guide me.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He said: 'I will go to my Lord; He will guide me.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And [then] he said, "Indeed, I will go to [where I am ordered by] my Lord; He will guide me.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Abraham) said, "I will go to my Lord who will guide me".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And he said: Surely I fly to my lord; He will guide me.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waqala innee thahibun ila rabbee sayahdeeni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He said, "I will go to my Lord: He is sure to guide me.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He said: "I will go to my Lord! He will surely guide me!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پروردگارا! مرا فرزندی که از صالحان باشد عطا کن.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اى پروردگار من، مرا فرزندى صالح عطا كن.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [اى‌] پروردگار من! مرا [فرزندى‌] از شايستگان عطا كن

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: «اى پروردگار من! مرا [فرزندى‌] از شايستگان بخش.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بار الها، مرا فرزند صالحی که از بندگان شایسته تو باشد عطا فرما.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پروردگارا! فرزندان شایسته‌ای به من عطاء کن. (فرزندانی که بتوانند کار دعوت را به دست گیرند و برنامه‌ی مرا تداوم بخشند). [[«الصَّالِحِینَ»: شایستگان (نگا: انبیاء / 72 و 86).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پروردگارا به من از شایستگان فرزندی ببخش‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پروردگارا! به من از صالحان [= فرزندان صالح‌] ببخش!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پروردگارا ببخش مرا از شایستگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پروردگار، مرا [فرزندى‌] از نيكان و شايستگان ببخش.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «پروردگارم! برایم (فرزندی) از شایستگان ببخش.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: (And he prayed:) "O Lord, grant me a righteous son."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “My Lord! Give me a meritorious child.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: My Lord, give me one of the righteous.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: My Lord! Bestow on me a son who will be of the righteous.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "My Lord! Grant me (offspring) from the righteous."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “My Lord, give me one of the righteous.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Lord, grant me a righteous son.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "My Lord! Grant me (offspring) from the righteous."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: My Lord! Vouchsafe me of the righteous.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘My Lord! Give me [an heir], one of the righteous.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: My Lord, grant me a righteous (son)'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: My Lord, grant me [a child] from among the righteous."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Abraham prayed, "Lord, grant me a righteous son".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: My Lord! grant me of the doers of good deeds.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Rabbi hab lee mina alssaliheena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Lord, grant me a righteous son."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "O my Lord! Grant me a righteous (son)!"

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس ما او را به پسری بردبار مژده دادیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس او را به پسرى بردبار مژده داديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس پسرى بردبار را به او مژده داديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس او را به پسرى بردبار مژده داديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس مژده پسر بردباری به او دادیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما او را به پسری بردبار و خردمند مژده دادیم. [[«غُلامٍ»: پسر نوجوان (نگا: آل‌عمران / 40، کهف / 74 و 80 و 82). «حَلیمٍ»: شکیبا. خردمند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه او را به فرزندی بردبار مژده دادیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما او [= ابراهیم‌] را به نوجوانی بردبار و صبور بشارت دادیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس نویدش دادیم به پسری خردمند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس او را به پسرى بردبار- اسماعيل- مژده داديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس او را به پسری بردبار مژده دادیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So We gave him the good news of a clement son.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: We therefore gave him the glad tidings of an intelligent son.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then We gave him the good tidings of a prudent boy;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Wherefore We gave him the glad tidings of a boy gentle.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So We gave him the glad tidings of a forbearing boy.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So We gave him good news of a clement boy.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (In response to this prayer) We gave him the good news of a prudent boy;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, We gave him the glad tidings of a forbearing boy.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So We gave him tidings of a gentle son.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So We gave him the good news of a forbearing son.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And We gave him the glad tidings of a very gentle son (Ishmael).

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So We gave him good tidings of a forbearing boy.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We gave him the glad news of the birth of a forbearing son.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So We gave him the good news of a boy, possessing forbearance.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fabashsharnahu bighulamin haleemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We gave him the good news that he would have a patient, forbearing son.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So We gave him the good news of a boy ready to suffer and forbear.

verses.text: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ‌ مَعَهُ‌ السَّعْيَ‌ قَالَ‌ يَا بُنَيَ‌ إِنِّي‌ أَرَى‌ فِي‌ الْمَنَامِ‌ أَنِّي‌ أَذْبَحُکَ‌ فَانْظُرْ مَا ذَا تَرَى‌ قَالَ‌ يَا أَبَتِ‌ افْعَلْ‌ مَا تُؤْمَرُ سَتَجِدُنِي‌ إِنْ‌ شَاءَ اللَّهُ‌ مِنَ‌ الصَّابِرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: هنگامی که با او به [مقام] سعی رسید، گفت: پسرکم! همانا من در خواب می بینم که تو را ذبح می کنم، پس با تأمل بنگر رأی تو چیست؟ گفت: پدرم آنچه به آن مأمور شده ای انجام ده اگر خدا بخواهد مرا از شکیبایان خواهی یافت.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون با پدر به جايى رسيد كه بايد به كار بپردازند، گفت: اى پسركم، در خواب ديده‌ام كه تو را ذبح مى‌كنم. بنگر كه چه مى‌انديشى. گفت: اى پدر، به هر چه مأمور شده‌اى عمل كن، كه اگر خدا بخواهد مرا از صابران خواهى يافت.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و چون او همراه پدر به [سنّ‌] كار و كوشش رسيد، گفت: اى پسرك من! من پيوسته در خواب مى‌بينم كه تو را سر مى‌برم. بنگر كه رأى تو چيست؟ گفت: اى پدر من! آنچه را دستور يافته‌اى انجام ده، اگر خدا بخواهد مرا از صابران خواهى يافت

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و وقتى با او به جايگاه «سعى» رسيد، گفت: «اى پسرك من! من در خواب [چنين‌] مى‌بينم كه تو را سَرْ مى‌بُرم، پس ببين چه به نظرت مى‌آيد؟» گفت: «اى پدر من! آنچه را مأمورى بكن! ان شاء الله مرا از شكيبايان خواهى يافت.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن گاه که (آن پسر رشد یافت و) با او به سعی و عمل شتافت (یا در جهد و عبادت یا در سعی صفا و مروه با پدر همراه شد) ابراهیم گفت: ای فرزند عزیزم، من در عالم خواب چنین می‌بینم که تو را قربانی (راه خدا) می‌کنم، در این واقعه تو را چه نظری است؟ جواب داد: ای پدر، هر چه مأموری انجام ده که ان شاء اللّه مرا از بندگان با صبر و شکیبا خواهی یافت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: وقتی که (او متولّد شد و بزرگ گردید و) به سنّی رسید که بتواند با او به تلاش (در پی معاش) ایستد، ابراهیم بدو گفت: فرزندم! من در خواب چنان می‌بینم که باید تو را سر ببرم (و قربانیت کنم). بنگر نظرت چیست؟ گفت: ای پدر! کاری که به تو دستور داده می‌شود بکن. به خواست خدا مرا از زمره‌ی شکیبایان خواهی یافت. [[«أَری فِی الْمَنَامِ»: در خواب می‌بینم. مراد این است که در خواب به من فرمان داده شده است. چرا که خواب انبیاء وحی بشمار است (نگا: صفوه التفاسیر).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چون در کار و کوشش به پای او رسید، [ابراهیم‌] گفت ای فرزندم من در خواب دیده‌ام که سر تو را می‌برم، بنگر [در این کار] چه می‌بینی؟ [اسماعیل‌] گفت پدر جان آنچه فرمانت داده‌اند، انجام بده، که به زودی مرا به خواست خداوند، از شکیبایان خواهی یافت‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هنگامی که با او به مقام سعی و کوشش رسید، گفت: «پسرم! من در خواب دیدم که تو را ذبح می‌کنم، نظر تو چیست؟» گفت «پدرم! هر چه دستور داری اجرا کن، به خواست خدا مرا از صابران خواهی یافت!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تا گاهی که رسید با وی کوشش (یا دویدن را) گفت ای پسرک من همانا دیدم در خواب که می‌کشمت پس بنگر تا چه می‌بینی گفت ای پدر بکن آنچه را فرمان می‌شوی زود است بیابیم اگر خدا خواهد از شکیبایان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و چون [پسر] به حد كار و كوشش با وى- پدر- رسيد، گفت: اى پسركم، من در خواب مى‌بينم كه تو را گلو مى‌برم، بنگر تا رأى تو چيست؟ گفت: اى پدر من، آنچه فرمان يافته‌اى بكن، كه اگر خداى خواهد مرا از شكيبايان خواهى يافت.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس هنگامی که با او به سَعْی (میان صفا و مروه) رسید، گفت: «فرزندم! من بی‌گمان در خواب (چنان) می‌بینم که تو را بی‌چون سر می‌بُرَم. پس بنگر چه (در) نظر داری‌؟» گفت: «پدرم! آنچه را مأموری به انجام رسان! زودا اگر خدا بخواهد، مرا از شکیبایان خواهی یافت.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When he was old enough to go about with him, he said: "O my son, I dreamt that I was sacrificing you. Consider, what you think?" He replied: "Father, do as you are commanded. If God pleases you will find me firm."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And when he became capable of working with him, Ibrahim said, “O my son, I dreamt that I am sacrificing you – therefore now consider what is your opinion”; he said, “O my father! Do what you are commanded! Allah willing, you will soon find me patiently enduring!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and when he had reached the age of running with him, he said, 'My son, I see in a dream that I shall sacrifice thee; consider, what thinkest thou?' He said, 'My father, do as thou art bidden; thou shalt find me, God willing, one of the steadfast.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And when he attained the age of, running with him, he said: O my son! verily I have seen in a dream that I am slaughtering thee; so look, what considerest thou? He said: O my father! do that which thou art commanded; thou shalt find me, Allah willing, of the patients.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And, when he (his son) was old enough to walk with him, he said: "O my son! I have seen in a dream that I am slaughtering you (offer you in sacrifice to Allah), so look what you think!" He said: "O my father! Do that which you are commanded, Insha' Allah (if Allah will), you shall find me of As-Sabirin (the patient ones, etc.)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then, when he was old enough to accompany him, he said, “O My son, I see in a dream that I am sacrificing you; see what you think.” He said, “O my Father, do as you are commanded; you will find me, God willing, one of the steadfast.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and when he was old enough to go about and work with him, (one day) Abraham said to him: “My son, I see in my dream that I am slaughtering you. So consider (and tell me) what you think.” He said: “Do as you are bidden. You will find me, if Allah so wills, among the steadfast.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And, when he (his son) was old enough to walk with him, he said: "O my son! I have seen in a dream that I am slaughtering you. So look what you think!" He said: "O my father! Do that which you are commanded, if Allah wills, you shall find me of the patient."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And when (his son) was old enough to walk with him, (Abraham) said: O my dear son, I have seen in a dream that I must sacrifice thee. So look, what thinkest thou? He said: O my father! Do that which thou art commanded. Allah willing, thou shalt find me of the steadfast.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: When he was old enough to assist in his endeavour, he said, ‘My son! I see in dreams that I am sacrificing you. See what you think.’ He said, ‘Father! Do whatever you have been commanded. If Allah wishes, you will find me to be patient.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And when he reached the age of traveling with him, he said: 'My son, while I was sleeping I saw that I shall slaughter (sacrifice) you, tell me what is your opinion' He replied: 'Father, do as you are ordered (by Allah). Allah willing, you shall find me one of those who are steadfast'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And when he reached with him [the age of] exertion, he said, "O my son, indeed I have seen in a dream that I [must] sacrifice you, so see what you think." He said, "O my father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, if Allah wills, of the steadfast."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When his son was old enough to work with him, he said, "My son, I have had a dream that I must sacrifice you. What do you think of this?" He replied, "Father, fulfill whatever you are commanded to do and you will find me patient, by the will of God".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And when he attained to working with him, he said: O my son! surely I have seen in a dream that I should sacrifice you; consider then what you see. He said: O my father! do what you are commanded; if Allah please, you will find me of the patient ones.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falamma balagha maAAahu alssaAAya qala ya bunayya innee ara fee almanami annee athbahuka faonthur matha tara qala ya abati ifAAal ma tumaru satajidunee in shaa Allahu mina alssabireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: And when he reached the age when he could work with him, he said, "O my son, I have seen in a dream that I am sacrificing you. So tell me what you think of it!" He replied, "O my father, do as you are commanded; and God willing, you will find me steadfast."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then, when (the son) reached (the age of) (serious) work with him, he said: "O my son! I see in vision that I offer thee in sacrifice: Now see what is thy view!" (The son) said: "O my father! Do as thou art commanded: thou will find me, if Allah so wills one practising Patience and Constancy!"

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس هنگامی که آن دو تسلیم [خواسته خدا] شدند و ابراهیم، جبین او را به زمین نهاد [تا ذبحش کند]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون هر دو تسليم شدند و او را به پيشانى افكند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس وقتى هر دو [بر اين كار] تسليم شدند و پسر را به پيشانى بر خاك افكند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس وقتى هر دو تن دردادند [و همديگر را بدرود گفتند] و [پسر] را به پيشانى بر خاك افكند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس چون هر دو تسلیم امر حق گشتند و او را (برای کشتن) به روی در افکند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هنگامی که (پدر و پسر) هر دو تسلیم (فرمان خدا) شدند (و ابراهیم پسر را روی شنها دراز کشاند) و رخساره‌ی او را بر خاک انداخت. [[«أَسْلَمَا»: تن در دادند. تسلیم قضا و قدر الهی شدند. منقاد فرمان یزدان شدند. «تَلَّهُ»: او را بر خاک انداخت. «لِلْجَبِینِ»: بر رخساره. واژه (لِ) به معنی (عَلی)، و (جَبِین) به معنی رخساره است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه چون هر دو [بر این کار] گردن نهادند و او را بر گونه‌اش به خاک افکند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هنگامی که هر دو تسلیم شدند و ابراهیم جبین او را بر خاک نهاد...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تا گاهی که گردن نهادند هر دو

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس چون هر دو [فرمان خداى را] گردن نهادند و او را بر پيشانى بيفكند ...،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس چون هر دو تن (در برابر امر خدا) سر تسلیم فرود آوردند و پسرک را به پیشانی (بر خاک) افکند،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When they submitted to the will of God, and (Abraham) laid (his son) down prostrate on his temple,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Then (remember) when they both submitted to Allah’s command, and Ibrahim lay his son facing downwards. (The knife did not hurt Ismail)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: When they had surrendered, and he flung him upon his brow,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then when the twain had submitted themselves and he had prostrated him upon his temple.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then, when they had both submitted themselves (to the Will of Allah), and he had laid him prostrate on his forehead (or on the side of his forehead for slaughtering);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then, when they had submitted, and he put his forehead down.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: When both surrendered (to Allah's command) and Abraham flung the son down on his forehead,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then, when they had both submitted themselves, and he had laid him prostrate on his forehead;

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then, when they had both surrendered (to Allah), and he had flung him down upon his face,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So when they had both surrendered [to Allah’s will], and he had laid him down on his forehead,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And when they had both submitted, and his son had laid down prostrate upon his forehead,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And when they had both submitted and he put him down upon his forehead,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When they both agreed and Abraham had lain down his son on the side of his face (for slaughtering),

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So when they both submitted and he threw him down upon his forehead,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falamma aslama watallahu liljabeeni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: When they had both submitted to God, and he had laid his son down on his face,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So when they had both submitted their wills (to Allah), and he had laid him prostrate on his forehead (for sacrifice),

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و او را ندا دادیم که ای ابراهیم!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما ندايش داديم: اى ابراهيم،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: او را ندا داديم كه اى ابراهيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: او را ندا داديم كه اى ابراهيم!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما در آن حال (که کارد به گلویش کشید) خطاب کردیم که ای ابراهیم،

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: فریادش زدیم که: ای ابراهیم! [[«أَنْ»: حرف تفسیریّه است. چرا که ما بعد آن، تفسیر و توضیح ماقبل آن است (نگا: یونس / 2).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ندایش دادیم که ای ابراهیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: او را ندا دادیم که: «ای ابراهیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و افکندش به پیشانی و خواندیمش ای ابراهیم‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و او را ندا داديم كه اى ابراهيم،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و او را ندا در دادیم: «ای ابراهیم!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We called out: "O Abraham,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We called out to him, “O Ibrahim!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We called unto him, 'Abraham,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: We cried Unto him: O Ibrahim

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We called out to him: "O Abraham!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We called out to him, “O Abraham!

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We cried out: “O Abraham,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: We called out to him: "O Ibrahim!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: We called unto him: O Abraham!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We called out to him, ‘O Abraham!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We called to him, saying: 'O Abraham,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: We called to him, "O Abraham,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We called to him, "Abraham,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We called out to him saying: O Ibrahim!

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wanadaynahu an ya ibraheemu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We called out to him, "Abraham,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: We called out to him "O Abraham!

verses.text: قَدْ صَدَّقْتَ‌ الرُّؤْيَا إِنَّا کَذٰلِکَ‌ نَجْزِي‌ الْمُحْسِنِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: خوابت را تحقق دادی [و فرمان پروردگارت را اجرا کردی]، به راستی ما نیکوکاران را این گونه پاداش می دهیم [که نیّت پاک و خالصشان را به جای عمل می پذیریم.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خوابت را به حقيقت پيوستى. و ما نيكوكاران را چنين پاداش مى‌دهيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: حقا كه خوابت را تحقق بخشيدى. ما نيكوكاران را چنين پاداش مى‌دهيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: رؤيا[ى خود] را حقيقت بخشيدى! ما نيكوكاران را چنين پاداش مى‌دهيم!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: تو مأموریت عالم رؤیا را انجام دادی (کارد را از گلویش بردار). ما نیکو کاران را چنین نیکو پاداش می‌دهیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تو خواب را راست دیدی و دانستی (و برابر فرمان آن عمل کردی و مأموریّت خود را به جای آوردی. دست نگهدار که در این آزمایش بزرگ موفّق شدی. بیش از این رنج تو و فرزندت را نمی‌خواهیم)، ما این گونه به نیکوکاران سزا و جزا می‌دهیم. [[«صَدَّقْتَ»: باور کردی و راست انگاشتی. یعنی آنچه در خواب دیده بودی، بدان عمل کردی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: رؤیایت را به حقیقت باورداشتی، ما بدین‌سان نیکوکاران را جزا می‌دهیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آن رؤیا را تحقق بخشیدی (و به مأموریت خود عمل کردی)!» ما این گونه، نیکوکاران را جزا می‌دهیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا راست آوردی خواب را ما بدینسان پاداش دهیم نیکوکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بدرستى كه آن خواب را راست كردى. همانا ما نيكوكاران را چنين پاداش مى‌دهيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «رؤیا(ی خود) را به‌راستی راست آوردی! ما بی‌گمان نیکوکاران را چنان پاداش می‌دهیم!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: You have fulfilled your dream." Thus do We reward the good.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “You have indeed made the dream come true”; and this is how We reward the virtuous.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: thou hast confirmed the vision; even so We recompense the good-doers.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Of a surety thou hast fulfilled the vision. Verily We! thus We recompense the well-doers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: You have fulfilled the dream (vision)!" Verily! Thus do We reward the Muhsinun (good-doers - see V. 2:112).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: You have fulfilled the vision.” Thus We reward the doers of good.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: you have indeed fulfilled your dream. Thus do We reward the good-doers.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "You have fulfilled the dream!" Verily, thus do We reward the doers of good.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thou hast already fulfilled the vision. Lo! thus do We reward the good.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: You have indeed fulfilled your vision! Thus indeed do We reward the virtuous!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: you have confirmed your vision' As such We recompense the gooddoers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: You have fulfilled the vision." Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: you have fulfilled what you were commanded to do in your dream." Thus do We reward the righteous ones.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: You have indeed shown the truth of the vision; surely thus do We reward the doers of good:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qad saddaqta alrruya inna kathalika najzee almuhsineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: you have fulfilled the dream." It is thus indeed that We reward those who do good,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Thou hast already fulfilled the vision!" - thus indeed do We reward those who do right.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به یقین این همان آزمایش روشن بود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اين آزمايشى آشكارا بود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: به راستى كه اين همان آزمايش آشكار بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: راستى كه اين همان آزمايش آشكار بود!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: این ابتلا همان امتحانی است که (حقیقت حال اهل ایمان را) روشن می‌کند (که در راه خدا از هر چیز می‌گذرند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: این (آزمایش بزرگ که ذبح فرزند با دست پدر است) مسلّماً آزمایشی است که بیانگر (ایمان کامل و یقین صادق به خداوند هستی) است. [[«الْبَلآءُ»: امتحان. آزمون. «الْمُبِینُ»: روشن و آشکار. روشنگر و بیانگر.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌گمان این آزمونی آشکار است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: این مسلّماً همان امتحان آشکار است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: این است هر آینه آن آزمایش آشکار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هر آينه اين آزمايشى روشن و آشكار بود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: به‌درستی این همانا آزمایش روشنگر است!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: That was indeed a trying test.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed this was a clear test.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: This is indeed the manifest trial.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily that! that was a trial manifest.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, that indeed was a manifest trial

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: This was certainly an evident test.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: This was indeed a plain trial.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, that indeed was a manifest trial.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! that verily was a clear test.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: This was indeed a manifest test.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: That was indeed a clear trial.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, this was the clear trial.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It was certainly an open trial.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Most surely this is a manifest trial.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna hatha lahuwa albalao almubeenu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: that surely was a manifest trial,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: For this was obviously a trial-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و ما اسماعیل را در برابر قربانی بزرگی [از ذبح شدن] رهانیدیم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و او را به ذبحى بزرگ بازخريديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و او را در ازاى قربانى بزرگ بازخريديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و او را در ازاى قربانى بزرگى باز رهانيديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و بر او (گوسفندی فرستاده و) ذبح بزرگی فدا ساختیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما قربانی بزرگ و ارزشمندی را فدا و بلاگردان او کردیم. [[«فَدَیْنَاهُ»: فدای جان او و بلاگردان عمر وی کردیم. «ذِبْحٍ»: حیوانی که سر بریده می‌شود. مصدر است و به معنی اسم مفعول، یعنی مذبوح است. مراد قوچ بزرگ و ارزشمندی است که خداوند فرو فرستاد تا به جای فرزند قربانی شود. «عَظِیمٍ»: عظمت این قربانی بیشتر در دو چیز است: یکی این که به فرمان خدا و بلاگردان یکی از انبیاء بود. دیگر این که سنّت و شیوه‌ای شد که تا پایان جهان به صورت برنامه هر ساله مؤمنان بر جای است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به جای او قربانی بزرگی را فدیه پذیرفتیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما ذبح عظیمی را فدای او کردیم،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و فدیه دادیمش به کشتنیی بزرگ‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و او را به ذبحى- گوسفندى- بزرگ باز خريديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و او را در ازای کشتنِ [:قربانیِ] بزرگی رهانیدیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So We ransomed him for a great sacrifice,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We rescued him in exchange of a great sacrifice. (The sacrifice of Ibrahim and Ismail – peace be upon them – is commemorated every year on 10, 11 and 12 Zil Haj).

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And We ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We ransomed him with a mighty victim.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice (i.e. a ram);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We redeemed him with a great sacrifice.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And We ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice;

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then We ransomed him with a tremendous victim.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So, We ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We ransomed his son with a great sacrifice

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We ransomed him with a Feat sacrifice.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wafadaynahu bithibhin AAatheemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We ransomed him with a momentous sacrifice:

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و در میان آیندگان برای او [نام نیک] به جا گذاشتیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و نام نيك او را در نسلهاى بعد باقى گذاشتيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و در [ميان‌] آيندگان براى او [آوازه‌ى نيك‌] بر جاى نهاديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و در [ميان‌] آيندگان براى او [آوازه نيك‌] به جاى گذاشتيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ثنای او را در میان آیندگان وا گذاردیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و نام نیک او را در میان ملّتهای بعدی باقی گذاردیم (و اسوه‌ی آیندگان با ایمان و قدوه‌ی پاکبازان جهانش کردیم). [[«تَرَکْنَا عَلَیْهِ ...»: (نگا: صافّات / 78 و 119 و 129).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و برای او در میان واپسینان نام نیک نهادیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و نام نیک او را در امّتهای بعد باقی نهادیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بازگذاردیم بر او در آیندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و از او نام و ثنا- يا دعوت به حق- در ميان پسينيان باقى گذاشتيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و در (میان) آیندگان بر او (آوازه‌ی نیک) بر جای گذاشتیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And left (his hallowed memory) for posterity.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We kept his praise among the latter generations.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and left for him among the later folk

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We left for him among the posterity:

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We left for him (a goodly remembrance) among generations (to come) in later times.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We left with him for later generations.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and We preserved for him a good name among posterity.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We left for him among the later generations.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We left for him among the later folk (the salutation):

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and left for him a good name in posterity:

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and We let it (the beautiful praise) remain upon him in the latter (generations),

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and perpetuated his praise in later generations.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We perpetuated (praise) to him among the later generations.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Watarakna AAalayhi fee alakhireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and left him thus to be succeeded by a group [of followers] among later generations:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We left (this blessing) for him among generations (to come) in later times:

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سلام بر ابراهیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: سلام بر ابراهيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سلام بر ابراهيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: درود بر ابراهيم!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: سلام و تحیّت خدا بر ابراهیم باد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: درود بر ابراهیم! [[«سَلامٌ ...»: (نگا: صافّات / 79).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سلام بر ابراهیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سلام بر ابراهیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سلامی بر ابراهیم‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سلام بر ابراهيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سلامی (ربانی) بر ابراهیم!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Peace be on Abraham.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Peace be upon Ibrahim!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: 'Peace be upon Abraham!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Peace be Unto Ibrahim:

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Salamun (peace) be upon Ibrahim (Abraham)!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Peace be upon Abraham.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Peace be upon Abraham.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Salam (peace!) be upon Ibrahim!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Peace be unto Abraham!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘Peace be to Abraham!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'Peace be upon Abraham'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: "Peace upon Abraham."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Peace be with Abraham.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Peace be on Ibrahim.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Salamun AAala ibraheema

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: "Peace and salutation to Abraham!"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Peace and salutation to Abraham!"

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [ما] نیکوکاران را این گونه پاداش می دهیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما نيكوكاران را اينچنين پاداش مى‌دهيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اين چنين نيكوكاران را پاداش مى‌دهيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: نيكوكاران را چنين پاداش مى‌دهيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ما نیکوان را این چنین پاداش نیکو می‌دهیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما این گونه نیکوکاران را پاداش خیر خواهیم داد.

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بدین‌سان نیکوکاران را جزا می‌دهیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: این گونه نیکوکاران را پاداش می‌دهیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: چنین پاداش دهیم نیکوکاران را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: ما نيكوكاران را بدين گونه پاداش مى‌دهيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (ما) نیکوکاران را بدین‌سان پاداش می‌دهیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: That is how We reward those who do good.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: This is how We reward the virtuous.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Even so We recompense the good-doers;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily We! thus We compense the well-doers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Thus indeed do We reward the Muhsinun (good-doers - see V. 2:112).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Thus We reward the doers of good.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Thus do We reward the good-doers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Thus indeed do We reward the doers of good.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thus do We reward the good.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Thus do We reward the virtuous.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: As such We recompense the gooddoers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Thus, do We reward the righteous ones.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Thus do We reward the doers of good.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Kathalika najzee almuhsineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: That is how We recompense the righteous:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Thus indeed do We reward those who do right.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید او از بندگان مؤمن ما بود،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: او از بندگان مؤمن ما بود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: در حقيقت، او از بندگان مؤمن ما بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در حقيقت، او از بندگان با ايمان ما بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: زیرا او از بندگان با ایمان ما بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: چرا که او از بندگان با ایمان ما بود.

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: چرا که او از بندگان مؤمن ما بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: او از بندگان باایمان ما است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا او است از بندگان ما مؤمنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا او از بندگان مؤمن ما بود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بی‌گمان، او از بندگان باایمان ماست.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He is truly among Our faithful creatures.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He is indeed one of Our high ranking, firmly believing bondmen.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: he was among Our believing servants.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily he was one of Our believing bondmen.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, he was one of Our believing slaves.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He was one of Our believing servants.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Surely he was one of Our believing servants.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, he was one of Our believing servants.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! he is one of Our believing slaves.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He is indeed one of Our faithful servants.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He was one of Our believing worshipers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He was one of Our believing servants.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely he was one of Our believing servants.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Innahu min AAibadina almumineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: truly, he was one of Our faithful servants.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: For he was one of our believing Servants.

verses.text: وَ بَشَّرْنَاهُ‌ بِإِسْحَاقَ‌ نَبِيّاً مِنَ‌ الصَّالِحِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و ما او را به اسحاق که پیامبری از شایستگان بود مژده دادیم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: او را به اسحاق، پيامبرى شايسته، مژده داديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و او را به اسحاق، پيامبرى از صالحان بشارت داديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و او را به اسحاق كه پيامبرى از [جمله‌] شايستگان است مژده داديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و باز مژده فرزندش اسحاق را که پیغمبری از شایستگان است به او دادیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما او را به (تولّد) اسحاق که پیغمبر و از زمره‌ی صالحان بود، مژده دادیم. [[«نَبِیّاً ...»: مراد این است که مقدّر بود پیغمبر گردد و از زمره شایستگان شود.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و او را به اسحاق که پیامبری از شایستگان بود، بشارت دادیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما او را به اسحاق -پیامبری از شایستگان- بشارت دادیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نوید دادیمش به اسحق پیمبری از شایستگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و او را به اسحاق، پيامبرى از نيكان و شايستگان، مژده داديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و او را به (ولادت) اسحاق - حال آنکه پیامبری برجسته از (جمله‌ی) شایستگان است - مژده دادیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So We gave him the good news of Isaac, apostle, who is among the righteous.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We gave him the glad tidings of Ishaq, a Herald of the Hidden, from among those who deserve Our proximity.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then We gave him the good tidings of Isaac, a Prophet, one of the righteous.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We gave him the glad tidings of Is-haq, a prophet, and of the righteous.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We gave him the glad tidings of Ishaque (Isaac) a Prophet from the righteous.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We gave him good news of Isaac, a prophet, one of the righteous.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And We gave him the good news of Isaac, a Prophet and among the righteous ones.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We gave him the glad tidings of Ishaq -- a Prophet from the righteous.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And we gave him tidings of the birth of Isaac, a prophet of the righteous.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And We gave him the good news of [the birth of] Isaac, a prophet, one of the righteous.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then, We gave him the glad tidings of Isaac, a Prophet, one of the righteous,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We gave him good tidings of Isaac, a prophet from among the righteous.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We gave him the glad news of the birth of Isaac, one of the righteous Prophets.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We gave him the good news of Ishaq, a prophet among the good ones.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wabashsharnahu biishaqa nabiyyan mina alssaliheena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We gave Abraham the good news of Isaac, a prophet and a righteous man,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We gave him the good news of Isaac - a prophet,- one of the Righteous.

verses.text: وَ بَارَکْنَا عَلَيْهِ‌ وَ عَلَى‌ إِسْحَاقَ‌ وَ مِنْ‌ ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحْسِنٌ‌ وَ ظَالِمٌ‌ لِنَفْسِهِ‌ مُبِينٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و بر او و بر اسحاق برکت دادیم، و از دودمان آن دو برخی نیکوکارند و برخی آشکارا ستمکار بر خویشند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: او و اسحاق را بركت داديم. و از فرزندانشان بعضى نيكوكار هستند و بعضى به آشكارا بر خود ستمكار.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و بر او و بر اسحاق بركت داديم، و از فرزندانشان برخى نيكوكارند و برخى آشكارا بر خود ستمكارند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و به او و به اسحاق بركت داديم، و از نسل آن دو برخى نيكوكار و [برخى‌] آشكارا به خود ستمكار بودند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و بر ابراهیم و اسحاق برکت و خیر بسیار عطا کردیم، و از فرزندانشان برخی صالح و نیکوکار و برخی دانسته و آشکار به نفس خود ستمکار شدند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما به ابراهیم و (فرزندش) اسحاق خیر و برکت دادیم (در عمر و زندگی، در نسلهای آینده، در مکتب و ایمان، و ...) از دودمان این دو، افرادی نیکوکار به وجود آمدند، و هم افرادی که (به خاطر عدم ایمان) آشکارا به خود ستم کردند. [[«مُحْسِنٌ»: نیکوکار. مراد مؤمن و مطیع فرمان خدا است. «ظَالِمٌ»: ستمگر. مراد کافر و منافق و گنهکار است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به او و به اسحاق برکت بخشیدیم، و از زاد و رود آنان، هم نیکوکار بود و هم آشکارا ستمگر در حق خویش‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما به او و اسحاق برکت دادیم؛ و از دودمان آن دو، افرادی بودند نیکوکار و افرادی آشکارا به خود ستم کردند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و برکت نهادیم بر او و بر اسحق و از نژاد آنان است نکوکاری و ستمگری بر خویشتن آشکار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و بر او و بر اسحاق بركت داديم، و از فرزندان ايشان برخى نيكوكارند و برخى ستمكارى آشكار بر خويشتن.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بر (سر و سامان) او و اسحاق برکت فرو ریختیم. حال آنکه از نسل آن دو برخی نیکوکار و برخی به گونه‌ای آشکارگر، به خود ستمکار است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And We blessed him and Isaac. Among their descendants are some who do good, but some who wrong themselves.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We sent blessings upon him and Ishaq; and among their descendants – some who do good deeds, and some who clearly wrong themselves.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And We blessed him, and Isaac; and of their seed some are good-doers, and some manifest self-wrongers.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We blessed him and Is-haq; and of their offspring are some well-doers and some who wrong themselves manifestly.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: We blessed him and Ishaque (Isaac), and of their progeny are (some) that do right, and some that plainly wrong themselves.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We blessed him, and Isaac. But among their descendants are some who are righteous, and some who are clearly unjust to themselves.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And We blessed him and Isaac. Among the offspring of the two some did good and some plainly wronged themselves.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: We blessed him and Ishaq. And of their progeny are (some) that do right, and some that plainly wrong themselves.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We blessed him and Isaac. And of their seed are some who do good, and some who plainly wrong themselves.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And We blessed him and Isaac. Among their descendants [some] are virtuous, and [some] who manifestly wrong themselves.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and We blessed him and Isaac, and from their offspring are some gooddoers, and others who clearly wronged themselves.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We blessed him and Isaac. But among their descendants is the doer of good and the clearly unjust to himself.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We had blessed him and Isaac. Some of their offspring were righteous and others were openly unjust to themselves.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
