translations.text: And indeed Yunus is one of the Noble Messengers.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Jonah too was one of the Envoys;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily Yunus was Of the sent ones.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And, verily, Yunus (Jonah) was one of the Messengers.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And Jonah was one of the messengers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And Jonah too was one of the Messengers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily, Yunus was one of the Messengers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! Jonah verily was of those sent (to warn)

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed Jonah was one of the apostles.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Jonah, too, was one of the Messengers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, Jonah was among the messengers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Jonah was certainly a Messenger.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And Yunus was most surely of the apostles.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainna yoonusa lamina almursaleena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Jonah too was one of the messengers.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So also was Jonah among those sent (by Us).

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [یاد کن] هنگامی را که به سوی آن کشتی پر [از جمعیت و بار] گریخت،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون به آن كشتى پر از مردم گريخت،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آن‌گاه كه به سوى كشتى پر [از جمعيت‌] بگريخت

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنگاه كه به سوى كشتى پر، بگريخت!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن گاه که به کشتی پر جمعیتی گریخت (زیرا به قومش وعده عذاب داد و آنها از دل توبه و انابه کردند و خدا رفع عذاب کرد. او به دریای روم گریخت تا نزد قوم خجل و شرمنده نرود).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: زمانی، او به سوی کشتی پر (از مسافر و کالا، بدون اجازه‌ی پروردگارش، از میان قوم خود) گریخت. [[«أَبَقَ»: گریخت. این واژه بیشتر برای گریختن بندگان از پیش صاحبانشان به کار می‌رود. اینجا مراد ترک کردن قوم و قبیله بدون اجازه پروردگار است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه که به سوی کشتی گرانبار گریخت‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: به خاطر بیاور زمانی را که به سوی کشتی پر (از جمعیّت و بار) فرار کرد.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گاهی که گریخت بسوی کشتی آکنده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنگاه كه به آن كشتى پُر و گرانبار- آكنده از مردم و كالا- گريخت.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: چون سوی آن کشتی پُر (از سرنشینان) بگریخت!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When he fled on the laden ship,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: When he left towards the laden ship.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: when he ran away to the laden ship

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Recall what time he ran away Unto a laden ship.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: When he ran to the laden ship,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: When he fled to the laden boat.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Call to mind when he fled to the laden ship,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: When he ran to the laden ship:

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: When he fled unto the laden ship,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: When he absconded toward the laden ship,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He ran away to the laden ship,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Mention] when he ran away to the laden ship.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He abandoned his people

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: When he ran away to a ship completely laden,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ith abaqa ila alfulki almashhooni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He fled to the overloaded ship.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: When he ran away (like a slave from captivity) to the ship (fully) laden,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و با سرنشینان کشتی قرعه انداخت [و قرعه به نامش افتاد] و از مغلوب شدگان شد [و او را به دریا انداختند.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: قرعه زدند و او در قرعه مغلوب شد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس [يونس با سرنشينان كشتى‌] قرعه انداخت و خود از باختگان شد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس [سرنشينان‌] با هم قرعه انداختند و [يونس‌] از باختگان شد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (کشتی به خطر افتاد و اهل کشتی معتقد شدند که خطا کاری در میان آنهاست، خواستند قرعه زنند تا خطا کار را به قرعه تعیین کرده و غرق کنند) یونس قرعه زد و به نام خودش افتاد و از مغلوب شدگان (و غرق شوندگان) گردید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (کشتی دچار سانحه شد و می‌بایست بر طبق قرعه، افرادی از سرنشینان به دریا انداخته شوند). یونس در قرعه‌کشی شرکت کرد و از جمله‌ی کسانی شد که قرعه به نام ایشان درآمد. (پس برابر عرف آن روز به دریا انداخته شد). [[«سَاهَمَ»: در قرعه‌کشی شرکت کرد. «الْمُدْحَضِینَ»: مغلوبان. قرعه به نام ایشان درآمدگان. فرو انداختگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس با آنان قرعه انداخت و او بیرون انداختنی شد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و با آنها قرعه افکند، (و قرعه به نام او افتاد و) مغلوب شد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس تیر گرفت پس شد از فروافتادگان (انداختگان)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس با آنها قرعه افكند و مغلوب شد- قرعه بر او افتاد-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس با آنان قرعه انداخت (و) در نتیجه از رانده‌شدگان (از آن) بود.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And lots were cast (when a storm overtook them), he was rejected, (and thrown overboard).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Then lots were drawn and he became of those who were pushed into the sea.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and cast lots, and was of the rebutted,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then he joined the lots, and was of the condemned.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He (agreed to) cast lots, and he was among the losers,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He gambled and lost.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: cast lots, and was among the losers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then he (agreed to) cast lots, and he was among the losers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And then drew lots and was of those rejected;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: he drew lots with them and was the one to be condemned [as one to be thrown overboard].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and cast lots, and he was among the losers (of the lots that were cast).

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And he drew lots and was among the losers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and sailed away in a laden ship, wherein people cast lots. Because he lost, he was thrown into the water.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So he shared (with them), but was of those who are cast off.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fasahama fakana mina almudhadeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: And then they cast lots and he was the one who lost,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He (agreed to) cast lots, and he was condemned:

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس آن ماهی بزرگ او را بلعید، در حالی که سزاوار سرزنش بود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ماهى ببلعيدش و او در خور سرزنش بود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [او را به دريا افكندند] و ماهى او را لقمه كرد، در حالى كه او ملامتگر [خويش‌] بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [او را به دريا افكندند] و عنبرماهى او را بلعيد در حالى كه او نكوهشگر خويش بود!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ماهی دریا او را به کام فرو برد و او در خور ملامت بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ماهی او را بلعید، در حالی که مستحقّ ملامت بود (و می‌بایست در برابر کاری که کرده بود، زندانی شود). [[«الْحُوتُ»: نوعی ماهی بزرگ. «مُلِیمٌ»: گناهکار. مستحقّ سرزنش. کسی که کاری کند یا حرفی بزند که سزاوار سرزنش و درخور لومه شود.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و ماهی [بزرگ /نهنگ‌] او را فرو بلعید و او در خور ملامت بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (او را به دریا افکندند) و ماهی عظیمی او را بلعید، در حالی که مستحقّ سرزنش بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس فرو بردش ماهی و او بود نکوهیده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس آن ماهى او را بلعيد و او در خور سرزنش بود- يا ملامت‌كننده خود بود-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (او را به دریا افکندند.) پس (آن) ماهی بزرگ او را بلعید، در حالی که او نکوهش کننده‌ی (خود) بود!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then he was swallowed by a large fish as he was worthy of blame.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The fish then swallowed him and he blamed himself. (For not waiting for Allah’s command.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: then the whale swallowed him down, and he blameworthy.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And a fish swallowed him, and he was reproaching himself.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then a (big) fish swallowed him and he had done an act worthy of blame.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then the fish swallowed him, and he was to blame.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then a fish swallowed him, and he was blameworthy.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then a (big) fish swallowed him as he had done an act worthy of blame.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And the fish swallowed him while he was blameworthy;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then the fish swallowed him while he was blameworthy.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So the whale swallowed him, for he was blameworthy,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then the fish swallowed him, while he was blameworthy.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The fish swallowed him up and he deserved (all this).

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So the fish swallowed him while he did that for which he blamed himself

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Failtaqamahu alhootu wahuwa muleemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and the fish swallowed him while he was blaming himself.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then the big Fish did swallow him, and he had done acts worthy of blame.

verses.text: فَلَوْ لاَ أَنَّهُ‌ کَانَ‌ مِنَ‌ الْمُسَبِّحِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [و در شکم ماهی به تسبیح خدا مشغول شد که] اگر او از تسبیح کنندگان نبود،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس اگر نه از تسبيح‌گويان مى‌بود،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس اگر او از تسبيح گويان نبود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اگر او از زمره تسبيح‌كنندگان نبود،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اگر او به ستایش و تسبیح خدا نپرداختی،

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر او قبلاً از زمره‌ی پرستشگران نمی‌بود. [[«الْمُسَبِّحِینَ»: عبادت کنندگان (نگا: صافّات / 166). دعا کنندگان (نگا: انبیاء / 79، نور / 41، سجده / 15).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اگر از تسبیح‌گویان نبود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و اگر او از تسبیح‌کنندگان نبود...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس اگر نبود از تسبیح‌گویان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس اگر نه اين بود كه وى از تسبيح‌گويان بود،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس اگر او از زمره‌ی تسبیح‌کنندگان نبود.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Had he not been one of those who struggled hard,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And were he not one of those who praise. –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Now had he not been of those that glorify God,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And had he not been of those who hallow Him,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Had he not been of them who glorify Allah,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Had he not been one of those who praised.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Had he not been one of those who glorify Allah,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Had he not been of them who glorify Allah,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And had he not been one of those who glorify (Allah)

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Had he not been one of those who celebrate Allah’s glory,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and had he not been among those who exalt (Allah),

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And had he not been of those who exalt Allah,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Had he not glorified God,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But had it not been that he was of those who glorify (Us),

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falawla annahu kana mina almusabbiheena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Had he not been one of those who acknowledge the glory of God,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Had it not been that he (repented and) glorified Allah,

verses.text: لَلَبِثَ‌ فِي‌ بَطْنِهِ‌ إِلَى‌ يَوْمِ‌ يُبْعَثُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید تا روزی که مردم برانگیخته می شوند در شکم ماهی می ماند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: تا روز قيامت در شكم ماهى مى‌ماند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: قطعا تا روزى كه برانگيخته مى‌شوند، در شكم آن [ماهى‌] مى‌ماند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: قطعاً تا روزى كه برانگيخته مى‌شوند، در شكم آن [ماهى‌] مى‌ماند!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: تا قیامت در شکم ماهی زیست کردی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: او در شکم ماهی تا روز رستاخیز می‌ماند. [[«لَبِثَ»: ماند. «إِلی یَوْمِ یُبْعَثُونَ»: تا روزی که برانگیخته شوند. مراد مدفون شدن برای همیشه است. چرا که او در دل ماهی و ماهی در دل زمین تا روز رستاخیز دفن می‌شوند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: در شکم آن تا روزی که مردمان برانگیخته شوند به سر می‌برد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: تا روز قیامت در شکم ماهی می‌ماند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: هر آینه می‌ماند در شکمش تا روزی که برانگیخته شوند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هر آينه تا روزى كه [مردم‌] برانگيخته مى‌شوند در شكم آن مى‌ماند- يعنى شكم آن ماهى گور او مى‌شد-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بی‌گمان تا روزی که برانگیخته می‌شوند، در شکم آن ماهی (همچنان) می‌ماند!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He would have stayed in its belly till the day the dead are raised.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He would have remained in its belly till the day when all will be raised.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: he would have tarried in its belly until the day they shall be raised;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He would have tarried in the belly thereof till the Day when they are raised.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He would have indeed remained inside its belly (the fish) till the Day of Resurrection.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He would have stayed in its belly until the Day they are raised.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: he would certainly have remained in its belly till the Day of Resurrection.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He would have indeed remained inside its belly (the fish) till the Day of Resurrection.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He would have tarried in its belly till the day when they are raised;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: he would have surely remained in its belly till the day they will be resurrected.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: he would have lingered in its belly till the Day they are resurrected.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He would have remained inside its belly until the Day they are resurrected.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: he would certainly have remained inside the fish until the Day of Resurrection.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He would certainly have tarried in its belly to the day when they are raised.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Lalabitha fee batnihi ila yawmi yubAAathoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: he would certainly have remained inside the fish till the Day of Resurrection.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He would certainly have remained inside the Fish till the Day of Resurrection.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس او را در حالی که بیمار بود به زمینی خشک و بی گیاه افکندیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس او را كه بيمار بود به خشكى افكنديم،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس او را در حالى كه ناخوش بود به خشكى انداختيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس او را در حالى كه ناخوش بود به زمين خشكى افكنديم!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: باز او را (پس از چندین روز) از بطن ماهی به صحرای خشکی افکندیم در حالی که بیمار و ناتوان بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما او را در یک سرزمین برهوت خالی (ازدرخت و گیاه) افکندیم، در حالی که بیمار و نزار بود. [[«نَبَذْنَاهُ»: او را انداختیم. او را افکندیم. مراد این است که کاری کردیم که ماهی او را از دهان خود پرت کند. «الْعَرَآءِ»: سرزمین برهوت و خالی از درخت و گیاه و ساختمان. «سَقِیمٌ»: بیمار. ناخوش.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه او را به کرانه بایر افکندیم و او بیمار بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (به هر حال ما او را رهایی بخشیدیم و) او را در یک سرزمین خشک خالی از گیاه افکندیم در حالی که بیمار بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس افکندیمش به دشت و او بود بیمار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس او را در حالى كه بيمار بود به بيابان- دشت خشك و بى‌گياه- بينداختيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس او را در حالی که ناخوش بود، به ساحل (عریان و بی‌سامان) افکندیم!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So We cast him, sick, on a barren shore,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: We then put him ashore on a plain, and he was sick.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: but We cast him upon the wilderness, and he was sick,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then We cast him on a bare desert whilst he was sick.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But We cast him forth on the naked shore while he was sick,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then We threw him into the wilderness, and he was sick.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But We threw him on a wide bare tract of land while he was ill;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But We cast him forth on the naked shore while he was sick,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then We cast him on a desert shore while he was sick;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then We cast him on a bare shore, and he was sick.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But We cast him, upon the shore, and he was ill,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But We threw him onto the open shore while he was ill.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We cast him out of the fish unto dry land and he was sick.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then We cast him on to the vacant surface of the earth while he was sick.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fanabathnahu bialAAarai wahuwa saqeemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But We caused him to be cast forth on to the beach, sick as he was,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But We cast him forth on the naked shore in a state of sickness,

verses.text: وَ أَنْبَتْنَا عَلَيْهِ‌ شَجَرَةً مِنْ‌ يَقْطِينٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و بر او گیاهی از نوعی کدو رویاندیم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و بر فراز سرش بوته كدويى رويانيديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و بر بالاى [سر] او بوته كدويى رويانديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و بر بالاى [سرِ] او درختى از [نوع‌] كدوبُن رويانيديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (در آن صحرا) بر او درختی از کدو رویانیدیم (تا به برگش سایه‌بان و پوشش کند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما کدوبُنی بر بالای او رویانیدیم (تا در سایه‌ی برگهای پهن و مرطوب آن بیارامد). [[«شَجَرَةً»: گیاه. بوته. «یَقْطِینٍ»: کدو. کدوبُن بدان خاطر انتخاب شده تا برگهایش روی یونس بیفتد و او را از گزند حوادث در امان دارد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بر سر او [برای سایه افکنی‌] گیاهی از قسم کدو رویاندیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و بوته کدوئی بر او رویاندیم (تا در سایه برگهای پهن و مرطوبش آرامش یابد)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و رویانیدیم بر او درختی را از کدو

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و بر [سر] او كدوبنى رويانيديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بر (سر و سامان)ش درختی از کدو بن رویاندیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And We made a gourd tree grow over him.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We grew a tree of gourd (as a shelter) above him.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and We caused to grow over him a tree of gourds.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We caused to grow over him a tree, a gourd.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We caused a plant of gourd to grow over him.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We made a gourd tree grow over him.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and caused a gourd tree to grow over him,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We caused a plant of gourd to grow over him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We caused a tree of gourd to grow above him;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So We made a gourd plant grow above him.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and We caused a pumpkin tree to grow over him.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We caused to grow over him a gourd vine.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We made a plant of gourd grow up for him.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We caused to grow up for him a gourdplant.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waanbatna AAalayhi shajaratan min yaqteenin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and We caused a gourd tree to grow over him.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We caused to grow, over him, a spreading plant of the gourd kind.

verses.text: وَ أَرْسَلْنَاهُ‌ إِلَى‌ مِائَةِ أَلْفٍ‌ أَوْ يَزِيدُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و او را به سوی [قومی] یکصد هزار نفر [ی] یا بیشتر فرستادیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و او را به رسالت بر صد هزار كس و بيشتر فرستاديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و او را به سوى صد هزار نفر يا بيشتر [به پيامبرى‌] فرستاديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و او را به سوى يكصدهزار [نفر از ساكنان نينوا] يا بيشتر روانه كرديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و او را بر قومی بالغ بر صد هزار یا افزون (به رسالت) فرستادیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (یونس کم‌کم بهبودی یافت) و او را به سوی جمعیّت یک صد هزار نفری یا بیشتر فرستادیم (تا ایشان را به ایمان آوردن و توبه کردن از بدیها و انجام نیکیها دعوت کند). [[«مِائَةِ أَلْفٍ»: صد هزار، مراد قوم خودش است (نگا: یونس / 98). «أَوْ»: بلکه. یا. عربها چنین حرفی را برای تأکید مطلب پیشین به کار می‌برند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و [سرانجام‌] او را به سوی صدهزار نفر یا بیشتر [به رسالت‌] فرستادیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و او را به سوی جمعیّت یکصد هزار نفری -یا بیشتر- فرستادیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و فرستادیمش بسوی صد هزار تن بلکه می‌افزودند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و او را به سوى صد هزار يا بيشتر- مردم نينوا- فرستاديم- يعنى دو باره پس از بيرون آمدن از شكم ماهى-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و او را سوی یکصدهزار (نفر) یا بیشتر (به رسالت) فرستادیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We sent him to a hundred thousand men or more,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We sent him towards a hundred thousand people, in fact more.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then We sent him unto a hundred thousand, or more,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We had sent him to a hundred thousand: rather they exceeded.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We sent him to a hundred thousand (people) or even more.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then We sent him to a hundred thousand, or more.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and We sent him forth to a nation of a hundred thousand or more,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We sent him to a hundred thousand (people) or even more.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We sent him to a hundred thousand (folk) or more

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We sent him to a [community of] hundred thousand or more,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then We sent him to a hundred thousand or more,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We sent him to [his people of] a hundred thousand or more.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We sent him to a hundred thousand or more people.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We sent him to a hundred thousand, rather they exceeded.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waarsalnahu ila miati alfin aw yazeedoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We sent him as a messenger to a hundred thousand people or more,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We sent him (on a mission) to a hundred thousand (men) or more.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس ایمان آوردند در نتیجه آنان را تا پایان عمرشان [از نعمت ها و مواهب خود] بهره مند کردیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنها ايمان آوردند و تا زنده بودند، برخورداريشان داديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس ايمان آوردند و تا مدت زمانى برخوردارشان كرديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس ايمان آوردند و تا چندى برخوردارشان كرديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آن قوم چون ایمان آوردند ما هم تا هنگامی معیّن (مدت عمر آن قوم، از نعمت خود) بهره‌مندشان گردانیدیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان همه ایمان آوردند و ما ایشان را از مواهب فراوان و نعمتهای فراخ زندگی تا مدّت مشخّصی بهره‌مند ساختیم. [[«فَمَتَّعْنَاهُمْ إِلی حِینٍ»: (نگا: یونس / 98). مدّت معیّن. یعنی فرا رسیدن اجل آنان و زمان مقدّر ایشان در حیات دنیوی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه ایمان آوردند و ما نیز آنان را تا مدتی بهره‌مند ساختیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها ایمان آوردند، از این رو تا مدّت معلومی آنان را از مواهب زندگی بهره‌مند ساختیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس ایمان آوردند پس بهره‌مندشان ساختیم تا زمانی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس ايمان آوردند و تا هنگامى- تا زنده بودند- برخوردارشان كرديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس ایمان آوردند. در نتیجه تا چندی برخوردارشان کردیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And they came to believe; so We allowed them to enjoy the good things of life for an age.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So they accepted faith – We therefore gave them usage for a while.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and they believed; so We gave them enjoyment for a while.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they believed, whrefore We let them enjoy life for a season.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And they believed; so We gave them enjoyment for a while.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And they believed, so We gave them enjoyment for a while.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and they believed. So We let them enjoy life for a while.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And they believed; so We gave them enjoyment for a while.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they believed, therefor We gave them comfort for a while.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and they believed [in him]. So We provided for them for a while.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and they believed, and We gave them enjoyment for awhile.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they believed, so We gave them enjoyment [of life] for a time.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They believed in him so We granted them enjoyment for an appointed time.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they believed, so We gave them provision till a time.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faamanoo famattaAAnahum ila heenin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and they believed in him: so We let them live in ease for a while.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And they believed; so We permitted them to enjoy (their life) for a while.

verses.text: فَاسْتَفْتِهِمْ‌ أَ لِرَبِّکَ‌ الْبَنَاتُ‌ وَ لَهُمُ‌ الْبَنُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [مشرکان سبک مغز می گویند: فرشتگان، دختران خدایند] پس از آنان بپرس که آیا دختران برای پروردگار تو هستند و پسران برای ایشان؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: از ايشان بپرس: آيا دختران از آن پروردگار تو باشند و پسران از آن ايشان؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس، از ايشان بپرس، آيا دختران براى پروردگار تو و پسران براى آنهاست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس، از مشركان جويا شو: آيا پروردگارت را دختران و آنان را پسران است؟!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس تو از این مشرکان (که فرشتگان را دختران خدا می‌خوانند) بپرس که آیا خدا را فرزندان دختر است و آنان را پسر؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: از آنان (که ساکن مکّه بوده و به دنبال خرافات راه افتاده و معتقدند که فرشتگان دختران خدایند) بپرس که آیا دختران از آنِ پروردگار تو باشند و پسران از آنِ خودشان؟ (آیا این عادلانه است؟). [[«الْبَنَاتُ»: مراد فرشتگان است که بنا به عقیده تباه خود می‌گفتند: فرشتگان دختران خدایند (نگا: بقره / 116، نحل / 57، نجم / 27). البتّه پسر و دختر در پیشگاه خدا ارزش یکسان دارند و معیار شخصیّت هر دو پاکی و تقوا است. ولی استدلال قرآن در اینجا به اصطلاح از باب «ذکر مسلّماتِ خصم» است که مطالب طرف را بگیرند و به خود او باز گردانند. نظیر این معنی (نگا: نجم / 22).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: از آنان بپرس که آیا پروردگار تو را دختران است و خود ایشان را پسران؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: از آنان بپرس: آیا پروردگارت دخترانی دارد و پسران از آن آنهاست؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس بپرسشان آیا پروردگار تو را است دختران و ایشان را است پسران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: از ايشان بپرس، آيا پروردگار تو را دختران باشد و آنان را پسران؟!- مشركان مى‌گفتند كه فرشتگان دختران خدايند-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس، از مشرکان جویای رأیی نوین شو. آیا پروردگارت را دختران و آنان را پسران است‌؟!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Now ask them if their Lord has daughters, and they sons?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore ask them (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), whether the daughters are for your Lord and the sons for them!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So ask them for a pronouncement -- Has thy Lord daughters, and they sons?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Now ask thou them: there for thy Lord daughters and for them sons?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Now ask them (O Muhammad SAW): "Are there (only) daughters for your Lord and sons for them?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Ask them, “Are the daughters for your Lord, while for them the sons?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So ask their opinion: “(Are you convinced) that your Lord should have daughters and you should have sons?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Now ask them: "Are there (only) daughters for your Lord and sons for them"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Now ask them (O Muhammad): Hath thy Lord daughters whereas they have sons?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Ask them, are daughters to be for your Lord while sons are to be for them?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Now, ask them, has your Lord daughters, and they sons?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So inquire of them, [O Muhammad], "Does your Lord have daughters while they have sons?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), ask them, "Do daughters belong to your Lord and sons to them?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then ask them whether your Lord has daughters and they have sons.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faistaftihim alirabbika albanatu walahumu albanoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Now ask them whether your Lord has daughters, whereas they have sons.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Now ask them their opinion: Is it that thy Lord has (only) daughters, and they have sons?-

verses.text: أَمْ‌ خَلَقْنَا الْمَلاَئِکَةَ إِنَاثاً وَ هُمْ‌ شَاهِدُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا اینکه ما فرشتگان را دختر آفریدیم و آنان شاهد بودند؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا وقتى كه ما ملائكه را زن مى‌آفريديم آنها مى‌ديدند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا فرشتگان را مؤنث آفريديم و آنها ناظر بودند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا فرشتگان را مادينه آفريديم و آنان شاهد بودند؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: یا آنکه چون ما فرشتگان را خلق می‌کردیم آنجا حاضر بودند و دیدند که آنها را زن آفریدیم؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یا این که (وقتی که) ما فرشتگان را به صورت ماده می‌آفریدیم، ایشان ناظر (بر خلقت فرشتگان) بوده‌اند؟ [[«شَاهِدُونَ»: جمع شاهد، حاضر و ناظر (نگا: کهف / 51، زخرف / 19).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا آنکه ما فرشتگان را مادینه آفریده‌ایم و ایشان شاهد بوده‌اند؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا ما فرشتگان را مؤنث آفریدیم و آنها ناظر بودند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا آفریدیم فرشتگان را ماده‌گانی و ایشانند گواهان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر آنان حاضر و گواه بودند كه ما فرشتگان را دخترانى آفريديم؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا فرشتگان را مادینه آفریدیم، حال آنکه آنان شاهد بودند؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or did We make the angels females, and they witnessed it?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or that have We created the angels as females, while they were present?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or did We create the angels females, while they were witnesses?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Or created We the angels females while they were witnesses?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or did We create the angels females while they were witnesses?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or did We create the angels females, as they witnessed?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Did We create the angels as females the while they witnessed?”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or did We create the angels female while they were witnesses

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or created We the angels females while they were present?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Did We create the angels females while they were present?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, did We create the angels females while they were witnessing?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or did We create the angels as females while they were witnesses?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Have We created the angels as females before their very eyes?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or did We create the angels females while they were witnesses?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am khalaqna almalaikata inathan wahum shahidoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Did We create the angels females, to which they were witnesses?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or that We created the angels female, and they are witnesses (thereto)?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آگاه باش! که آنان از بافته های دروغ خود می گویند

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آگاه باش كه از دروغگوييشان است كه مى‌گويند:

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آگاه باش كه اينان از دروغ پردازيشان مى‌گويند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: هش‌دار كه اينان از دروغ پردازى خود قطعاً خواهند گفت:

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بدان که اینان (از جهل خود) بر خدا دروغی بسته و می‌گویند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هان! آنان تنها از روی دروغها و تهمتهای به هم بافته‌ی خود می‌گویند: [[«مِنْ إِفْکِهِمْ»: بنا به دروغهای زشت خود. تنها از روی به هم بافته‌ها و خیال‌پردازیهای خود. «لَیَقُولُونَ»: مقول قول در آیه بعدی است که (وَلَدَ اللهُ) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: هان ایشان از سر تهمتشان می‌گویند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بدانید آنها با این تهمت بزرگشان می‌گویند:

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا ایشان از دروغ پردازیشان گویند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آگاه باش كه آنها از دروغ‌پردازيشان است كه مى‌گويند:

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: هان! (که) آنان از (گزاف و) انحرافشان بی‌گمان گویند:

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Is it not a lie invented by them when they say:

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Pay heed! It is their slander that they say. –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Is it not of their own calumny that they say,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Lo! verily it is of their falsehood that they say:

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, it is of their falsehood that they (Quraish pagans) say:

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: No indeed! It is one of their lies when they say.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Behold, it is one of their fabrications that they say:

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, it is of their falsehood that they say:

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! it is of their falsehood that they say:

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Be aware that it is out of their mendacity that they say,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then is it of their lying that they say:

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Unquestionably, it is out of their [invented] falsehood that they say,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It is only because of their false invention that they say,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Now surely it is of their own lie that they say:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ala innahum min ifkihim layaqooloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: No indeed! It is one of their fabrications when they say:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Is it not that they say, from their own invention,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: که خدا فرزند آورده! و بی تردید آنان دروغگویند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خدا صاحب فرزند است. دروغ مى‌گويند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: خدا فرزند آورده است. در حالى كه آنها قطعا دروغگويند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: «خدا فرزند آورده!» در حالى كه آنها قطعاً دروغگويانند!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: خدا را فرزند می‌باشد. البته دروغ می‌گویند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: خداوند فرزند زاده است! قطعاً ایشان دروغگویند. [[«وَلَدَ»: زاد. فرزند به دنیاآورد. صاحب فرزند شد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: خداوند فرزندی پدید آورده است، و ایشان دروغگو هستند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: «خداوند فرزند آورده!» ولی آنها به یقین دروغ می‌گویند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: خدا را است فرزندی و همانا ایشانند دروغگویان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: خدا فرزند زاد، و هر آينه آنها دروغگويند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «خدا (فرزند) بزاد!» در حالی که آنان بی‌گمان دروغگویانند!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "God has begotten (children)?" They are liars indeed!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: That “Allah has offspring”; and indeed, surely, they are liars.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: 'God has begotten?' They are truly liars.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: God hath begotten. Verily they are the liars.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Allah has begotten off spring or children (i.e. angels are the daughters of Allah)?" And, verily, they are liars!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “God has begotten.” They are indeed lying.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: “Allah has begotten.” They are liars!

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Allah has begotten." And, verily, they are liars!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Allah hath begotten. Allah! verily they tell a lie.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘Allah has begotten [offsprings],’ and they indeed speak a falsehood.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'Allah has begotten' They are truly liars.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: " Allah has begotten," and indeed, they are liars.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: 'God has begotten a son.' They are certainly liars.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Allah has begotten; and most surely they are liars.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walada Allahu wainnahum lakathiboona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: "God has begotten children." They are truly liars.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Allah has begotten children"? but they are liars!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا دختران را بر پسران ترجیح داده است؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا خدا دختران را بر پسران برترى داد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا [خدا] دختران را بر پسران ترجيح داده است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا [خدا] دختران را بر پسران برگزيده است؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا خدا دختران را بر پسران برگزید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا خدا دختران را بر پسران ترجیح داده است (در صورتی که به گمان شما پسران از دختران بهترند؟ تازه اگر برابر اندیشه‌ی تباه شما هم بود، می‌بایست خدا پسران را نصیب خود کند؛ نه دختران را!). [[«أَصْطَفی»: آیا برگزیده است؟ در اصل (أَإِصْطَفی) است. همزه فعل برای تخفیف حذف شده است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا [خداوند] دختران را بر پسران ترجیح داده است؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا دختران را بر پسران ترجیح داده است؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا برگزیده است دختران را بر پسران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا [خدا] دختران را بر پسران برگزيد؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا (خدا) دختران را بر پسران برگزیده است‌؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Does He prefer sons to daughters?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Has he chosen daughters instead of sons?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Has He chosen daughters above sons?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Hath He chosen daughters above sons?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Has He (then) chosen daughters rather than sons?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So He preferred girls over boys?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Did He choose daughters rather than sons?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Has He (then) chosen daughters rather than sons

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: (And again of their falsehood): He hath preferred daughters to sons.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Has He preferred daughters to sons?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Has He chosen daughters above sons?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Has He chosen daughters over sons?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Has He chosen daughters in preference to sons?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Has He chosen daughters in preference to sons?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Astafa albanati AAala albaneena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Has He chosen daughters over sons?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Did He (then) choose daughters rather than sons?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: شما را چه شده، چگونه حکم می کنید؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: شما را چه مى‌شود؟ چگونه قضاوت مى‌كنيد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: شما را چه شده؟ چگونه داورى مى‌كنيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: شما را چه شده؟ چگونه داورى مى‌كنيد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: چرا چنین جاهلانه حکم می‌کنید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: چه چیزتان شده است، چگونه داوری می‌کنید؟ (هیچ می‌فهمید چه می‌گوئید؟!). [[«مَا لَکُمْ ...»: (نگا: یونس / 35).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: شما را چه می‌شود، چگونه داوری می‌کنید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: شما را چه شده است؟! چگونه حکم می‌کنید؟! (هیچ می‌فهمید چه می‌گویید؟!)

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: چه شود شما را چگونه حکم کنید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: چيست شما را، چگونه حكم مى‌كنيد؟- آنچه را خود نمى‌پسنديد به خدا نسبت مى‌دهيد!-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس شما را چه شده‌؟ چگونه داوری می‌کنید؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: What ails you that you judge in such a wise?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “What is the matter with you? What sort of a judgement you impose!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What ails you then, how you judge?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: What aileth you? How judge ye?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: What is the matter with you? How do you decide?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: What is the matter with you that you make such strange judgements?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: What is the matter with you How do you decide

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: What aileth you? How judge ye?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: What is [wrong] with you? How do you make judgement?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Woe to you! How terrible is your Judgment.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: What is the matter with you, how is it that you judge?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ma lakum kayfa tahkumoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: What is the matter with you? How do you form your judgement?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: What is the matter with you? How judge ye?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس آیا متذکّر [حقایق] نمی شوید؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا نمى‌انديشيد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: چرا متذكر نمى‌شويد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا سرِ پند گرفتن نداريد؟!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا (با این ادلّه روشن) باز متذکر نمی‌شوید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا یادآور نمی‌گردید (و از این بی‌خبریها به خود نمی‌آئید، و از این بیهوده‌گوئیها دست بر نمی‌دارید؟). [[«أَفَلا تَذَکَّرُونَ»: (نگا: انعام / 80، سجده / 4، یونس / 3).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا اندیشه نمی‌کنید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا متذکّر نمی‌شوید؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا یادآوری نمی‌شوید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا ياد نمى‌كنيد و پند نمى‌گيريد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا پس (از این هم) متذکر نمی‌شوید؟!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Why do you not reflect?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “So do you not ponder?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What, and will you not remember?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Will ye not then be admonished?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Will you not then remember?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Will you not reflect?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Will you then not take heed?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Will you not then remember

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Will ye not then reflect?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Will you not then take admonition?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: What, will you not remember?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then will you not be reminded?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do you not understand?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Will you not then mind?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Afala tathakkaroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Will you not then reflect?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Will ye not then receive admonition?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا شما [بر این ادعای خود] دلیل روشنی دارید؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا بر ادعاى خود دليل روشنى داريد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: يا دليل روشنى [در اختيار] داريد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا دليلى آشكار [در دست‌] داريد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا (برای عقیده باطل خود) دلیل روشنی دارید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یا این که شما دلیل روشن و روشنگری (در این زمینه) دارید؟ [[«سُلْطَانٌ»: دلیل و برهان (نگا: آل‌عمران / 151، نساء / 91 و 144 و 153، انعام / 81). مراد وحی آسمانی است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا حجتی آشکار در دست دارید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: یا شما دلیل روشنی در این باره دارید؟

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا شما را است فرمانروائی آشکار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر شما را حجتى روشن است؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا برایتان (در دعوایتان) سلطه‌ای آشکارگر است‌؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or have you received some clear authority?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Or do you have some clear proof?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or have you a clear authority?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Or, is there for you a clear warranty

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or is there for you a plain authority?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or do you have some clear proof?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do you have any clear authority for such claims?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or is there for you a plain authority

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or have ye a clear warrant?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do you have a manifest authority?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, do you have a clear authority?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or do you have a clear authority?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do you have clear authority?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or have you a clear authority?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am lakum sultanun mubeenun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Or have you clear evidence?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or have ye an authority manifest?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس اگر راستگویید، کتابتان را [که این سخنان را با تکیه بر آن می گویید، به میان] آورید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اگر راست مى‌گوييد كتابتان را بياوريد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس كتابتان را بياوريد اگر راست مى‌گوييد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس اگر راست مى‌گوييد كتابتان را بياوريد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: کتاب و برهان‌تان را بیاورید اگر راست می‌گویید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر راست می‌گوئید (که دلیل و برهانی دارید) کتاب خود را بیاورید و بنمائید. [[«بِکِتَابِکُمْ»: مراد از کتاب، کتاب آسمانی است. (نگا: زخرف / 21، فاطر / 40).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس اگر راست می‌گویید سندتان را بیاورید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: کتابتان را بیاورید اگر راست می‌گویید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس بیارید کتاب خویش را اگر هستید راستگویان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس كتاب خود را [كه از آنجا مى‌گوييد] بياريد، اگر راستگوييد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس اگر (از) راستان بوده‌اید، کتاب (وحیانی)تان را بیاورید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then bring your scripture, if what you say is true.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Then bring forth your Book, if you are truthful!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Bring your Book, if you speak truly!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then bring your book, if ye say sooth.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then bring your Book if you are truthful!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then bring your book, if you are telling the truth.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Bring your Book, if you are truthful.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then bring your Book if you are truthful!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then produce your writ, if ye are truthful.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then produce your scripture, should you be truthful.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Bring your Book, if what you say is true!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then produce your scripture, if you should be truthful.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Bring your book if what you say is true.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then bring your book, if you are truthful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fatoo bikitabikum in kuntum sadiqeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then produce your scriptures, if you are telling the truth.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then bring ye your Book (of authority) if ye be truthful!

verses.text: وَ جَعَلُوا بَيْنَهُ‌ وَ بَيْنَ‌ الْجِنَّةِ نَسَباً وَ لَقَدْ عَلِمَتِ‌ الْجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمْ‌ لَمُحْضَرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: میان خدا و جن، نسب و خویشی قرار دادند، در صورتی که جنیان به خوبی می دانند که [روز قیامت برای حساب و پاداش] احضار خواهند شد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و ميان خدا و جنيان خويشاوندى قائل شدند و جنيان مى‌دانند كه احضارشدگانند

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و ميان خدا و جنّ‌ها خويشاوندى انگاشتند و حال آن كه جنيان نيك دانسته‌اند كه خود احضار شونده‌اند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و ميان خدا و جن‌ها پيوندى انگاشتند و حال آنكه جنيان نيك دانسته‌اند كه [براى حساب پس‌دادن،] خودشان احضار خواهند شد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (فاسدتر از این عقیده آنکه) بین خدا و جنّ نسبت و خویشی برقرار کردند در صورتی که جنّیان می‌دانند که (این عقاید وهم و خرافات است و به محشر برای کیفر) احضار خواهند شد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان معتقد به خویشاوندی و نزدیکی میان خدا و جنّیان هستند. در صورتی که جنّیان می‌دانند که مشرکان (و هم خودشان، اگر شرک بورزند، در میان دوزخ) حاضر آورده می‌شوند. [[«جَعَلُوا»: مراد از ضمیر (و) مشرکان عرب است. «الْجِنَّةِ»: جنّیان. مراد شیاطین است. «إِنَّهُمْ»: که ایشان. مراد مشرکان عرب، یا جنّیان است. «لَمُحْضَرُونَ»: (نگا: روم / 16، سبأ / 38، یس / 32 و 53، صافّات / 127). «نَسَباً»: خویشی و خویشاوندی. قرابت و نسبت. مثلاً می‌گفتند: اهریمن و یزدان دو برادر یکدیگرند. اهریمن شَرور و لئیم، و یزدان بزرگوار و کریم است. اهریمن و یزدان شریک همدیگرند. اهریمن خالق شرّ و یزدان خالق خیر است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بین او و جن پیوندی قائل شدند، و جنیان خود به خوبی می‌دانند که ایشان [برای حساب‌] حاضر شدگانند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها [= مشرکان‌] میان او [= خداوند] و جنّ، (خویشاوندی و) نسبتی قائل شدند؛ در حالی که جنّیان بخوبی می‌دانند که این بت‌پرستان در دادگاه الهی احضار می‌شوند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بنهادند میان او و میان پریان پیوندی و هر آینه دانند پریان که ایشانند احضارشدگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و ميان او

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بین خدا و جنّیان نسبی قرار دادند، حال آنکه به‌راستی جنّیان نیک دانسته‌اند (که برای حساب پس‌دادن) همواره خودشان بی‌چون احضارشد‌گانند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They link Him with jinns by lineage, yet the jinns know they will be brought before Him.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And they have appointed a relationship between Him and the jinns; and indeed the jinns surely know that they will be brought forth.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They have set up a kinship between Him and the jinn; and the jinn know that they shall be arraigned.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they have made a kinship between Him and the jinn a kinship whereas the jinn assuredly know that they are to be brought up

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And they have invented a kinship between Him and the jinns, but the jinns know well that they have indeed to appear (before Him) (i.e. they will be brought for accounts).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And they invented a relationship between Him and the jinn. But the jinn know that they will be arraigned.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They have established a kinship between Allah and the angels; and the angels know well that these people will be arraigned (as culprits).

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And they have invented a kinship between Him and the Jinn, but the Jinn know well that they have indeed to appear (before Him).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they imagine kinship between him and the jinn, whereas the jinn know well that they will be brought before (Him).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And they have set up a kinship between Him and the jinn, while the jinn certainly know that they will be presented [before Him].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They assert kinship between Him and the angels. But the angels know that they (the liars) will be arraigned (in Hell).

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they have claimed between Him and the jinn a lineage, but the jinn have already known that they [who made such claims] will be brought to [punishment].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They have said that there is a relationship between Him and the jinn. The jinn certainly know that they will all be brought to suffer torment.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they assert a relationship between Him and the jinn; and certainly the jinn do know that they shall surely be brought up;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WajaAAaloo baynahu wabayna aljinnati nasaban walaqad AAalimati aljinnatu innahum lamuhdaroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They claim that He has kinship with the jinn, yet the jinn themselves know that they will be produced before Him [for judgement].

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And they have invented a blood-relationship between Him and the Jinns: but the Jinns know (quite well) that they have indeed to appear (before his Judgment-Seat)!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: خدا از آنچه او را به آن توصیف می کنند، منزّه است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: از آن وصف كه مى‌آورند خدا منزه است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: خدا منزه است از آنچه توصيف مى‌كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: خدا منزه است از آنچه در وصف مى‌آورند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: خدا ذات پاکش از این اوصاف که (از جهل) به او نسبت می‌دهند منزّه است (و همه شما مسئولید).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: خداوند، پاک و منزّه است از توصیفهائی که (این گروه مشرک و خرافه‌پرست) می‌کنند. [[«سُبْحَانَ ...»: (نگا: انبیاء / 22، مؤمنون / 91).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پاک و منزه است خداوند از آنچه می‌گویند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: منزّه است خداوند از آنچه توصیف می‌کنند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس منزّه است خدا از آنچه می‌ستایند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پاك است خداى از آنچه وصف مى‌كنند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: خدا منزّه است از آنچه (به غلط و نارسایی) توصیف می‌کنند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: God is too glorious for what they ascribe to Him

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Purity is to Allah from the matters they fabricate.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Glory be to God above that they describe,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Hallowed be Allah from that which they ascribe to Him.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Glorified is Allah! (He is Free) from what they attribute unto Him!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: God be glorified, far above what they allege.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (They say): “Exalted be Allah above what they attribute to Him,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Glorified be Allah! (He is free) from what they attribute unto Him!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Glorified be Allah from that which they attribute (unto Him),

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Clear is Allah of whatever they allege [about Him]

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Exaltations to Allah above what they describe,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Exalted is Allah above what they describe,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: God is too glorious to be described as they describe Him

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Glory be to Allah (for freedom) from what they describe;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Subhana Allahi AAamma yasifoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: God is far above what they attribute to Him,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Glory to Allah! (He is free) from the things they ascribe (to Him)!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: مگر بندگان خالص شده خدا [که او را به آنچه توصیف می کنند شایسته مقام قدس اوست.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مگر بندگان مخلص خدا.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مگر بندگان خالص شده‌ى خدا

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: به استثناى بندگان پاكدل خدا.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: جز بندگان پاک برگزیده خدا.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مگر بندگان مخلص خدا (که در دوزخ گرد آورده نمی‌شوند). [[«إِلاّ عِبَادَ ...»: برخی آنان را مستثنی از حضور در آتش می‌دانند و معنی آن در بالا گذشت. بعضی هم آنان را مستثنی می‌دانند از آنچه مشرکان توصیف می‌کنند. یعنی: جز توصیف بندگان مخلص خدا، هیچ توصیفی شایسته ذات مقدّس خدا نمی‌باشد. «الْمُخْلَصِینَ»: (نگا: صافّات / 40 و 74 و 128).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: مگر بندگان خداوند که اخلاص یافتگانند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مگر بندگان مخلص خدا!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: مگر بندگان خدا ناآلودگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مگر بندگان ويژه و برگزيده خداى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بجز بندگان اخلاص‌شده (از سوی) خدا (که او را به حقیقیت توصیف می‌کند).

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Except His chosen creatures who do not.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Except the chosen bondmen of Allah.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: except for God's sincere servants.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Except the bondmen of Allah sincere.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Except the slaves of Allah, whom He choses (for His Mercy i.e. true believers of Islamic Monotheism who do not attribute false things unto Allah).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Except for God’s sincere servants.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: all of them except the chosen servants of Allah.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Except the servants of Allah, whom He chooses.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Save single-minded slaves of Allah.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: —[all] except Allah’s exclusive servants.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: except for the sincere worshipers of Allah.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Except the chosen servants of Allah [who do not share in that sin].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: except the servants of God, sincere and devoted.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But not so the servants of Allah, the purified ones.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Illa AAibada Allahi almukhlaseena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: but not so the true servants of God,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Not (so do) the Servants of Allah, sincere and devoted.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و بی تردید شما و آنچه را می پرستید،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: شما و بتانى كه مى‌پرستيد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: در واقع شما [مشركان‌] و آنچه مى‌پرستيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در حقيقت، شما و آنچه [كه شما آن را] مى‌پرستيد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که شما و معبودانتان،

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: شما و چیزهائی که پرستش می‌کنید. [[«فَإِنَّکُمْ وَ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ»: اگر واژه (ما) موصوله بشمار آید، معنی چنین خواهد بود: شما و چیزهائی که می‌پرستید. شما با معبودهایتان بمانید. اگر هم واژه (ما) مصدریّه به حساب آید، معنی چنین می‌شود: شما و عبادتی که می‌کنید. شما در گرو عبادتی هستید که می‌کنید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بدانید که شما و آنچه می‌پرستید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: شما و آنچه را پرستش می‌کنید،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا شما و آنچه می‌پرستید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا شما و آنچه مى‌پرستيد- بتان-،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس همانا، شما و آنچه (که شما آن را) می‌پرستید،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So neither you nor those you worship

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore you and all what you worship. (The disbelievers and their deities.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But as for you, and that you serve,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Wherefore verily neither ye nor that which ye worship,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So, verily you (pagans) and those whom you worship (idols).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Surely, you and what you serve.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So you and your deities

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, verily you and those whom you worship

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! verily, ye and that which ye worship,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed you and what you worship

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But as for you, and that you worship,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So indeed, you [disbelievers] and whatever you worship,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: You and whatever you worship

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So surely you and what you worship,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fainnakum wama taAAbudoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: neither you nor what you worship

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: For, verily, neither ye nor those ye worship-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: نمی توانید [مردم را] بر ضد خدا گمراه کنید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نتوانستيد مفتون بتان كنيد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: نمى‌توانيد بر ضد آن [هدف الهى‌] فتنه‌انگيز باشيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بر ضد او گمراه‌گر نيستيد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: نتوانستید آنها را مفتون و گمراه کنید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هرگز نمی‌توانید کسی را با فتنه و فساد از خداپرستی منحرف سازید (و به بت‌پرستی بکشانید). [[«مَآ أَنتُمْ»: واژه (ما) نافیه است. «عَلَیْهِ»: ضمیر (ه) به خداوند بر می‌گردد و جار و مجرور متعلّق به (فَاتِنِینَ) است. «فَاتِنِینَ»: گول زنندگان. منحرف کنندگان. مفسدین. حرف (ب) زائد و برای تأکید نفی نسبت ما بعد خود از ما قبل خود به کار می‌رود. «مَآ أَنتُمْ عَلَیْهِ بِفَآتِنِینَ»: ای کفّار مکّه! شما و بتهائی که می‌پرستید یا شما و عبادتی که می‌کنید، هرگز نمی‌توانید بندگان شایسته خدا را تباه و منحرف سازید، و گول زنید و فریب دهید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: شما کسی را به گمراهی نمی‌کشید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هرگز نمی‌توانید کسی را (با آن) فریب دهید،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نیستید بر آن فریب‌دهندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: نيستيد بر او

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بر ضدّ او [:خدا] فتنه‌گر نتوانید بود.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Can mislead anyone away from Him,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: You cannot make anyone rebel against Him.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: you shall not tempt any against Him

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Can tempt anyone to rebel against Him.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
