translations.text: Cannot lead astray [turn away from Him (Allah) anyone of the believers],

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Cannot seduce away from Him.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: shall not be able to tempt anyone away from Allah

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Cannot lead astray,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Ye cannot excite (anyone) against Him.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: cannot mislead [anyone] about Him,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: you shall tempt none against Him

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: You cannot tempt [anyone] away from Him

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: cannot mislead anyone

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Not against Him can you cause (any) to fall into trial,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ma antum AAalayhi bifatineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: can lure away from God any

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Can lead (any) into temptation concerning Allah,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: مگر کسانی را که [به اختیار خود به خاطر پذیرفتن وسوسه و اغواگری شما] به دوزخ درآیند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مگر آن كس را كه راهى جهنم باشد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مگر كسى را كه به آتش وارد شدنى است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مگر كسى را كه به دوزخ رفتنى است!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: جز آن کس را که اهل دوزخ است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مگر کسی را که مایل باشد به آتش دوزخ بسوزد. [[«صَالِ»: مخفّف صالی، کسی که با آتش بسوزد. از ماده (صلی) که سوختن با آتش است (نگا: مریم / 70، انشقاق / 12).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: مگر کسی را که درآینده به دوزخ است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مگر آنها که در آتش دوزخ وارد می‌شوند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: مگر آن را که او است چشنده دوزخ‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مگر كسى را كه به آتش دوزخ در آيد- دوزخى باشد-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: مگر کسی که آتش‌افروز (دوزخ) پرسوز است!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Except one who is (destined) to burn in Hell.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Except the one who will go into the blazing fire.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: except him who shall roast in Hell.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Save him Who is to roast in the Flaming Fire.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Except those who are predestined to burn in Hell!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Except for he who will be roasting in Hell.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: except him who shall roast in the Blazing Fire.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Except those who are predestined to burn in Hell!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Save him who is to burn in hell.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: except someone who is bound for hell.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: except for he who shall roast in Hell.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Except he who is to [enter and] burn in the Hellfire.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: except those who are doomed to enter hell.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Save him who will go to hell.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Illa man huwa sali aljaheemi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: except those who will burn in Hell.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Except such as are (themselves) going to the blazing Fire!

verses.text: وَ مَا مِنَّا إِلاَّ لَهُ‌ مَقَامٌ‌ مَعْلُومٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و هیچ یک از ما فرشتگان نیست مگر اینکه برای او مقامی معین است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و هيچ كس از ما نيست مگر آنكه جايى معين دارد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و هيچ يك از ما [فرشتگان‌] نيست مگر اين كه براى او مقام [و موقعيتى‌] معين است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و هيچ يك از ما [فرشتگان‌] نيست مگر [اينكه‌] براى او [مقام و] مرتبه‌اى معيّن است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (ای رسول ما، مشرکان را بگو که فرشتگان می‌گویند) هیچ کس از ما فرشتگان نیست جز آنکه او را (در بندگی حق) مقامی معین است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هر یک از ما مقام مشخّص و جایگاه جداگانه‌ای داریم (و در آنجا و در آن پُست به انجام وظیفه مشغول و گوش به فرمان یزدانیم). [[«مَا مِنَّا إِلاّ ...»: گویندگان کلام فرشتگانند که بت‌پرستان ایشان را دختران خدا می‌پنداشتند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [و فرشتگان گویند] هیچ کس از ما نیست مگر آنکه پایگاهی معین دارد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و هیچ یک از ما نیست جز آنکه مقام معلومی دارد؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نیست از ما مگر او را است پایگاهی دانسته‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و از ما [فرشتگان‌] هيچ كس نيست مگر او را جايگاهى است معلوم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و هیچ یک از ما (فرشتگان) نیست، مگر (اینکه) برای او مقام و مرتبه‌ای معلوم است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "There is not one of us who does not have his appointed place," (declare the angels.)

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And the angels say, “Each one of us has an appointed known position.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: None of us is there, but has a known station;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Of us there is none but hath a station assigned.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: There is not one of us (angels) but has his known place (or position);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “There is not one of us but has an assigned position.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: As for us, there is none but has an appointed station.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And there is not one of us (angels) but has his known place;

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: There is not one of us but hath his known position.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘There is none among us but has a known place.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (Gabriel said to the Prophet): 'Each of us has a known place.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [The angels say], "There is not among us any except that he has a known position.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The angels say, "Each of us has an appointed place.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And there is none of us but has an assigned place,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama minna illa lahu maqamun maAAloomun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: [The angels say], "Every single one of us has his place assigned:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Those ranged in ranks say): "Not one of us but has a place appointed;

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و همانا ما [برای اجرای فرمان خدا] صف بستگانیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هر آينه ما صف زدگانيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و البته ما [براى اطاعت خدا] به صف ايستاده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و در حقيقت، ماييم كه [براى انجام فرمان خدا] صف بسته‌ايم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و همه (به فرمان خدا) نیکو صف آراسته‌ایم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و ما جملگی (برای اطاعت یزدان و اجرای فرمان خداوند سبحان) به صف ایستاده‌ایم (و کسی از ما جرأت حرکت از جای خود، و گام بیرون نهادن از دائره‌ی حوزه‌ی کارش را ندارد). [[«الصَّآفُّونَ»: به صف ایستادگان (نگا: صافّات / 1).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و ماییم که صف در صفیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و ما همگی (برای اطاعت فرمان خداوند) به صف ایستاده‌ایم؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و هر آینه مائیم صف‌کشندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه ماييم صف زدگان [براى طاعت‌].

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و به‌راستی، ماییم که (برای انجام فرمان خدا) به‌درستی صف اندر صفیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "And we are truly those who stand in rows,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And indeed we, with our wings spread, await the command.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: we are the rangers,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily we! we are ranged in ranks.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, we (angels), we stand in rows for the prayers (as you Muslims stand in rows for your prayers);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And we are the arrangers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Verily we range ourselves in rows (as humble servants)

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily, we (angels), we stand in rows;

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! we, even we are they who set the ranks,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It is we who are the ranged ones.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We are surely those who are arranged in ranks.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, we are those who line up [for prayer].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We stand in ranks (for prayer)

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely we are they who draw themselves out in ranks,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainna lanahnu alssaffoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: we are those who stand ranged in ranks.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "And we are verily ranged in ranks (for service);

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و ما خود تسبیح کنندگانیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و هر آينه ما تسبيح‌گويندگانيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و بى‌ترديد ما جملگى تسبيح گويان او هستيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و ماييم كه خود تسبيح‌گويانيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و دایم به تسبیح و ستایش او مشغولیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و ما جملگی، به تسبیح و تقدیس خدا مشغولیم (و ستایشگران ایزد بیچونیم). [[«الْمُسَبِّحُونَ»: تسبیح گویان (نگا: انبیاء / 20 و 26 و 27).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و ماییم که تسبیح گویانیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و ما همه تسبیح‌گوی او هستیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا مائیم تسبیح‌کنندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و همانا ماييم تسبيح‌گويان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و همانا ما، خودهامان همواره تسبیح‌گویانیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And we are those who sing hallelujas to Him."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And indeed we are those who say His purity.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: we are they that give glory.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily we! we halloW.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, we (angels), we are they who glorify (Allah's Praises i.e. perform prayers).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And we are the glorifiers.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and we are of those who glorify Allah.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily, we (angels) indeed are those who glorify.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! we, even we are they who hymn His praise

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It is we who celebrate Allah’s glory.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And we are they who exalt (Allah)'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, we are those who exalt Allah."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and we glorify God".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And we are most surely they who declare the glory (of Allah).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainna lanahnu almusabbihoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We glorify God."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "And we are verily those who declare (Allah's) glory!"

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و مشرکان [پیش از بعثت پیامبر] قاطعانه می گفتند:

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اگر چه مى‌گفتند:

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و [مشركان‌] به تأكيد مى‌گفتند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و [مشركان‌] به تأكيد مى‌گفتند:

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و همانا کافران می‌گفتند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هر چند مشرکان (پیش از بعثت) می‌گفتند: [[«إِنْ»: مخفّف از مثقّله است. اصل آن «إِنَّ» است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و آنان ادعا می‌کردند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها پیوسته می‌گفتند:

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و هر چند (یا همانا) بودند می‌گفتند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه [كافران مكه‌] مى‌گفتند:

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و گرچه آنان بی‌‌امان می‌گفته‌اند:

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They used to say:

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed the disbelievers used to say, –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What though they would say,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they surely were wont to say:

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And indeed they (Arab pagans) used to say;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Even though they used to say.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They used to say before:

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And indeed they used to say:

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And indeed they used to say:

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They indeed, used to say,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: What, would they then say:

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, the disbelievers used to say,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Even though they (unbelievers) say,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And surely they used to say:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wain kanoo layaqooloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They say,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And there were those who said,

verses.text: لَوْ أَنَ‌ عِنْدَنَا ذِکْراً مِنَ‌ الْأَوَّلِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: اگر نزد ما کتابی چون کتاب های آسمانی پیامبران پیشین بود،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اگر از پيشينيان نزد ما كتابى مانده بود،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اگر پندنامه‌اى از پيشينيان نزد ما بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: «اگر پند [نامه‌ا]ى از پيشينيان نزد ما بود،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که اگر نزد ما کتابی از رسولان پیشین بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر کتابی همچون کتابهای (آسمانی) پیشینیان می‌داشتیم. [[«ذِکْراً»: مراد کتابی، همچون کتابهای آسمانی انبیاء است (نگا: اعراف / 63 و 69، حجر / 6 و 9، انبیاء / 2 و 24 و 50). «الأوَّلِینَ»: (نگا: حجر / 10 و 13، فاطر / 43، شعراء / 26 و 137 و 184 و 196).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که اگر در دست ما کتابی از [کتابهای آسمانی‌] پیشینیان بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: «اگر یکی از کتابهای پیشینیان نزد ما بود،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که اگر می‌بود نزد ما یادآوریی از پیشینیان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اگر نزد ما كتابى و پندى از پيشينيان بود- يعنى مانند آنان كتاب آسمانى داشتيم-،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «اگر همواره یادواره‌ای از پیشینیان نزدمان بود،»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: If we had the account of earlier people with us,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “If we had some advice from the earlier generations,” –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: 'If only we had had a Reminder from the ancients,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Had we but an admonition as had the ancients.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "If we had a reminder as had the men of old (before the coming of Prophet Muhammad SAW as a Messenger of Allah).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “Had we received advice from the ancients.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: “If only we had the Reminder which had been granted to the people of yore

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "If we had a reminder as had the men of old,"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: If we had but a reminder from the men of old

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘Had we possessed a Reminder from our predecessors,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'If only we had a reminder from the ancients,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: "If we had a message from [those of] the former peoples,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: "Had we received guidance from the people living before us,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Had we a reminder from those of yore,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Law anna AAindana thikran mina alawwaleena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: "If we had had with us a Book like that of the people of old,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "If only we had had before us a Message from those of old,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید از بندگان خالص شده خدا می شدیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما از بندگان مخلص خدا مى‌بوديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: قطعا بندگان خالص شده‌ى خدا مى‌شديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: قطعاً از بندگان خالص خدا مى‌شديم!»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ما هم البته از بندگان برگزیده خدا می‌بودیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما قطعاً بندگان مخلص خدا می‌شدیم. [[«الْمُخْلَصِینَ»: (نگا: صافّات / 40 و 74 و 128).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌شک از بندگان اخلاص یافته خداوند می‌شدیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: به یقین، ما بندگان مخلص خدا بودیم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: هر آینه می‌بودیم بندگان خدا ناآلودگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هر آينه بندگان ويژه خدا مى‌بوديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «بی‌چون بندگان خالص‌شده‌ی خدا بوده‌ایم!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We would have been the chosen creatures of God."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “We would certainly be the chosen bondmen of Allah.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: then were we God's sincere servants.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Surefy we would have been the bondmen of God sincere.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "We would have indeed been the chosen slaves of Allah (true believers of Islamic Monotheism)!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We would have been God's faithful servants.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: we would surely have been Allah's chosen servants.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "We would have indeed been the chosen servants of Allah!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: We would be single-minded slaves of Allah.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: we would have surely been Allah’s exclusive servants.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: we would have been sincere worshipers of Allah'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: We would have been the chosen servants of Allah."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: we would have certainly been sincere servants of God".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: We would certainly have been the servants of Allah-- the purified ones.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Lakunna AAibada Allahi almukhlaseena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: we would surely have been God's chosen servants,"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "We should certainly have been Servants of Allah, sincere (and devoted)!"

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: ولی [هنگامی که قرآن را برای هدایت آنان نازل کردیم] به آن کافر شدند و به زودی [و زر و وبال کفرشان را] خواهند دانست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنها به آن كتاب كافر شدند، و زودا كه خواهند فهميد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: ولى [وقتى قرآن آمد] به آن كافر شدند پس به زودى خواهند دانست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: ولى [وقتى قرآن آمد] به آن كافر شدند، و زودا كه بدانند!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (دروغ می‌گفتند، زیرا آن قرآن بزرگ خدا آمد و) به آن کافر شدند و به زودی (کیفر خود را) خواهند دانست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (آرزوی آنان جامه‌ی عمل به خود پوشید و بزرگترین کتاب آسمانی قرآن برای ایشان فرو فرستاده شد) و ایشان بدان کفر ورزیدند، و فرجام کار خود را خواهند دانست. [[«بِهِ»: به آن کتاب آسمانی که قرآن است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ولی آن [کتاب آسمانی/ قرآن‌] را انکار کردند، زودا که بدانند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (امّا هنگامی که این کتاب بزرگ آسمانی بر آنها نازل شد،) به آن کافر شدند؛ ولی بزودی (نتیجه کار خود را) خواهند دانست!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس کفر ورزیدند بدان پس زود است بدانند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس به آن- قرآن- كافر شدند، و زودا كه [سرانجام گمراهى خويش را] بدانند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: در نتیجه به آن کافر شدند، پس در آینده‌ای دور خواهند دانست!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Yet now (that it has come) they refuse to believe in it; but they will come to know soon.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They therefore denied it, so they will soon come to know.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But they disbelieved in it; soon they shall know!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Yet they disbelieve therein. Presently they shall come to know.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But (now that the Quran has come) they disbelieve therein (i.e. in the Quran and in Prophet Muhammad SAW, and all that which he brought, the Divine Revelation), so they will come to know!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But they rejected it, so they will find out.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But when it came to them, they rejected it. They shall soon come to know (the end of such an attitude).

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But (now) they disbelieve therein, so they will come to know!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Yet (now that it is come) they disbelieve therein; but they will come to know.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But they disbelieved it [when it came to them]. Soon they will know!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But they disbelieve in it (the Koran), but soon they shall know!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But they disbelieved in it, so they are going to know.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They have rejected the Quran. They will soon know the consequences (of their disbelief).

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But (now) they disbelieve in it, so they will come to know.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fakafaroo bihi fasawfa yaAAlamoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: but they have rejected it, [the Quran] and they shall soon learn!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But (now that the Qur'an has come), they reject it: But soon will they know!

verses.text: وَ لَقَدْ سَبَقَتْ‌ کَلِمَتُنَا لِعِبَادِنَا الْمُرْسَلِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و وعده قطعی ما درباره بندگان به رسالت فرستاده شده، از پیش محقق و ثابت گشته است،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما در باره بندگانمان كه به رسالت مى‌فرستيم از پيش تصميم گرفته‌ايم،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و قطعا وعده‌ى [نصرت‌] ما براى بندگان فرستاده شده‌ى ما از پيش مسلم شده است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و قطعاً فرمان ما در باره بندگان فرستاده ما از پيش [چنين‌] رفته است:

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و همانا عهد ما در باره بندگانی که به رسالت فرستادیم (چنین در علم ازلی) سبقت گرفته است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: وعده‌ی ما راجع به بندگان فرستاده‌ی ما قبلاً (در لوح محفوظ) ثبت و ضبط گشته است. [[«لَقَدْ سَبَقَتْ کَلِمَتُنَا ...»: (نگا: یونس / 19، انبیاء / 101).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و حکم ما در حق بندگان به رسالت فرستاده‌مان از پیش معین شده است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: وعده قطعی ما برای بندگان فرستاده ما از پیش مسلّم شده...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و هر آینه سبقت گرفت سخن ما به بندگان ما فرستادگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه سخن ما براى بندگان فرستاده‌مان پيشى گرفته است،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و به‌راستی و درستی کلمه‌ی ما برای بندگان فرستاده‌شده‌ی ما از پیش (چنان) رفته است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Our word had already been given before to Our votaries, the apostles, --

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed Our Word has already gone forth for Our bondmen who were sent.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Already Our Word has preceded to Our servants, the Envoys;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And assuredly Our word hath already gone forth Our bondmen, the sent ones:

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And, verily, Our Word has gone forth of old for Our slaves, the Messengers,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Our Word has already gone out to our servant messengers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We have already given Our promise to Our Messengers

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And, verily, Our Word has gone forth of old for Our servants, the Messengers,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And verily Our word went forth of old unto Our bondmen sent (to warn)

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Certainly Our decree has gone beforehand in favour of Our servants, the apostles,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Our Word had already preceded Our worshipers, the Messengers,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And Our word has already preceded for Our servants, the messengers,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We decreed that Our Messenger servants

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And certainly Our word has already gone forth in respect of Our servants, the apostles:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walaqad sabaqat kalimatuna liAAibadina almursaleena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: And surely Our word has gone forth respecting Our servants, the messengers:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Already has Our Word been passed before (this) to our Servants sent (by Us),

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: که بی تردید آنان [در همه زمینه ها] یاری شدگانند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كه هر آينه آنان يارى مى‌شوند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه آنان حتما [از طرف ما] يارى شدگانند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كه آنان [بر دشمنان خودشان‌] حتماً پيروز خواهند شد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که البته آنها (بر کافران) فتح و فیروزی یابند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و آن این که ایشان قطعاً یاری می‌گردند. [[«الْمَنصُورُونَ»: یاری شوندگان (نگا: روم / 47، حجّ / 40، غافر / 51).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ایشانند که نصرت یافتگانند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: که آنان یاری شدگانند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که ایشانند همانا یاری‌شدگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه همانا ايشان يارى‌شدگانند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آنان به‌راستی (بر دشمنانشان) بی‌گمان یاری‌شدگاند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: That they would be helped,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: That undoubtedly, only they will be helped.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: assuredly they shall be helped,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: That verily they! they shall be made triumphant.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: That they verily would be made triumphant.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It is they who will be supported.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: that they shall certainly be succoured,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: That they verily would be made triumphant,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: That they verily would be helped,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: that they will indeed receive [Allah’s] help,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: that they shall receive Our help

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [That] indeed, they would be those given victory

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: will certainly be victorious

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Most surely they shall be the assisted ones

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Innahum lahumu almansooroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: that it is certainly they who will be helped;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: That they would certainly be assisted,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و مسلماً سپاه ما پیروزند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و لشكر ما خود غالبند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و سپاه ما بى‌ترديد همانها پيروزند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و سپاه ما هرآينه غالب‌آيندگانند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و همیشه سپاه ما (بر دشمن) غالبند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و لشکر ما حتماً پیروز می‌شوند. [[«الْغَالِبُونَ»: چیره شوندگان. پیروزمندان. (نگا: مجادله / 21). یادآوری: وعده خداوند مبنی بر پیروزی لشکر اسلام و غلبه مؤمنان، یک وعده مشروط است؛ نه مطلق. مشروط به بندگان حقیقی و لشکریان راستین خدا بودن و تلاش در مسیر الهی با افکار و برنامه‌های آسمانی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و سپاه ماست که ایشان پیروزند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و لشکر ما پیروزند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا سپاه ما آنانند پیروزمندان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه سپاه ما- پيروان انبياء- چيره و پيروزند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بی‌گمان سپاهمان همان پیروزمندانند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And that certainly Our armies will be victorious.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And surely, only Our army will be victorious.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and Our host -- they are the victors.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily Our host! they are to be overcome.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And that Our hosts, they verily would be the victors.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And Our troops will be the victors.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and that Our hosts shall triumph.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And that Our hosts! they verily would be the victors.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And that Our host, they verily would be the victors.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and indeed Our hosts will be the victors.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and Our armies shall be the victors.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And [that] indeed, Our soldiers will be those who overcome.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and that Our army will be triumphant.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely Our host alone shall be the victorious ones.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainna jundana lahumu alghaliboona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and that it is Our host that would certainly triumph.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And that Our forces,- they surely must conquer.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس تا مدتی از آنان روی بگردان.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس تا مدتى از آنها روى بگردان.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس [اى محمد!] تا مدتى از آنان [كافران‌] روى بگردان [تا فرمان جهاد آيد]

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس تا مدتى [معيّن‌] از آنان روى برتاب.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس اینک روی از آنها بگردان تا به وقتی معیّن.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: از آنان دست بدار و ایشان را تا مدّت زمانی معیّن به حال خود واگذار. [[«فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ»: ایشان را به حال خود بگذار. از آنان روی بگردان و صبر داشته باش (نگا: نساء / 81، انعام / 91). «حَتّی حِینٍ»: تا زمانی. مراد تا زمانی که به تو اجازه جنگ می‌دهیم و تو را بر آنان چیره و پیروز می‌گردانیم و ننگ شکست و رسوائی بدیشان می‌چشانیم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس تا مدتی از آنان روی بگردان‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: از آنها [= کافران‌] روی بگردان تا زمان معیّنی (که فرمان جهاد فرارسد)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس روی برتاب از ایشان تا هنگامی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس تا مدتى- هنگام يارى ما- از آنان روى بگردان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس تا مدّتی (معیّن) از آنان روی برتاب.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So you ignore them for a time

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore turn away from them for some time.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So turn thou from them for a while,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So turn thou aside from them for a season.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So turn away (O Muhammad SAW) from them for a while,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So disregard them for a while.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So, (O Prophet), leave them alone for a while,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, turn away from them for a while,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So withdraw from them (O Muhammad) awhile,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So leave them alone for a while,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So turn (away) from them for a while.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So, [O Muhammad], leave them for a time.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), stay away from them for a while

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Therefore turn away from them till a time,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fatawalla AAanhum hatta heenin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So turn away from them for a while.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So turn thou away from them for a little while,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و آنان را بنگر که به زودی [و زر و وبال گناهانشان را] خواهند دید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: عاقبتشان را ببين، آنها نيز خواهند ديد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [عاقبت‌] آنها را بنگر كه به زودى [آنها نيز] خواهند ديد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و آنان را بنگر كه خواهند ديد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (عذاب دنیا و آخرت) آنها را به چشم ببین که آنها هم به زودی (فتح و فیروزی تو را) خواهند دید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (آن وقت) نگاهشان کن (که چه بلائی بر سرشان می‌آید) و آنان خود بالأخره خواهند دید (هزیمت خویش را و نصرت شما را). [[«أَبْصِرْ بِهِمْ»: نگاهشان کن. بنگرشان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بنگر ایشان را، که زودا به دیده بصیرت بنگرند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و وضع آنها را بنگر (چه بی‌محتواست) اما بزودی (نتیجه اعمال خود را) می‌بینند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بنگرشان که زود است می‌نگرند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و [اينك‌] آنان را بنگر- تا هنگام انتقام بازشناسى-، پس بزودى [وبال كفر خود را] خواهند نگريست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و آنان را بنگر. پس (همانان) در دور زمان خواهند نگریست.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And wait; they will come to know soon.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And watch them, for they will soon see.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and see them; soon they shall see!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And see them thou; they themselves shall presently see.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And watch them and they shall see (the punishment)!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And watch them—they will soon see.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and see, and soon they too shall see.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And watch them and they shall see!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And watch, for they will (soon) see.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and watch them; soon they will see [the truth of the matter]!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: See them and soon they shall see.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And see [what will befall] them, for they are going to see.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and watch them. They, too, will watch.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And (then) see them, so they too shall see.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waabsirhum fasawfa yubsiroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Watch them: they will soon see.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And watch them (how they fare), and they soon shall see (how thou farest)!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا شتاب در آمدن عذاب ما را می خواهند؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا عذاب ما را به شتاب مى‌طلبند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا به عذاب ما عجله مى‌كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا عذاب ما را شتابزده خواستارند؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا کافران (به تمسخر، از تو) عذاب ما را با تعجیل می‌طلبند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا عذاب ما را باشتاب می‌خواهند؟! (مگر خِرد ندارند؟!). [[«یَسْتَعْجِلُونَ»: بشتاب می‌خواهند. زود فرا رسیدن را می‌خواهند مراد از عذاب مذکور در آیه، عذاب دنیوی (نگا: سجده / 28) و عذاب اخروی است (نگا: یونس / 48، انبیاء / 38، نمل / 71، سبأ / 29، یس / 48).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا عذاب ما را به شتاب می‌خواهند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا آنها برای عذاب ما شتاب می‌کنند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا به عذاب ما شتاب خواهند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا عذاب ما را به شتاب مى‌خواهند؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس آیا عذاب ما را شتابزده خواستارند؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do they want to hasten Our punishment?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So are they being impatient for Our punishment?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What, do they seek to hasten Our chastisement?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Our torment seek they to hasten on!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Do they seek to hasten on Our Torment?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Are they seeking to hasten Our punishment?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do they seek to hasten Our chastisement?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Do they seek to hasten on Our torment

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Would they hasten on Our doom?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do they seek to hasten Our punishment?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: What, do they seek to hasten Our punishment?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then for Our punishment are they impatient?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do they want to suffer Our torment immediately?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: What! would they then hasten on Our chastisement?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: AfabiAAathabina yastaAAjiloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do they really wish to hasten Our punishment?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Do they wish (indeed) to hurry on our Punishment?

verses.text: فَإِذَا نَزَلَ‌ بِسَاحَتِهِمْ‌ فَسَاءَ صَبَاحُ‌ الْمُنْذَرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس هنگامی که [عذاب ما] به آستانه خانه هایشان نازل شود، بیم شدگان روزگار بدی خواهند داشت،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون عذاب به ساحتشان فراز آيد، اين بيم‌داده‌شدگان چه بامداد بدى خواهند داشت.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس وقتى [عذاب ما] به آستانه آنها فرود آيد، صبحگاه بيم داده شدگان بد خواهد بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [پس هشدارداده‌شدگان را] آنگاه كه عذاب به خانه آنان فرود آيد چه بد صبحگاهى است!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (بدانند که) چون عذاب قهر الهی پیرامون دیارشان فرود آید (بر آن کافران شبی بگذرد که) صبح بسیار بدی خواهند داشت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هنگامی که عذاب ما در حیاط منازلشان (و در میدان زندگیشان) فرود آمد، بیم‌شدگان چه بامداد بدی خواهند داشت! [[«بِسَاحَتِهِمْ»: در حیاط ایشان. در میدان زندگی آنان. «سَاحَة»: حیاط، میدان. «صَبَاحُ»: بامداد. صبح. مراد بامداد بیداری از خواب غفلت، یا صبح معمولی است که عذاب در چنین وقتی به سراغ ایشان می‌آید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه که به سرای ایشان فرود آید، چه بد است بامداد [عذاب‌] هشدار یافتگان‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: امّا هنگامی که عذاب ما در آستانه خانه‌هایشان فرود آید، انذارشدگان صبحگاه بدی خواهند داشت!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تا گاهی که فرود آید به ساحت ایشان پس چه زشت است بامداد بیم‌دادگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و چون [عذاب‌] به درگاه سراى آنها فرود آيد، پس بدا بامداد آن بيم‌شدگان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس، آن‌گاه که (عذابمان) به جایگاه و پایگاه وسیعشان فرود آید، چه بد صبحگاهی برای هشدارشدگان است!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When it comes down on their plains, it will be an evil dawn for those who had been warned.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So when it does descend in their courtyards – so what an evil morning it will be for those who were warned!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: When it lights in their courtyard, how evil will be the morning of them that are warned!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then when it descendeth Unto them face to, face, a hapless morn that shall be for those who were Warned.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then, when it descends into their courtyard (i.e. near to them), evil will be the morning for those who had been warned!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: When it descends into their yard, miserable will be the morning of those forewarned.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: When that chastisement will descend upon their courtyard, evil shall that Day be for those who had been warned.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then, when it descends in their courtyard, evil will be the morning for those who had warned!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But when it cometh home to them, then it will be a hapless morn for those who have been warned.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But when it descends in their courtyard it will be a dismal dawn for those who had been warned.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: When it descends upon their courtyards, evil will be the morning of those forewarned.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But when it descends in their territory, then evil is the morning of those who were warned.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When it descends into their courtyard, it will be terrible for those who have already been warned.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But when it shall descend in their court, evil shall then be the morning of the warned ones.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faitha nazala bisahatihim fasaa sabahu almunthareena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: When it descends on their courtyards, how terrible that morning will be for those who were warned!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But when it descends into the open space before them, evil will be the morning for those who were warned (and heeded not)!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و تا مدتی از آنان روی بگردان،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: از آنها تا چندى روى بگردان.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و از ايشان تا مدتى روى بگردان

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و از ايشان تا مدتى [معيّن‌] روى برتاب.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: اینک روی از آنها بگردان تا به وقتی معین.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: دست از آنان بدار و ایشان را تا مدّت زمانی معیّن به حال خود واگذار. [[«تَوَلَّ ...»: (نگا: صافّات / 174). تکرار آیه، برای تأکید بیشتر است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و تا مدتی از آنان روی بگردان‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: از آنان روی بگردان تا زمان معیّنی!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و پشت کن بر ایشان تا زمانی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و از آنان تا هنگامى روى بگردان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و از ایشان تا مدّتی روی برتاب.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So turn away from them for a time

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And turn away from them for some time.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So turn thou from them for a while,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And turn thou aside from them for a season.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So turn (O Muhammad SAW) away from them for a while,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So avoid them for a while.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Leave them alone for a while,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, turn away from them for a while,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Withdraw from them awhile

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So leave them alone for a while,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So turn (away) from them for a while,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And leave them for a time.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Stay away from them for a while

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And turn away from them till a time

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Watawalla AAanhum hatta heenin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So turn away from them for a while.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So turn thou away from them for a little while,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [آنان را] بنگر که به زودی [و زر و وبال گناهانشان را] خواهند دید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس عاقبتشان را ببين، آنها نيز خواهند ديد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و [عاقبتشان را] بنگر كه به زودى [آنها نيز] خواهند ديد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و بنگر كه خواهند ديد!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (عذاب و ذلّت آنها را) به چشم ببین که آنها هم به زودی (فتح و فیروزی تو را) خواهند دید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (آن وقت، کار آشفته و وضع پریشان ایشان را) تو ببین، و آنان خودشان هم (فرجام بد و حال تباه خویش را) خواهند دید. [[«أَبْصِرْ ...»: (نگا: صافّات / 175). تکرار به خاطر تأکید است. یا این که آیه‌های 174 و 175 اشاره به شکست و رسوائی حتمی دنیوی کافران، و پیروزی و والائی قطعی دنیوی مؤمنان دارد، و آیه‌های 178 و 179 بیانگر مجازات و کیفر سخت الهی و ناکامی و بدبختی قطعی اخروی افراد بی‌دین و ایمان است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بنگر زودا که به دیده بصیرت بنگرند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و وضع کارشان را ببین؛ آنها نیز به زودی (نتیجه اعمال خود را) می‌بینند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بنگر که زود است می‌نگرند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و بنگر، پس آنها نيز خواهند نگريست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بنگر. پس در دُور زمان خواهند نگریست!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And watch; they will come to know soon.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And wait, for they will soon see.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and see; soon they shall see!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And see thou: they themselves shall presently see.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And watch and they shall see (the torment)!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And watch—they will soon see.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and see; and they too shall soon see.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And watch and they shall see!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And watch, for they will (soon) see.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and watch; soon they will see!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and see, soon they shall see!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And see, for they are going to see.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and watch. They, too, will watch.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And (then) see, for they too shall see.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waabsir fasawfa yubsiroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: And watch, for they will soon see.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And watch (how they fare) and they soon shall see (how thou farest)!

verses.text: سُبْحَانَ‌ رَبِّکَ‌ رَبِ‌ الْعِزَّةِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پروردگارت که دارای عزت است از آنچه او را به آن توصیف می کنند، منزّه است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: منزه است پروردگار تو -آن پروردگار پيروزمند- از هر چه به وصف او مى‌گويند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: منزه است پروردگار تو، صاحب عزت و بزرگى، از آنچه وصف مى‌كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: منزه است پروردگار تو، پروردگار شكوهمند، از آنچه وصف مى‌كنند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پاک و منزه است پروردگار تو که خدایی مقتدر و بی‌همتاست و از توصیف (جاهلانه) خلق مبرّاست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پاک و منزّه است خداوندگار تو از توصیفهائی که (مشرکان درباره‌ی خدا به هم می‌بافند و سر هم) می‌کنند، خداوندگار عزّت و قدرت. [[«رَبُّ الْعِزَّةِ»: خداوند عزّت. صاحب قدرت و قوّت. «الْعِزَّةِ»: غلبه. قوّه.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پاک و منزه است پروردگارت، که پروردگار پیروزمند است، از آنچه می‌گویند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: منزّه است پروردگار تو، پروردگار عزّت (و قدرت) از آنچه آنان توصیف می‌کنند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: منزّه است پروردگار تو پروردگار عزّت از آنچه می‌ستایند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پاك است پروردگار تو، خداوند عزت- بزرگى و نيرو و غلبه-، از آنچه [او را بدان‌] وصف مى‌كنند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: منزّه است پروردگار تو، پروردگار با عزت، از آنچه وصف می‌کنند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Too glorious is your Lord, the Lord of power, for what they ascribe to Him.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Purity is to your Lord, the Lord of Honour, from all what they say.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Glory be to thy Lord, the Lord of Glory, above that they describe!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Hallowed be thine Lord, the Lord of Majesty, from that which they ascribe!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Glorified be your Lord, the Lord of Honour and Power! (He is free) from what they attribute unto Him!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Exalted be your Lord, the Lord of Glory, beyond their allegations.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Exalted be your Lord, the Lord of Glory, above what they attribute to Him,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Glorified be your Lord, the Lord of Al-`Izzah! (He is free) from what they attribute unto Him!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Glorified be thy Lord, the Lord of Majesty, from that which they attribute (unto Him)

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Clear is your Lord, the Lord of Might, of whatever they allege [concerning Him].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Exaltations be to your Lord, the Lord of Might, above that they describe!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Exalted is your Lord, the Lord of might, above what they describe.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Your Lord, the Lord of Honor, is too exalted to be considered as they describe Him.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Glory be to your Lord, the Lord of Honor, above what they describe.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Subhana rabbika rabbi alAAizzati AAamma yasifoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Glory be to your Lord: the Lord of Glory is far above what they attribute to Him.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Glory to thy Lord, the Lord of Honour and Power! (He is free) from what they ascribe (to Him)!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و سلام بر پیامبران

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: سلام بر پيامبران،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و سلام بر فرستادگان

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و درود بر فرستادگان!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و سلام و تحیت الهی بر رسولان گرامی او باد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: درود بر پیغمبران! [[«سَلامٌ ...»: در این سوره بر بسیاری از پیغمبران، جداگانه درود فرستاده شده است (نگا: 109 و 130). خدا در اینجا به گونه جمع‌بندی بر همه پیغمبران درود فرستاده و جملگی ایشان را مورد لطف و مرحمت قرار داده است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و درود بر پیامبران باد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و سلام بر رسولان!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و سلامی بر فرستادگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و سلام بر فرستادگان

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و سلامی بر تمامی فرستادگان‌(مان)!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So peace be on the messengers,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And peace is upon the Noble Messengers.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And peace be upon the Envoys;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And peace be Unto the sent ones.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And peace be on the Messengers!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And peace be upon the messengers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and peace be upon the Messengers,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And Salam (peace!) be on the Messengers!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And peace be unto those sent (to warn).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Peace be to the apostles!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Peace be on the Messengers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And peace upon the messengers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Peace be with the Messengers (of God).

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And peace be on the apostles.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wasalamun AAala almursaleena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Peace be upon the Messengers

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And Peace on the messengers!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و همه ستایش ها ویژه خداست که پروردگار جهانیان است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و حمد از آن پروردگار جهانيان است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و ستايش، ويژه‌ى خداوند، پروردگار جهانيان است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و ستايش، ويژه خدا، پروردگار جهانهاست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ستایش مخصوص خداست که آفریننده جهان‌ها و جهانیان است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ستایش، یزدان را سزا است که خداوندگار جهانیان است. [[«الْحَمْدُ لِلّهِ ...»: (نگا: فاتحه / 2).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و سپاس خداوند را که پروردگار جهانیان است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: حمد و ستایش مخصوص خداوندی است که پروردگار جهانیان است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و سپاس خدای را بر پروردگار جهانیان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و سپاس و ستايش خداى راست، پروردگار جهانيان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و تمامی ستایش ویژه‌ی خدای جهانیان است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And all praise to God, the Lord of all the worlds.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And all praise is to Allah, the Lord Of The Creation.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and praise belongs to God, the Lord of all Being.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And all praise Unto Allah the Lord of the worlds.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And all the praise and thanks be to Allah, Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And praise be to God, the Lord of the Worlds.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and all praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Universe.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And all the praises and thanks be to Allah, Lord of all that exists.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And praise be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: All praise belongs to Allah, Lord of all the worlds.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And praise belongs to Allah, Lord of the Worlds.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It is only God, the Lord of the Universe, who deserves all praise.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And all praise is due to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waalhamdu lillahi rabbi alAAalameena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and praise be to God, the Lord of all the Worlds.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And Praise to Allah, the Lord and Cherisher of the Worlds.
